text: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for the weekend and decided to have some oysters at AquaKnox before Valentine's Day dinner.  This was our second time dining at this restaurant.  The first time was okay but overpriced.  We ordered a dozen oysters at the bar.  The oysters came out quickly and my husband was about to eat the first when both of us noted something black squirming in the oyster.  Upon closer inspection it was a black worm about a centimeter long.  It was moving very quickly so we called over the bartender to show him.  He did see it and took the oyster and quickly threw it away and left the rest of the oysters.  We let him know that we did not want the rest of the oysters and he then took them away.  He left the bar area for a few minutes (probably to let someone know what happened).  Upon his return, no apology, just asked if we wanted something else.  We didn't.  It probably took us about 15 minutes to finish our drinks.  During that time no apology from anyone at the restaurant.  On our way out I asked to see the manager to let him know what happened and he smiled and said he already knew.  We let him know that we at least expected an apology and he said that the bartender should have apologized.  He went over to the bartender and said something to him.  The bartender got irate and said first to us "what do you want me to do, I didn't charge you for the oysters".  He then said to his manager that he apologized 3 times.  A complete fabrication.  Not sure if I'm eating raw oysters anymore, but what I can say is that we will never return to AquaKnox.

Had the crab legs, tomato salad and the sea bass.  The crab legs were good because they were pre-cracked.  The sea bass was served with the head and tail.  It is not Chilean sea bass and was not that great.  

The service was really really slow.  We had a large group, 16 people, but it took over three hours.  The seats are really formal and the wait staff could not reach over the seats to get or pick up food, so they hit my chair every time.  

There are plenty of other restaurants in Vegas that are much better.

Buyer's and Eater's Remorse!!!

The Good
Five Stars for the service - The service was impeccable! We have had, as good, but never better service in over thirty years eating in fine dining restaurants.

Five stars for my wife's dinner - My wife had the Georges Bank Scallops. She always orders scallops if they are on the menu. She said they were perfectly cooked and the accompanying sides were as tasty as those she had at Roy's and the SW Steakhouse in the Wynn.   

The Bad
Two stars for ambiance - They crammed as many tables and chairs into the space as possible. I am not a large person and I barely had enough room to move my chair back to get in and out. The tables and chairs on each side of the walkways to allow diners into and out of the restaurant and the wait staff room to get around the restaurant were very close to each other. I could have easily leaned over and touch the chair next to me across the walkway. The music was too loud for a fine dining restaurant.

Two stars for my dinner. I had the AquaKnox Fish Soup. The John Dory was overcooked, one of the clams and one of the oysters were no bigger than the nail on my little finger and the lobster was overcooked and very tiny. I have had perfectly cooked and a much larger lobster tails in a similar dish at Roy's and even Red Lobster! A real shame because the broth was to die for.

Two stars for menu variety and creativity - I had a very difficult time finding a starter to go with my Fish Soup. Almost every starter contained some element in the Fish Soup so I just ordered the boring Romaine Salad and my wife did the same. The menu is uninspired and insipid. The appetizer "Special" was steamed crab legs with drawn butter. I wonder how long it took them to develop that dish! Anyone can buy crab legs from the grocery store, warm them and melt butter on the side. When we go out to eat in a fine dining restaurant we expect the only problem with the menu to be too many interesting and enticing choices, not too few! Check out the online menus for the Chart House and Roy's, both upscale seafood restaurants also in Las Vegas, for examples of truly inspired and creative offerings.

The Bottom Line
Two stars for a disappointing experience and a case of "Buyer's and Eater's Remorse"! If you are a local in Las Vegas, much better choices are The Chart House in the Golden Nugget and Roy's - a short eight minute drive to Flamingo Road from the Venetian. Either restaurant has far more convenient valet or self parking.   If you are from out of town and without a car, the extra expense for a cab ride to either restaurant is advised.

Amazing, 5 star experience. What can I say, the Oysters were excellent, I never expected seafood would be so good anywhere in a desert location, but it was.  The wine the Expert recommend was very good! I wish I could remember the cocktail waitresses name, but she was fantastic and funny, such a people person.  All I all it was terriffic, ambiance was also very nice.  Highly recommended.

This is one where you really want to like the place as the service was super and the atmosphere was nice... but the food.. was a 2 - meh, I've had better...  overall 3-stars because the service was 5-star but we came for the food... I just don't have the energy to go into more about this place - cuz well... meh...
Reservation is very flexible. Very pricey food; though fish is fresh. Slow service. Restaurant serves bread sticks with a small plate of dip rather than real bread with butter.

The AquaKnox is located in the Venetian area.  We had a party of three.  The first thing we noticed was that the waiters work in a pair, which was interesting.  We ordered a bottle of wine recommended by our waiters, which worked well with the food and was decently priced.  We started off with an amuse bouche, which was basically a bite sized caprese salad, which was delicious, but not particularly all that creative.  We split the platter as an appetizer, which was a ridiculous amount of food.  Had we had just the platter and dessert, all of us would have left happy and full.  There were oysters, crab, mussels, shrimp, lobster, oyster shooters, and we got the other crab upsell.  I would say that the shrimp ceviche was really disappointing as the shrimp was rubbery and there wasn't a lot of flavor.  The stone crab however was delicious.  I got the lobster stuffed with crab and holy crap was that a huge lobster -- at least a 2.5 pounder.  Next time, I'm definitely going to ask how big it is.  It however didn't go to waste as I just took it home and ate it as lunch the next day (as an aside: I asked them to crack everything and they told me they did.  The claws were kinda cracked, but kinda half assed so I had to leave a lot of meat in the claw because I couldn't get to it at work).  My father had the prawns which were tasty and my husband had the yellowfin which was also delicious.  I'm not really sure if the dining experience really merited the price, but the seafood was definitely very fresh.  I guess I felt they relied very heavily on the top quality nature of their seafood instead of any real creativity in the cooking and flavoring.  Oherwise, as top notch of a dining experience that you can get in Vegas.

Excellent seafood collection with even better customer service.  I have had several items but my favorite has to me Alaskan king crab cakes and Japannese Bass Barramundi and chocolate souffl√© cake.  You can top it off with their wonderful cappuccino or better yet a home made chocolate chip cookie with raspberry cream.

I definitely do not like seafood but according to my friends they enjoyed it. What I really enjoyed was the nice atmosphere this place had. Sat at the bar and had a few beers. The Bartender which I did not get her name was on her game. Very busy and she managed to take care of me and my guest. Keep it up

Best seafood that I've ever had in Las Vegas & probably on of the best seafood places that I've ever eaten in my life. 

The service was seamless & just flowed very nicely. Everyone was very cordial & polite, as well as hilarious & earthy. Our server kept us entertained the entire evening. 

The food was impeccable! First they start you out with a salmon pate type thing & breadsticks. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Then we ordered a lobster bisque, which very silky & flavorful- THE GREATEST LOBSTER BISQUE EVER! After that we had a seafood platter of oysters on the half shell, prawns, lobster, ceviche & shooters- really a great deal for $80, serving 2 people. Our main courses were so delicious, we had to conquer them- despite how full we were from the previous courses. I got the John Dory which was server recommended & I am so happy I listened. Very versatile piece of fish; crunchy, savory, sweet. It was served over a lobster succatash, who doesn't like their food being served over lobster?! Last, but certainly not least- DESSERT! We got the Apple Tarte Tatin- caramelly apples with salted caramel ice cream, count me in!

I would give AquaKnox 10 stars if I could- everything was so wonderful & so was everyone. My girlfriend & I can't wait to go back & try everything on the menu.

Very good sushi but not the best.. the presentation and the scenery makes this place more that it could be.. The crab cakes are amazing and the grilled ahi tuna is beautifully presented and very good.

This place hands down has given me the best meal I have ever had. The crab stuffed lobster was incomparable. The service was perfect and even the bartender added to the evening with perfect martinis. 

Like another yelper, I was concerned that I was able to get reservations within a few hours unlike some of the other restaurants I tried before here, but thank goodness for that. I have a new "must go" on my Vegas trip itinerary.

While the food is generally good, it's very expensive and should be cooked to perfection.  Last time I ate here the food was over cooked and rubbery.  My water class had a film on it.  The servers were great but they constantly were rushing us to order.  The food came out within minutes of ordering and was overlooked and not very warm.  This makes me wonder if it's pre prepared.   At these prices that is unforgivable.  If you're looking for a leisurely meal stay away from here.   The appetizers were the best part of the meal, hence the three stars.  This may be my last trip here.

We were happy with dinner here. For the price point here we found this to be the best value of other options in this range. Staff was helpful and not over pushy, upselling was not to the extent we have found at other places.

Seafood soup was awsome. 

very nice dining experence here
All I have to say is try the oyster shooters and John Dory.  One of my favorite places to dine in Vegas.  Service is always great.  Food is better.

I had the "butterfish", which was pretty good, but had a weird consistency that I wasn't crazy about. I remember the flavor being good, and all that accompanied it, and that the party I was with seemed quite taken with their selections. I recall that someone ordered some kind of steak and they were out, which I thought was kind of weak. Also, I had to order my second drink (cocktail) like 3 times over 30 minutes before they finally brought it out, so that was disappointing.

Took my boyfriend here for his birthday. It was our first time here and we loved it. The service was the best I've had In a while. The food was fantastic! Beautiful atmosphere! They even brought out a little birthday dessert with two shots. Highly recommend!

if you're a seafood restaurant and manage to botch up a raw seafood platter, something is very very wrong. half the food on ice just did not impress not to mention the ridiculous prices they charged for it. decor was gorgeous though, don't get me wrong...but if you're looking for fresh seafood go somewhere else. this place is a total rip off.

Just had drinks here.....

Beautiful, beautiful restaurant tucked away out of the way in the Venetian (like Bouchon where you aren't amidst the hussle and bussle).  The signature martini with blue raspberry is unbelievable.  The bar service was ok, a little short and unfriendly.  I would recommend Aquaknox for a chill spot to grab a drink or two.
Awesome place! Me and my girl went here for Valentines day and wow!! The service and the food was amazing! I recommend anyone going there to try the stuffed crab Maine lobster.

I ate at this restaurant with a group of 12 people while we were on a business trip.  The decor was beautiful, and the service was good.  At the end of the night, we asked the server to split our tickets.  We were reimbursed by showing the company our individual receipts. (sucks)  However, the server told us that he can't split the tickets for us.  So, one person had to pay for everything, and the other people would pay to that particular person.  This was very annoying because we each had to make a copy of the receipt, and initial our names by what we ordered.  This whole process took a long time, and a couple of people sitting next to us started to make condescending comments toward us.  For example, they said to us,"If you don't have any money, then don't eat at this fancy restaurant."  I thought to myself, "what a bunch of idiots!  They had no idea what we were doing and what we were annoyed about.  At the end of the night, I left the restaurant with a bad taste in my mouth. 

If you are eating with a group of 4 or more, and you have to split the tickets for reimbursement.  Don't go to this restaurant.

Phenomenal!!!

I cannot believe what a wonderful experience we had at AquaKnocks.  Our server Luke was extremely knowledgeable and attentive and we knew we in for a treat the moment we tasted the lobster bisque.  The next course was the shrimp and crab salad followed by the scallops entree.  Our entire meal was incredible. This is the best seafood I have had in Vegas.

Two thumbs up.!!!

What what only 3.5 stars for this place?!?! Blasphemy!!!

This place was definitely one of the highlights of my weekend Vegas trip with the boyfriend.  Actually, it's one of the best fine dining experience that I've ever had!!! The food was absolutely AMAZING and the service was excellent !! 

Upon arriving at the restaurant, we were promptly seated at the booths, and I'm glad we were, because the area's really quite romantic. The decor is just beautiful and the whole vibe of the restaurant was just great. Lovee the blue drapes that were hanging down from above. 

After placing our order, the waitress brought out a vase of breadsticks, along with smoked salmon sauce. The smoked salmon was really, really delicious. After finishing the breadsticks I just  had to finish the rest of the salmon. yummy. 

We ordered the seafood plateau ($80), an appetizer  consisting of shrimp, raw clams, 6 raw oysters, oyster shooters, and lobster. ALL of the items were extremely fresh and delicious, especially the oysters, the clams, and the lobster. I also like the fact that the cocktail sauce had horseradish in it to give the overall thing an extra kick. Delicious. After the slowly enjoying each and every item on the plate, we were pretty happy and satisfied with the meal, but the best was yet to come!

Next came the house salad ($11). It's a nice and simple dish that was arranged quite nicely on the plates.and was quite refreshing to have after the seafood appetizer.  

As an entree, we had the surf and turf, which was split between the two of us. I was quite surprised at how much food they gave us. We each had our own little steak (4 oz or a maybe little more?) and lobster (bf got the tail and I the claws). I must say... the steak's probably the second best I've ever had [after the bf's. but his steak can't be beat ;) Tender AND flavorful!!!  ] . The meat was nicely seasoned and just melted in our mouths. The lobster was equally amazing, if not better than the steak ! I thought that it was nice that they brought out a nice little contraption that kept the butter warm for us. But yes. The food was just sooo good...  and I was sooo happy when I was eating the entree haha. (We also ordered champagne, so that probably contributed to my overly happy state at the time as well. Oh, wine bottles are half off on Sunday! )

After the meal, we were pretty darn satisfied, so we didn't order dessert. They brought us some little butter cookies, and I thought that was a nice gesture from them. 

The food's definitely not wallet friendly (total came out to 250, exc tax), but it's definitely something you need to try at least once when you're in Vegas. I will be back !!!! hopefully. After I do some gambling and make more moneys =)

Pictures uploaded!

You know the saying, "Reach for the stars!" or "Shoot over the moon!" Well, this restaurant has definitely shot farther than the stars and moon!

I had the most fabulous and relaxing experience. I said experience. It wasn't just how flavorful and fresh the seafood was. I'm from Hawaii and we have the one of the best seafood dishes here, however this restaurant (and awesome chef) truly created a beautiful and orgasimic-euphoric dish. 

PROS:
1. Surf and turf. The stuffed lobster was perfect! I rarely eat steak because it doesn't taste appealing. BUT this was so amazing and I understood why people love steak! Haha. 

2. The seafood stew-cipionnio was the best ever broth. The seafood was bountiful and tender. I ordered it without the couscous. 

3. Most of all, the server was personable, but professional. He was so accommodating and respected our space as we took our time, laughed, and enjoyed the whole experience. The waters were always filled. The wait staff was smiling, friendly, and very attentive. 

4. Make a reservation for around 5:30pm. Why? Most kitchens are ready and eager to start cooking. Anytime after 6:30pm, usually kitchens are slammed. The noise level was quiet and we weren't rushed. 

You will enJOY your experience! I'm definitely coming back here when I visit Vegas!

My husband and I went to Aqua Knox as part of Las Vegas Restaurant Week.  Amazing restaurant-the service was impeccable.  Food outstanding.

We sampled both salads and both deserts offered-all were unique and very tasty. I had the Halibut which was cooked to perfection-moist and flaky.  My husband had the signature dish the Aqua Knox fish soup.  It was a delicious broth with a little spice, a little saffron and tons of shellfish..  Truly delicious.

The chef also presented us a tuna tartar appetizer and a pineapple/mango shooter with cupcake after desert.  A special offering for restaurant week.

All in all-excellent fresh seafood, service and dining experience.

This was our first time at AquaKnox.  It was first class all the way.  Jesse was our waiter; he did a fantastic job, as did the sommelier (a woman whose name escapes me right now).  The entire staff was fantastic.

I was told by a friend that this was the place to go when I had something special planned for the wife and he was right!!! We asked for a booth and the young lady had no problem giving it to us also They have an amazing staff the waiter was friendly I felt I could ask him anything about the wine and food and that didn't stop I know my wife can be picky sometimes so when she kept asking the young lady that served us our food for specific items the young lady was very nice about it .I feel like most restaurants won't do that and don't get me started on the food it was delicious everything tasted amazing try the surf and turf its to die for!! I enjoyed the quality of the food if you want a romantic dinner for 2 then this is the place to go!! I will be recommending this place to friends and family as well!!

Dined here once.  Nothing stood out enough for me to remember other than the seafood platter, but who can screw up a cold seafood platter at this price point?  I'd rather chow down @ The Oyster Bar for my raw seafood fix.

Way overrated and overpriced. I had the scallops and lobster bisque for dinner. We also ordered 3 appetizers - crab cakes, king crab legs and the seafood trio. The seafood trio was pretty bad - terrible sauces that just made the seafood taste funky. The crab in the trio tasted bad to me or else the sauce just made it taste fishy and off. I didn't enjoy a single dish, so that's pretty bad. The service was fine but I didn't really care for the waiter. Definitely would not return. For 3 people it was over a $300 bill. Should've spent it gambling instead.

Girlfriends weekend out with a small group.  We often stop at AquaKnox for drinks and apps, but this time had full dinner, and it was great.

The wine service was helpful, we quizzed her about what would go well with our dining options (and of course everyone ordered something different, ranging from Ribeye to Halibut), we ended up with a really nice Pinot from Oregon.

Girlfriend had the seared scallops, and they were perfect.  I had the halibut and it was also cooked to perfection.  Our meat eating friend got the special of the night, I think it was lamb shank.  Too big for her (she is tiny) but she enjoyed what she did consume.  Another friend got the Ahi, and the chef really shows creativity with that dish.  For the table we ordered the pomme frietes and veggies, shared and loved by all.

On a previous occasion we went with another couple, who both ordered the lobster (crab stuffed) and it was a very generous portion, suitable for sharing.

Highly recommend, especially if you have a show nearby (we didn't but we love the Palazzo and the Venetian and "restaurant row" between them).

Have been many times over years.  Recent trip, noticed service is still attentive, atmosphere is still nice; food has gone one step backward.

Had my usual lobster stuffed with crab meat; lobster much smaller than times past and price higher than times past.  Also had lobster bisque; it was just ok this time compared to times past.  This would have been my sixth or seventh time here in last few years, ordering the same; so I could compare to my previous experiences.

Better places for seafood in vegas with better prices!

I only had a late night snack at the bar, crabcakes and wine. The crabcake app was excellent, the best crabcake I've ever had, and most expensive at 18 or so. It had virtually no filler, was cooked perfectly crispy on the outside, had nicely separate flavors from the greens garnish to the diced veggies underneath and the amazinng citrus aioli. 2 of them were small but filling enough for an app. 

Also had a chard by the glass from whatever was available on the limited menu for wine by glass and it too was excellent and would have paired well with many foods. 

My server at the bar was a little rushed, hasty, and seemed like she couldn't be bothered with a customer at first, but then she warmed up. 

Mixed reviews would turn me off to a full on dinner here but if you start off with the crabcakes you'll like that part.

Waterfalls and fountains, aqua and white, ultra chic and modern, fish and shellfish. This serene, and comfortable restaurant is sandwiched between many other fine dining restaurants, from French (Pinot Brasserie), whimsical and creative American cuisine (David Burke), to Emeril (Delmonico Steakhouse). Their prized seafood, flown in daily, is 80% of the dinner menu, also, boasts an expansive, wine list. The menu includes signature dishes, such as, the seafood plateau (enough for two).  The plateau includes, 3 mussels, 3 clams, 3 prawns, 2 crab claws, 6 oysters on a half shell, 2 oyster ponzu shooters, and a small dish of shrimp ceviche (side note: massive dish, prawns were shrimp, ponzu shooters were too sweet and might be a lil on the spicy side for the general public). The presentations of the John Dory with lobster stuccotash and sweet corn broth and Jumbo Louisana Prawns on a bed of curried forbidden black rice were aesthetically appealing, but a tad under-seasoned. Again, very fresh seafood. Dessert; Pear Frangipane with Vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce, garnished with a pear chip and a Mint Chocolate Cake with mint ice cream and a chocolate sauce, garnished with chocolate flutes, once again, aesthetically pleasing, although, the ice cream somewhere other than on top of the cake. The service was a roller coaster. Our server, somewhat disappeared and another server/food runner took over and saved her. Otherwise, a great dining experience.
Casino parking.
Food: 7 Service: 7 Cost: $65/person
3 1/2 Stars

I've had the pleasure of dining at AquaKnox twice, and both experiences were outstanding. From the food, to the ambiance, to the service, AquaKnox does an excellent job at creating a memorable dining experience.

Here are a few of the dishes i highly recommend:

To start, I would definitely order the seafood trio. It consists of shrimp cocktail, Maine lobster cocktail, and blue crab cocktail with the house mustard sauce.  All three were delicious, but the blue crab was AMAZING! It was juicy & full of flavor. I would return just to have that crab! We also had a pot of clams (I can't remember the actual name of the dish) which was equally as delicious and flavorful.

As entrees we had the filet mignon and the John Dory. Again, both were great, but the John Dory was seriously superb. I'm usually a Chilean sea bass type of person, but I was pleasantly surprised by its great flavor. It was cooked to perfection - tender and juicy. This will definitely be my entree of choice if I get the chance to dine here again.

We did have dessert, which was very tasty, but I'm since not huge on dessert, many of them taste similar to me and thus don't really stand out. I will say, however, that their banana cake is probably the best I've ever had.

So, would I return? YES! Do I highly recommend? YES! In addition to excellent food, the staff was extremely friendly, not pretentious, and very knowledgable. If you're in Vegas and in the mood for seafood, you really need to give this place a try.

I've been this place yesterday with my family.
Someone was always smile to us and really friendly, so we were having a really good time by her favor.
We were three and I felt stomachache, and my aunt wasn't that hungry, so we order three and shared the dishes.
But suddenly the old man came to our table (seems like manager), he just took out our folks and knives and plates by saying that "you guys are done, right?" and he only left my spoon.
He seems that because we ordered dishes small amount, he was being freaking ruuuuude.

I really didn't want to give him tip, but our waitress was really nice so we gave her tip.
I hope it doesn't go to him...
Have eaten here several times and the food is always great.  get the blue cheese salad(if you like blue cheese)  Something to eat for everyone

This place definitely rates 4 or 5 for design and ambiance.  The ocean inspired deep blue motif is calming and assuring.  This review is actually just for the bar which I visited twice on last weeks trip, but I did have the pleasure to dine with Aquaknox this time last year.

I'm actually allergic to fin-fish (swimming fish as opposed to shell fish) so I'm probably not the guy to write a dining review.  The bar service is great and our waitress was spicy, friendly and on the ball.  There was definitely energy in the area but it was not too loud and at one point someone in our party got a little rowdy and other guests noticed/.  Not bad, just a sign that you can carry on a civilized conversation without straining your voice.

My recollections of last years meal are positive and the service at the bar this year was exceptional enough that I would definitely recommend this establishment whether you are on vacation with loved ones or friends; or on your way back from walking the Sands Expo floor with clients or co-workers.

Cheers Aquaknox - to a great experience!

Wow what a awesome place to dine! Me and my girlfriend came here on a date a few weeks ago and we both have been to many fine dinning seafood and haven't had a better experience then this! Food was ON POINT!!! And the service was amazing! My girlfriend had some questions (usually way more then anyone can hangle) and a guy named Andrew.H could tell you anything you ever wanted to know about the food!!! 5 stars you guys ROCK!!!!

I had lunch here while at a conference. It didn't appear to be one of the more popular restaurants as it was relatively emply on a Wednesday afternoon. Opted for a shrimp and scallop cerviche which was wel priced and delicious!

I had just arrived to spend three nights at the Palazoo and decided to try this place because it was restaurant week. The complimentary bread was very hard, day old bread? Probably the worst bread I have ever had a restaurant. Wait..the food got a lot better after that. 

I tried the peach, tomoate and mozzarella salad. The cheese was the softest mozzarella I have ever had, very creamy consistency. The gave just enough for the salad. The salad was different beacuse of the peaches. I think I would have liked it more if it had been more traditional without the peaches though.

My date had the lobster bisque. There was hardly any lobster bits in it, but the soup had a nice flavor.

For the main course, I had the rib cap steak. It was a smaller cut, 8oz. It was served with crispy thin onion rings, mashed potatoes and a sauce. I really liked eating the steak with the onion. The steak was really prepared and very tender. I had asked for medium rare and my date had asked his steak to be medium. They brought out bought at medium. The did quickly replace mine though. I figured they must have had another medium rare one that had just been completed?

For dessert we had the Belgian Chocolate Smores. The dessert is very rich, I could only eat half of it. The marshmellows were made of a paste instead of an actually marshmellow, which I think would have worked better. The paste was pretty firm. 

The service was nice, there s a waiter and a food runner/water replinsher that helped alot. We say him way more than our waiter. The chef and manager both stopped by briefly to ask how things were.

Overall, we had a good experience. I don't think I will be back as there are many other restaurants in Vegas that I would like to try. If you want steak you must go to Gordon Ramsey's STEAK in the Paris hotel!!

Excellent food and our server was great.  I gave  this place 4 stars due to the fact that we had to wait longer than normal for our crab leg appetizer to arrive at our table.  Our. Server even apologized for the wait.  
Hot crab legs were amazing!  The surf and turf was huge and the barramundi fish that I had was fabulous! Very pricy, but if you want a guaranteed delicious meal for a special occasion, eat here!

Dined here with a large group during Labor day weekend.  We made the reservations Saturday afternoon and they were able to accomodate us, for that night, so I was hesitant about this place.  Labor day weekend, Saturday night, and not booked? what gives? 

Well I was pleasantly surprised.  The place is unassuming from outside (located in the Venetian) but inside is tastefully decorated.  I loved all the soothing blue colors they used throughout. 

We were seated promptly and our server was stellar.  You could tell he was experienced and swiftly took our drink orders.  I heard him make some suggestions for wine as well as signature dishes to try.  

I decided to splurge on myself and ordered the crab stuffed lobster.  Now I've had lobster at chain restaurants, as well as fine dining establishments, but the lobster they brought out was the biggest I'd ever seen.  It was sliced in half exposing all of the wonderful meat, crab stuffing and served with drawn butter.  It was pure indulgence.  

The lobster was tender and sweet and the crab stuffing was savory and flavored well.  And then, dunking it all into the melted butter! It  was  too much for my taste buds! Needless to say, I was glad I decided to splurge because it was a well spent $70.  Oh yeah, there were vegetables served on the side, but clearly the lobster was the star.  

I did hear a few comments about the roasted chicken being too salty but overall, I think everyone else enjoyed their meals.  Honestly, I was too busy enjoying my lobster to even care.

I went here with my husband and we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  We split the romaine salad and the aquaknox plateau and each got our own dessert and it was the perfect amount of food.  The salad had great flavors.  The real star of the dinner was the plateau.  It was full of delicious fresh oysters, shrimp, crab legs, lobster, mussels, and ceviche.  The atmosphere was nice and the service was good.  We would definitely return.

This would have to be one of the Nicest, and more expensive, places to eat around Las Vegas... Well worth it though when you're up from gambling, Great service and Relaxing Enviornment, plus Delicious and Filling dishes... My $46 NY Strip & Potatoes was the best, and was even too big to finish... Great Seafood too, so says the other people in my party...

Easily the best meal I've eaten in years. We were lucky enough to visit during restaurant week, and even luckier that aquaknox was participating. We had the lobster bisque (divine) and crab cake (also very good), followed by the salmon and prawns for the main course. And then the lemon cheesecake and banana cream pie for desert.

Now let me tell you, I HATE salmon! I was stealing as many bites from the Hubs as possible. Soooo amazing...the prawns were delicious too. I wasn't fond of the cheesecake but the banana cream pie...GET IT NOW! 

Service was friendly and warm, impeccable throughout the meal, even as we were some of the last diners. Overall amazing experience. I'll go back every trip to Vegas. 

Also I'm from San Diego where we have lots of great food, not some Podunk place where Applebee's is fine dining.

I hosted a 50 person dinner party here. Valerie, the event planner, was incredibly helpful. She walked me through the menu items, a custom menu, the wine and the whole process. This was a very important work event for me. Aquaknox nailed it! The food was great! The service was great! We went over our reservation count by 12 people and the service team was incredibly accommodating. They didn't miss a beat.

Michael, the sommelier, picked out two incredible wines for the party. In particular, the New Zealand white wine was incredible.

Andrew and Andrew helped manage the party in such a professional way. They were just awesome.

The food was ridiculously great! 

Oh and by the way, they pulled this 50+ person party off with about two hours notice.

They have my highest recommendation!

Thanks!!

I was very disappointed in the service in particular.  I was there with a group of about 12.  We arrived when there was no one in the restaurant, and our meal took almost 4 hours.  The service left a lot to be desired, and the food was just OK.  I expected much more for the price.  I would not recommend.

Not as good as we were expecting.   The fish was undercooked and swimming (get it) in sauce.  My shrimp had little shrimp legs.   On the plus side, the restaurant was comfortable and we got seated right away.
This is the first fine dining restaurant I ever went too and I go back as much as possible. I love the atmosphere and I always am impressed at the service. The food and drinks are always phenomenal.

I ate at Aquaknox last Saturdy for the first time.  I really liked the food.   We had the  Restaurant Week menu, and they didn't skimp even with the reduced price point.  My only complaint involves a policy they appear to subscribe to.  We arrived 20 minutes early for a 6 pm reservation.  The restaurant was nearly empty, and they refused to seat us until exactly 6.  They suggested we wait in the lounge, and of course order cocktails.  We would have ordered cocktails anyway, even if they had seated us right away, but I don't like to be manipulated.
Aquaknox stuffed crab lobster was awesome! The service was excellent! My servers Hilary&Miller were outstanding!

I consider myself quite a connoisseur of fine dining and I'm not easy to please when it comes to my food, but this restaurant completely blew my mind and taste buds!!! Everything was perfect!!! From appetizers to desert they delivered big time!!! Tuna tartar was more than excellent, our halibut and barramundi were cooked to utter perfection and paired with equally delicious sides. The desserts.... Let me say I came back the next day for more. If you are going to spend some money on dining, do it here, you will not regret it. A bit of downside - interior design is a bit understated but with all that great food you will not notice it.

I stopped into Aquaknox to have a drink and a bite to eat and ended up getting a little toasty drinking "Moscow Mules" which is a quite simple yet utterly delicious beverage prepared with Russian Standard Vodka, ginger beer, and fresh lime. 

After a few of those I indulged in the clams with garlic bread which was out of this world.   

Service at the bar was superb and i was extremely happy with the whole deal.  Definitely going to come back for the full shibang one day.

I don't normally write Yelp reviews, but seeing as I've been eating at Aquaknox for almost 10 years now, I am compelled! My family and I are frequent diners along the Las Vegas strip and we've had our share of fine dining (Joel Robuchon, Picasso, Le Cirque, N9NE steakhouse, Eiffel Tower, etc.) and not once has Aquaknox disappointed us! I also lived in San Francisco/Bay Area for 5 years and nothing has compared to the quality of food or service that this restaurant provides!

Aquaknox's level of service is unparalleled. With the advent of their new manager, Min, we are always being taken care of and leave satisfied beyond our heart's content. One evening, my mother had requested for a pina colada, but it was not on their menu as they did not have a blender. My mom had no problem requesting for another drink, yet Min personally ran to neighboring restaurants to find a blender. For years, this has been our go-to seafood place (not to mention our favorite restaurant) when we're looking for a fancier-than-normal-kind-of-night.

I HIGHLY recommend the following dishes:
- Steamed mussels (request for extra bread!)
- Lobster cocktail w/ citrus garlic aioli
- Sweet shrimp and lump crab salad
- Lobster bisque (you can smell its heavenly essence from across the table)
- Filet mignon / Surf n Turf
- Pacific prawns on couscous with lobster cream
- Red Snapper on truffle potato puree

If you're looking for good seafood and a good time, go to Aquaknox. You can't beat it!

Beautiful place with impeccable service. Prices were consistent with fine dining anywhere I've been, and actually not bad for Las Vegas. The fish was perfectly cooked. Wine selections and specials were superb. Surprisingly, the place was empty during a Saturday night meal--we were there 8-10pm. Best kept secret?

This review is a week overdue.  OMG!  One of the best meals I have ever had in Las Vegas.  
The ambiance, service and food were all top notch.  Our servers were Carlos and Brian.  They were so attentive and welcoming. We started with the very fresh and delicious Seafood Plateau. 2 of us ordered the Pan-Seared Barramundi, which is an Asian Sea Bass- white fish.  All the flavors were amazing and we both loved every bite!  For dessert we opted for Sticky Toffee Pudding which was just perfect after a great meal.  Can't wait to go back!

Disappointing.  I ordered the smoked fish as an appetizer.  The trout was tough and chewy, the cod was bland and tasteless, and I've had better smoked salmon out of the package from Costco.  Our waiter encouraged me to order the New Zealand Blue Nose Bass because they "had just gotten it in," but it was overcooked and had no flavor whatsoever.  The pureed potatoes that accompanied it were equally unexciting.  My boyfriend had the surf and turf, and while the lobster was good, he said he's had better elsewhere and everything else was forgettable.  The service was fine.  The best part was an amuse bouche made of salmon and cream (and dill?), served with breadsticks.  I was looking forward to eating here based on the reviews, and I really, really wanted to like it,  but it was easily one of the most disappointing meals I've ever had in Las Vegas.

This place was spectacular. From the food to the service- everything was stellar. Best experience at any restaurant in Vegas. We had Chris and his assistant(did not catch his name. Tall guy with glasses and SUPER friendly). The service was excellent. They checked on us often and we did not wait long for our food to come out. 

For appetizers we had the lobster bisque and the crab cakes. My boyfriend loved his bisque. The crab cakes are a MUST! It is served over a corn relish that compliments the crab cakes very well! For our entrees I had the scallops and he had the Baramundi. He absolutely loved the Baramundi. My scallops were pretty good also. Everything tasted super fresh. Definitely give this place a try if you are craving seafood while in Vegas!!!!

From the moment we were greeted until we payed the check, it was an outstanding experience.  The servers were knowledgeable, articulate, and very well synced with the kitchen. All the food was wonderful.  Highly recommend the seafood plateau as an appetizer.  We decided against dessert as we were quite full, so the manager stopped by with complimentary glasses of sparkling wine.  All the finishing touches made it well worth the price.  We will be going back!

We splurged on a nice meal last night and found ourselves being seated in a nice, cozy booth at Aquaknox in the Venetian. The atmosphere was very romantic and it was great being seated in a "secluded" booth. If you are dining with 2 and want a romantic table please ask for a booth. (see photo's on my profile)
The service was over the top! At least 5 different people assisted us. They made the whole dining experience fantastic. 
For starters we had the shrimp cocktail - Yummy large shrimp but hold on for the hottest, tastiest cocktail sauce around. The Seafood Trio - Nice flavors. Plus my wife had the lobster bisque - She loved it. 
The service was quick and attentive. 
For the main meal, I had the crab and shrimp linguine in a spicy red sauce. It was very good and loaded with crab and shrimp. My wife had the halibut special over lobster succotash. She loved it and I had a bite. It was the best halibut ever! 
For dessert we had the apple pie and creme brulee, both were good. We had 3 different glasses of wine with dinner. 
My only objection to this place is the over priced wine list (by the bottle) and the high prices of the entree's.

My husband and I loved this restaurant.  It was a true dining experience.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  I was even in love with the salad!  The sevice was great, the atmosphere was nice, we had an all around enjoyable evening.  We will definitely return.
Excellent food. Good service. The bill was miscalculated but everything else was fine.

My standards for Las Vegas dining are very high.   Almost every chef who is a 'somebody' has a place on the strip, so when we came to try Chef Molony's restaurant after a long day, my hopes were high.  Thankfully, he did not disappoint.  

Ambiance + Service: love the feel of this restaurant and once you are a few steps in, you forget you are in Las Vegas (a big plus in my book).  Lovely textures, comfortable lighting and friendly, informative service set this evening off on the right food.

Wine List: Solid wine list, we opted to have a bottle recommended by our server.  Well chosen and moderately priced.

Apps: The Halloumi and Watermelon is awesome (worth sharing for sure) and the Butter Lettuce & Herb salad was stellar.  We were wistfully licking the plates as they left the table.

Mains:  All of the seafood selections were great, with the Wild Barramundi winning 'best dish' of the night.  The signature John Dory was also lovely and the prawns were delightful - and the heartiest dish.  That said, if you are only getting one dish: get the Barramundi.

We passed on dessert this time, but will definitely be coming back for more deliciousness next time I find myself in LV.
Lovely ambiance and excellent service. Food was cooked to perfection and will definately be visiting again soon. Highly recommend the surf and turf ( lobster with crab and a fillet steak) amazing.

This is one of my favorite seafood restaurants in Las Vegas! Amazing service, delicious food, quality at its best!
Steamed clams, figs with goat cheese and the shrimp with couscous. Final touch of the evening is topped off with the souffl√©. 
We can never get enough of this place!!

Excellent service and food.  
We had the lobster bisque.  Great.
I had the Pawns which were wonderful.
Husband had the scallops and he was just okay with them.
Dessert was Butterscotch Bread Pudding which was excellent.
Husband had very good Cr√®me Brulee.
One of the best meals of my life. Service, food, atmosphere: all perfect.
Delicious. Ordered the Aquaknox fish soup and it was incredible -- the best cioppino that I'd ever had. Service was friendly.

Just an average seafood place with averagely high Las Vegas prices. I came here with a group of girlfriends on a Friday night and the place was dead. That's not usually a great sign but the restaurant itself is pretty and we all like seafood. I personally ordered two appetizers as an entree, the foie gras and the mussels. Most of my friends ordered the scallops and a few had other fishes.

The foie gras was quite strange. It was very tough and gamey. They should just take that one off the menu. The mussels were pretty good. A good size and the thai sauce and rice were done well.

My friends had no complaints about the scallops or fish but said it was nothing spectaulor for the price. They more had complaints about feeling rushed. Our server and the busboys were a little too pushy with trying to remove plates and bring the check. This is a nice restaurant that is practically empty, why rush us out?

Me and my wife had a lovely dinner here.. Jessie was our server who took real good care. Suggested some good food and all the servers and staff were servicing with a smile .. I would go here again though people think it's pricy but to me it's priced right and value for a fresh food. Peruvian Sea bass was the best.

Great food: very fresh seafood, tender steaks... Everything we've ordered so far is perfectly cooked and delicious! I don't understand how they can even make chicken so tasty. 
Outstanding service. 
Upscaled casual but comfortable atmosphere.
What else can I ask?
Fully redeemed !! What a turn around of service and the quality of food was exceptional. Thank you to Min for the amazing dining experience and compliments to the chef.

Strange - thought i already wrote a review on this place - but dang , i can't find it !

One of my freeloading meals - one of the few joys of the grind.

I can now say i've eaten at every restaurant at the Venetian ( though i still haven't done reviews on a few of them  - for example, Valentino - no pics, no review ! ) 

The overall impression of AquaKnox - nice.  It ain't stunning/earth-shattering, but it's solid and if i was in the seafood mood and on the northern side of the Strip  and not looking/affording over the top ( as in Bartolotta ) - this is the place to hit.

I tried the Lobster Bisque ( pic added ) 

And the whole , fresh fish of the day ( pic added ) - to be honest - i can't remember the name but i was told it had a similar taste/texture to sea bass ... and it did .  Kinda surprised that they didn't de-bone it at the table (  i think the prices justified such a service ) but it was fairly easy to separate the meat from the bones .

Surprsingly, I didn't  have dessert - a usual pleasure  again, when it's on another person's expense account - so i have no opinion on the desserts.

Again, overall, a decent place.
Amazing food! We had halibut that was to die for. Our server Jesse was wonderful as well. Everything was great! Very impressed and would recommend visiting here for your next seafood experience.
Loved it. Great food, must try the seafood platter on ice, seriously good. Had the grilled Bronzino, yum. The wait staff was excellent. Great place, good food.

I can't complain about the food.  Everything was great! They have the best Lobster bisque I have ever tried. I like the dressing of the crab claws.  The stuffing of the surf and turf was amazing!  I could ask for more with the food quality.  However, customer service was disappointing and unorganized... it took us 15 min. To get a menu and we would always have to tell the waiter twice to get what we need.

I came to visit a friend and to see Earth, Wind, and Fire...Aqua Knox was the third restaurant that we tried to get a table at.  We were very lucky that we were able to be seated right away. 
Tanya was great and our Filet mignon was better.  The entire meal was perfection, thank you for a memorable experience.

Went here with the wife and had a great time.   She had the crab stuffed lobster and I had the John Dory, which is similar to flounder.   The crab stuffed lobster was delicious and still had the lobster meat present and the crab stuffing was a great compliment to the richness is the lobster meat.   The John Dory came with lobster succotash and black truffles, which added elegance to the simple, yet delicious fish.

Yes yes yes!! Go here and go all out! 

I was taken here by a client about 5 years ago and had the BEST lobster ever. I went back tonight for the first time since and again had ... the BEST lobster ever.

Their seafood is impeccably fresh and the staff delightful. Yes, it's pricey, but I've concluded that there are two types of food in Vegas: CRAP (cheap) and REALLY good (expensive). Splurge and go for it!

I had the herb butter lettuce salad, 1/2 dozen oysters (3 diff varieties), 1/2 lobster (1 lb for $37 - they will say it's 2 lbs for $72 but ask for 1/2!), side of mashed pots, side of grilled asparagus, sorbet platter (3 big scoops of different kinds), espresso, and a 1/2 bottle of sauvignon ... everything was absolutely delightful and the crew (4 people??? Server, bus person, "extension of the kitchen??", and sommelier)  handling my table of one were top of the line service professionals.

GO HERE.

Have fun!

This place was perfect!!!

First time visiting Vegas and wasn't too sure where to eat. I was staying at The Venetian, the choice of restaurants was great however the majority seemed to be steakhouses.. I wanted to try something a little different. 

As I was walking through the Venetian mall I came across AquaKnox. It looked unusual and colourful.. the main theme based on water! 

I ordered the Pan-Seared Barramundi Filet. It was cooked to perfection. It literally melted in my mouth and the accompanying mash and vegetables were delicious! 

I was strongly recommend this restaurant for all seafood lovers! 

The service was great! The waiters recommended certain dishes and gave tasters of other parts of the menu! 

The dessert was incredible! The white chocolate bread pudding was unbelievably tasty! 

It's definitely worth the money!

My experience here was wonderful - from start to finish! We had the tuna tartar appetizer and the surf n turf with the crab stuffed lobster and the filet. Everything was absolutely incredible! And let's not forget the amazing banana cream pie (a dessert I would never normally consider), which was extremely delicious. 

The thing that made this place so above and beyond was the genuine, attentive and outstanding service from the second we walked in the door to the second we left. All of the hostesses, our servers Brad and Adrian, and the manager Melody all played an important role in making our visit to AquaKnox something to rave about! 

Next time I'm in Vegas, it'll be my first stop!

They were "open" for lunch....that means cold sandwiches and offerings from the "raw" seafood bar. Three iced teas and the "cocktail sampler" came to about 40 dollars with tip.

Service was unbelievably slow.

The seafood cocktails were about 3 oz each of shrimp(around U30) with a bit of spice, lobster and crab.  I had a hard time differentiating the two, and there was more than acceptable amount of shell in them, and not that fresh tasting either.

Would not ever eat here again.

That said, one of the hostess/greeters was stunning.  Simply one of the most lovely women I have seen anywhere, and as I left, I told her that she was too good for this place......and she is.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I have had in Las Vegas.

With high prices come high expectations and unfortunately AquaKnox did not deliver on the expectations.  The ambience was nice and modern but also BIG - Not really where I'd go for an intimate setting - The place was half empty at 7:00 pm on a Saturday Night - Not a good sign.  The Food was good possibly even very good but also very expensive - About a third overpriced compared to other similar locations.  The wine list also was quite expensive with not much under $100 a bottle (there were some though).  When a glass of wine costs 50% more then what you can get for an entire bottle at the local Walgreens - about 5X retail - Thats pricey (In my opinion wine should never be more then 2-3 X retail)  Finally, Service was good but again not great.  I don't mind paying more but as the cost goes up so do my expectations and they simply was not met.

Lively bar with blue cheese stuffed olives. I had been here before and had the raw oysters. This time was about 7:30pm on a weekday for a cocktail before dinner. Location provided great people watching because some seats look out onto the main walkway. The place is cool, open, and airy. Service was great. This is in my permanent rotation.

I'd give it 3.5 stars if possible.  

My girlfriend I came here for dinner on Monday, 6/1/15.  I had made a reservation and made note that it was our Anniversary.  The hostess even called earlier in the day to confirm the reservation and confirm that it was an anniversary and that she would make sure they did something special for us.  Nothing special every happened....so that was kinda disappointing.  

We arrived and were seated promptly in a circular booth thing which was nice.  I'll agree with some other reviews that say the decor and ambiance is a little cheesy.  It is.  It's kinda Ikea-meets-modern-asian-fusion-vibe.  Everything just looks kinda cheap.  

Anyway,  we were promptly greeted by the server (Miller) and he gave us some time to look over the menus.  When he came back he answered any questions we had.  He was very thorough and very helpful.  

Drinks:
She got some rosemary gin thing.  I got an Old Fashioned.  Both were pretty average cocktails.  Nothing Spectacular. But they were good.  

We then ordered some appetizers:
Octopus Carpacchio and Little Neck Clams.  Both were pretty darn good.  The butter sauce on the clams could be enjoyed on it's own haha.  So good.  

Ordered more drinks:
We decided to get wine this time.  As we were looking at the list, the Sommelier noticed and stopped by the provide some recommendations.  He was honest and not trying to sell the most expensive wine, he was going based upon our likes/dislikes.  We ordered a two different wines and they were great selections.  

Entrees:  
She got the Butterfish, I got a Filet.  Both were great.  The Butterfish was pretty amazing.  Texture and flavor were perfect.  

Dessert:  
Banana Cream Pie and Creme Br√ªl√©e.  They were both good desserts.  Interesting presentation on the Banana Cream Pie.  

My girl was curious about Absinthe, so the server gave her a little taste.  That was nice of him to do.  

We got the check, paid and left.  

I was kinda disappointed that there was "nothing special" for an anniversary.  Why would the hostess bother to say "we will do something special for you" if there was nothing special.  My girlfriend even asked "did you tell them it was our anniversary?" I said, "yup, but i guess they didn't want to do anything."  

Like I said, the server Miller was great and the food was pretty good.  Was just a little disappointed that they didn't help us "celebrate."
Just a regular seafood place.  Nothing special. I had the cold seafood platter. It was as expected.  Service was ok.

Seafood at its best! The combo plates we ordered (large group) caused much laughter and discussion about how to eat each item, and what was what! Service was top notch, and they rushed our order to meet our show time.

Always an enjoyable place to eat. I prefer sweet tasting cocktails that aren't too strong and at AquaKnox they're made just to my liking. 
Shrimp cocktails are delicious although I prefer only lemon on mine. Their cocktail sauce is super spicy from the horseradish and it's too overpowering for me. However, my husband loves it so it depends on your liking. 
Filet mignon is always amazing and cooked to perfection. I like my filet medium rare. Bread pudding for dessert was wonderful as well. 
Overall, dinner was pleasant. Staff is friendly and very knowledgeable. Thank you for another great dinner!

I am all about sauce.  Cooking the fish to perfection is expected, and it was perfect.  But the sauce on the halibut with the lemongrass broth was perfection.  Every bite has to be thoroughly savored as meals of this quality are few.  My date had the mesquite grilled New Zealand King salmon and was fantastic, but the halibut was world class.  

A large wine list with a wide range of prices was great, including my favorite sparkling wine, since I will no longer drink French sparkling wine (a won't call theirs by the 'C' word either), J (Jordan) sparkling wine.  I do miss Vueve Cliquot, but since they want to be jerks, J is the best California alternative.  

Vegas has the best dining and there are a lot of choices, and same have more notoriety, so if you have enjoyed the big names, the food here is a hidden gem to be tried.  I found the service rushed, but knowledgeable, accommodating, and friendly.  The staff and atmosphere are fine, but the food is so much the star I could have been seated at a picnic table and still have given this 5 stars.

Seafood platter was delicious with large variety of shell fish sized appropriately. Our sirloin steak was a bit gamey we got it medium rare. The octopus was a bit chewy. Service was mediocre at best. The bar did not carry Japanese whiskey. That might be more of a personal choice so will not let it affect the overall score. They did have great shellfish and a very large selection of wine. Kind of a cool wine cellar. If your looking for seafood and wine it's a great choice.

This is a 3.5 star review.  Aquaknox sits in the Venetian, in restaurant row.  The bar has a nice seating area, and is chill, without pretending to be a ultralounge.  The restaurant itself has nice ambiance... despite being on a main walking drag, you can be just inside the restaurant and it's not too loud, which is kind of a miracle.  The food was solid.  Again, I'd put the food at 3.5 stars. I had the blue cheese caesar, which was properly dressed, and had lots of flavor.  The tuna crudo and tartare were both very tasty, and used interesting flavors with the fish. It didn't make the fish the star, but it was tasty, and that's coming from a purist.

My husband and I stopped here for a drink and the raw bar.  The drinks were good and so were the oysters.  The service was pretty good, not the best.   I would like to come back and actually try their dinner.

Came here for Valentine's day. The service was excellent. They were very attentive and friendly. Food was amazing as well. They gave us a complementary Amuse Bouche and a cute dessert. It was perfect.

Was able to just walk in Friday night and sit down even though it was pretty crowded.  My table had the Bone in steak, lobster bisque and scallops.  The Steak was delicious, it was cooked perfectly and the sauce and potatoes with it made it taste all the better.  My favorite was the corn and polenta that was served with the scallops.  The service was friendly and very attentive. All in all dinner was a highlight of the night and I would highly recommend this place!

After a lukewarm first experience a while back, I was reluctant to try this place again. Due to a variety of factors, including a hankering for fresh oysters, Hubby and I  decided to give this place another whirl. Boy was I glad we did.

We were seated in a lovely booth with high ceiling and cascading curtains. It was a bit drafty, so we moved to the booth next door. The booths were romantic and private, compared to the other tables.  

Our servers, Mark and Zack, were attentive and approachable, not pretentious at all. Just a couple of nice guys who actually care about our dining experience. We didn't like the breadsticks but the dip they brought with it was delightful. We ordered a dozen fresh oysters, consisting of 3 varieties (Shigoku, Miyagi, and Gold Creek) and 3 sauces. They were super fresh and went down so easy with Prosecco, we ordered another dozen of the Shigoku Oysters, which were even tastier and slightly larger than Kumamoto Oysters. After two dozen superb oysters, we felt we had reached Oyster Nirvana. 

We ordered a Romaine Heart of Lettuce to share. It was a generous helping even with the split. The lettuce was crisp and the Caesar dressing was spot on.  Then Zack surprised us with two small crab cakes which was compliments of the Chef. They blew our minds away! We would definitely order those again and again.

We ordered both the Steamed Mussels and Steamed Little Neck Clams to share. The Mussels were definitely the tastier of the two, even better than the mussels at Bouchon. You could taste the freshness in each bite. My Hubby loved the mussel broth so much he practically made a meal out of dipping the crispy buttered bread into the Chardonnay Herbed Butter broth. 

By the time the Grilled Whole Branzino came, we were quite full already. It was a bit under-salted, but nothing a bit of sea salt could not fix.  Again, they split it into two nice plates for us and we devoured every last morsel. 

We were too stuffed to order dessert but my Husband did enjoy the complimentary Chocolate Truffles at the end. This wonderful experience made this place a must-stop whenever we are in town again.

Pretty disappointed all the way around.  My husband had scallops, and they were fairly bland.  I had tuna tartare which I asked if it was spicy. Server said no and then I couldn't even eat it-it was very spicy.  Server seemed more interested in football game.  We were there about 8pm on a Sunday and restaurant was fairly dead.  Not what we were expecting for a nice seafood restaurant in the Palazzo and wouldn't return.

I came here a few months ago for restaurant week. I dropped $110 for a prix fixe menu with wine pairing. 

The sommelier matched great wines with indelible food. The absinthe root beer float sticks out in my mind. That was amazing. I had a piece of everyone's food and it was great.

I must say that the wait staff was on top of their game.

Came here for our four year anniversary, was super cute and us being locals haven't dined here before. They set us up in a nice booth and our server was awesome. Started with some wine and the trio, delicious. Boyfriend had the scallops, so delicious and I had the special which was a halibut I believe for $53. Little pricey, halibut was a little dry, but the lobster corn succotash that it was paired with was phenomenal. Service and dining was great. Only problem is they brought out an anniversary dessert plate but charged us for it. But other than that definitely will be back!
I've Never had such Delicious so Fresh Seafood. Worth every cent, very satisfied :) The Chef even gave us a wonderful military discount. The service was amazing!

Came here for two birthdays, service was a bit slow =(, the food was pretty good but service definitely could have been a bit better. We also got nothing for both our birthdays (it really was both our birthdays, no lie) which I was a bit disappointed with.

We got the crabcake which was definitely amazing as an appetizer and then got Wild Alaskan Halibut, Aquaknox Fish Soup both which were pretty good I will say. The atmosphere was a bit more casual than i expected (I was in a suit and felt a bit overdressed) but overall not a bad dining experience.

I knew I was saving my very first review for a special restaurant. AquaKnox was the perfect dining experience to celebrate reconnecting with an old friend. 

The food is phenomenal but what made my experience memorable was the service. Our sommelier Scott was very knowledgable and paired each course perfectly. 

I look forward to dining here again when I go back to Las Vegas!

We definitely wanted seafood while we were in Vegas. The Venetian's Aqua Knox had some pretty good reviews. However, I had some pangs of hesitation when I saw pictures of the restaurant online. It looked sort of cold to me and I wondered how our meal would be, given that environment. But we made our reservations and were so, SO surprised at how nice the restaurant was once we got there. I don't think the pictures do it any justice. It was lovely and we were so happy we decided to try it anyway!

The service was most excellent! Friendly, informative, attentive and timely. We could not have asked for better. And, the food! We loved it! Interesting choices, wonderful flavour, creative presentations... so, SO good! We would go back there in a heartbeat. We loved it!

This was one of our best dining experiences. I totally forgot to review it, but we think of it often. We had the mussels that came with an amazing sauce and sticky rice. We both had the lobster, and it was so delicious. Quite an expensive place to eat for dinner, but the quality is excellent with great proportions. The service was some of the best we've had. 

We'll definitely make a stop here again when we're in Vegas.

All I can say is yum.  The surf and turf was the special which was offered.  The dish included filet mignon which was tender and the lobster which was also pretty good.  Not much else to the dish, but it didn't need much.  We also had an order of the seafood appetizer dish:

ceviche was great
oysters were good
clams were tough
crab claws were okay
shrimp was good

With so many fine dining options in Vegas, I was really hoping that I had made a smart choice with AquaKnox.... Due to the less than acceptable service and mediocre food (taste and portion sizes) I left feeling disappointed. Perhaps visiting Gordon Ramsay Steak a couple nights prior set the bar too high...

The highlight was getting our picture taken in the private one table wine cellar... I wouldn't choose this restaurant for a special event, like an anniversary or birthday because you likely will not get the attention you deserve.

We came here for a NYE Dinner. Service was horrendous. Horrible experience from ordering and to paying for the check. We had a heavy lunch so some of us were ordering lighter and only got soup, Miller the waiter had the audacity to say "Is that all" in a super rude tone. After waiting over an hour and fifteen minutes we finally asked the waiter what's the status. We weren't planning on spending NYE Midnight in this restaurant. The waiter kept saying two minutes, two minutes, until another 20 minutes passed. Food finally arrived, steaks were warm but plates were hot meaning they sat under the warming light. The food was NOT worth the price or the wait. Then to top it off, the waiter throws the check on the table and walks away. We will not be returning here and would not recommend it to anyone. There are far better places to spend your money at on the strip.

The bartenders were excellent, then we moved to our table where the waiter was excellent, Scott the sommelier was useless (aren't they supposed to like talking about wine?) The lobster bisque was stellar, as others have noted.  Hubs crab cake was good.  

Then the kitchen stopped cold.  Nothing came out for ages.  Waiter assured us 'soon' but it wasn't.  When we got our entrees they were good, but tarnished by the excessive wait.  I had the barramundi which had delish crispy skin but piled with pickled veg that really didn't complement the fish.

When we declined dessert, we gotta weird combo of a petit four and a mojitos hot that did not go together at all and was dropped quickly in front of us by a runner who seemed to be having a shitty night.

The restraint wasn't crowded and I can see why.  I'd hit the bar for its excellent bartenders, but skip the dining room.

Best in Sea & Land

My husband and I had the Honor of dining at Aquaknox for our 25th Wedding Anniversary Dinner!  Holy Cow!  What an experience!  We had a "Tour of the Menu" with wine paring!  I literaly floated out after dinner!  We started off with the Aquaknox Plateau for 2!  The presentation is Beautiful!  I would love to tell my favorite,  but the ENTIRE plateau was incredible, Lobster, Oysters, Prawns, Crab, Mussels, and Ponzu Oyster Shooters I was in SEAFOOD HEAVEN!  The Lobster Bisque was Perfectly Creamy, very comforting, get that warm fuzzy feeling when it slides down!  The Crab Cakes were Outstanding!  Our Filet's were cooked to perfection, just the way I love to eat it! I mean you can't ask for more!  They give it ALL UP!  The service was Stellar!  From our Server to our Somm. everything was Remarkable!  I happen to love the seating there as well, they offer the coziest booths if you are looking for a little bit more privacy while you indulge!  Very elegantly decorated and they have a most beautiful water wall on the way in!  The Venetian has done it once again, another NOT TO MISS spot in Las Vegas, Aquaknox!

Okay, I want to love this place. It's in the Venetian hotel, close to all the typical conference activities, but how can you be a high-end seafood restaurant and have fake seafood in your raw bar window. This sets the wrong tone for the entire meal. When the raw bar is fake up front (see pics) how can your trust what's going on out back?  I can't...

Elegant and exquisite restaurant. My friends and I stopped in last night for a bite to eat. Most places are about an 1 hour wait. We got into aquaknox less than 20 mins. The food was absolutely amazing! Try the poke as an appetizer and get the king salmon for your main course. Our server delivered outstanding service and did his job. Definitely will be back!

Just finished our anniversary dinner. Our main server was Miller- he was excellent at being condescending, and that's about it. My wife and I were treated like we were 16 at a prom dinner. Started with the irritation after we ordered oysters, he offered zero information about them so I asked our sever  where are they from - his reply was "I am not sure... " and then told us where he thought they might be from but was annoyed at the question. Next up drinks, my wife ordered a white wine by the glass and they have two symbols, one a half full glass another a full glass. He informed me the full one obviously meant 9 oz. I asked for the beer list and he told me about the 3 choices on draft and then said and we have a ton of bottled beers and asked what I like, and I said pilsner or on the lighter side, after an awkward pause he offered no further explanation or  choices do I asked about the bottles and said well those are Millers, bud, etc. it's hard to imagine a 4 dollar sign vegas restaurant only has bud and Miller. He then told us we need to order now because the food is made to order- we did upon his advise and we had our food within 10 min of ordering- the whole experience was 50 min total- for once we were not trying to eat fast and wanted to sit and enjoy a long meal. The last straw was when trying to order a salad, I ordered barramundi entree and he said how about a salad with that so I said sure what are my options- he plopped the menu on my plate and pointed to the salad category. In general the attitude was unappreciated from a higher end restaurant. The replacement server was excellent and we had no further dealings with Miller for the rest of the night. Food was fairly tasty but there are countless other alternatives. We have tried the next door restaurant delmonicos and Le cirque and liked both much better.

Update: the general manager of the restaurant reached out to apologize and ask for a second chance- I am impressed to the attention to postings and while I was not intending to gain anything I appreciate the offer to have my wife and return. At least they care enough to reach out.

I think we ended up trying pretty much everything because I and my loved ones are are all impulsive and gluttonous.  I was really pleased by everything.   I... can't say what is best, I took notes and after every item I ordered or stole from my dining mates I just wrote "YES!!".  

Service was good; not treat-you-like-royalty good, but no complaints at all.

We came here for my husband's birthday dinner, I made reservations a couple weeks in advance, but we didn't really need to. The plus was that they knew ahead of time that it was my husband's birthday and a late anniversary trip. So they greeted us with that in mind. It was just the two of us and we're both big seafood people. To start, he had the Steam Greenlip Mussels and I had the Lobster Bisque Soup...they were so delicious. 

We enjoyed every bite of our starters and the portions were perfect. The lobster bisque was nice and rich and creamy without being heavy. It was good enough to want to come back - and that's considering there are restaurants at every corner on the strip, and even within the Venetian. 

The Mussels were yummy. We're fans of curry so the aroma and spice were superb. To give it to you straight, they were bomb. Both appetizers were bomb. 

Our entrees consisted of the Ora King Salmon and the New Bedford Scallops. I had the scallops, so my review will be much more detailed than the salmon. The scallops come with squid ink pasta that is perfectly cooked. Initially, I wanted to devour the pasta, but slicing a piece of scallop paired perfectly. There were many different pieces to my dish and the flavors worked for me, I loved it. I couldn't finish the plate though, and ended up taking a scallop and some of the other pieces of the dish and took it back up to our hotel. My husband did not finish his either - but he did say it was delicious. I had a bite, and from what I could tell, it tasted great.

Since it was my husband's birthday they came out with a surprise complementary dessert for us. They were two macarons with a pink yougurty drink. It reminded me of the little bottles of Korean yogurt drinks. 

Yummy food. We love the Venetian and Palazzo in general so I'm sure we'll be back soon.

This was our third trip here, first was around 10 years ago. Very rushed meal took less than an hour, even though the place was only 50% full. Waiter wanted us to order wine before we decided on the food. After we ordered a glass, 2 different waiters asked us if we wanted wine.

Tuna poke app, very good taste but crackers did not work well. 8/10

Tasting trio app, great crab and lobster was so-so. Shrimp ceviche did not belong in the mix, they used to offer scallops. 6/10

Scallops main dish, very good but not perfect as in the past. 9/10

Baramundi main dish, fish was perfect with a great crust, but it was sitting on some pathetic mashed potatoes and topped with a salad. 7/10

Desserts, I had bread pudding and wife had something similar with ice cream. Very forgettable. 7/10

Wine. The waiter strongly pushed the house brands which were OK but overpriced. 5/10

Service. Very rushed, did not offer specials until I asked. Did not offer coffee or after dinner drinks to go with dessert. 7/10

This place used to be our grail for seafood, sad that they are now just another overpriced Casino restaurant.

I am from Seattle and my nose automatically goes skyward when I go to a land-locked seafood joint.  The waiter said ALL of their seafood is fresh, including the New Zealand King Salmon, which is what I ordered and it was one of the best peices of salmon I've ever had.  It tasted more like Steelhead.  The oysters, poke, and ceviche were all delicious.  They really knocked my nose down here!  Thank you :)

One of the best fine dining experiences I've had, Aquaknox is heaven for a pescaterean such as myself, the scallops melted in your mouth, the shrimp were perfectly cooked and tender. Even the garnishes and cous cous was the best I'd ever had. The smoked salmon puree (given at the start of each meal) was amazing!  I found myself forking for leftover puree once the breadsticks were out. 
The atmosphere was ethereal, like an abstract and elegant "under the sea" experience. Incredibly romantic, its definitely a place to share with someone special. The booths are a must if you're with your significant other, very private with beautiful blue drapes. 
Although the atmosphere is elegant and implies the appropriate dress code, I'd love to come there with my comfiest, stretchiest sweatpants and try everything on the menu!

Everything here was great. My scallops were cooked to perfection the pasta and veggies were a perfect accent. I don't eat oysters, but my date insisted that I share a dozen with him so I agreed and a few days later I find myself craving them. Needless to say, the oysters were very fresh and delicious. Service was quick and attentive. I have nothing bad to say about this place, except that we walked around in circles until we found it. No one at the Venetian or Palazzo gave very good directions, or maybe we were just too tipsy?

One word sums up my experience here--WOW! I tried making a reservation at this restaurant on Open Table in advance of my arrival in Vegas, but none were available. Luckily, my friend and I walked in at the time we wanted anyway and had no problems being seated. Every staff member was on point. Our two servers were gracious without being overbearing, and the sommelier gave us some great tips on what wine to order. After we placed our order, we were surprised by a complimentary starter of seafood croquettes. Then, my friend and I split the Black Garlic Caesar, which was unlike any other Caesar I've ever had. The dressing was outstanding! I ordered the AquaKnox Fish Soup as my main entree, because I had read about how amazing it was in various reviews. It completely exceeded my expectations, and I frequent a local seafood restaurant back home that I used to think had the best bouillabaisse on the planet. Just when I thought our meal couldn't get any better, we were presented with a complimentary dessert--almond cookies topped with strawberries. They were absolutely delicious! I can't wait to come back!

Fort the $$$, I've had WAAAAAY better.
Not worth your money.

Ok, here is the deal.  I've been to Aquaknox many times for drinks at the bar and its always ok.  One time the bartender didn't know how to make a Kir Royale and I had to explain it to her.  I let it slide since I thought it may not be the most popular drink even if I consider it to be standard.
