On my last trip to Vegas my friend, the birthday girl, decided to have her birthday dinner at Aquaknox.  Finally given the chance to try the cuisine, I have to admit that I was not very impressed.  The Sommelier was moderately helpful in the end but during the process of selecting a wine she continuously suggested wines that were clearly out of the price range we were looking.  (I hate when Sommeliers do that.  I'm not going for the $180 bottle of wine tonight, thanks).  In the end she was able to produce two bottles of a nice chardonnay not on the menu.  

The butter lettuce and herb salad was good, the dressing was nice and light and the salad was a good size.  The shrimp cocktail, however, was not as good.  It was literally downed in cocktail sauce.  I'm the kind of girl that likes to dip (my husband on the other hand likes to smother) and I didn't appreciate the pint of cocktail sauce on my shrimp.  (To be fair it was a good sized serving of shrimp).

Aquaknox probably would not be on the top of my list of Vegas restaurant suggestions.

Service: top-notch! My entree came out 15 minutes after my family's because the chef was not happy with how he cooked my fish. I was told by the manager that he made another portion. Manager comped the entree for me; it was swordfish  ($38).

Ambience: Beautiful setting with upscale decor. 

Food: My kids said it was the best fish stew they've ever had. I tried it and indeed it was delicious! Very fresh seafood in a saffron broth. 
My fish dish was well-balanced in flavor and the fish was cooked perfectly. 

Price: I think it is very comparable to other 5-Star hotel restaurants in Vegas. Mains are $40-$50. Fish stew was $54 (well-worth it!). Starters are $10-$20. 

Definitely coming back!

Must try the tomahawk wagyu it just melts in your mouth and the chimichurri was also a good addition to the meat. All the seafood is super fresh and our server brian was on point with all the food suggestions! Also try the bread pudding you wont be disappointed.

Customer service was excellent. Had Chris for our server and thoroughly enjoyed his recommendations. My wife and I couldn't agree on what our favorite dish was. I enjoyed the Marus King Crab and she loved the halibut with lobster mash potatoes. Everything was delicious. We even tried the Absinthe root beer float. Not a fan of the licorice taste but the presentation was awesome.
(Posted this 3/1/14, but actually dined there 2012. Stupid me, just realized that I never completed the post. My wife and I still talk about the food. 5 stars.)

Came here on our last night of our weekend Vegas getaway.  Had no reservations on a Saturday night, but we got a table nonetheless.  The hostess proceeded to sit us at a table of 6 for our party of 5.  Seeing that there were 5 settings, but 6 chairs, the gorgeous hostess reamed the help to "get their act together".  Hot and bitchy, now that's my kind of girl.

The food was decent for the most part.  Had the Seafood Plateau to start which had fresh items from the raw bar.  My entree was the fish soup, which was sort of a spin on the classic cioppino.  My friends had the scallops which were delicious.  The bill was not cheap, but not outrageous.  This place is on par with most decent seafood joints in Vegas.

Went here for my birthday dinner.  The seafood is excellent.  I ordered scallops and they were cooked to perfection, nice and buttery, melt in your mouth.  My friend ordered the whole fish and it looked amazing.  She said it tasted really good and well cooked.  
For appetizers we ordered a dozen oysters and they were amazing.  I love oysters.  It came with 3 different types of oysters so we all had 3 each.  
We didn't order any dessert but they gave me the flourless chocolate cake as it was my birthday.  It was pretty good but not amazing.  I prefer souffles myself.  The latte I ordered was tasty and it came with a biscotti on the side.  All in all we had a pretty good experience.  If you like seafood then this is the place to come as the seafood is very fresh and they know how to cook it.
Got food poisoning from the oysters here. Got clammy and sweaty during a huge conference, passed out because I was so sick, had to go to emergency room type of food poisoning.

AquaKnox, located in The Venetian Resort Hotel & Casino, is, as I am told, one of the area's premier seafood restaurants. I am not one who enjoys fish, so I perused the menu for an alternative. On that, or any menu, a steak suits me just fine. 

It is fish that I can live without, but I do like shrimp, crab and lobster. Fitting with that, I and my business travel companion shared the Seafood Trio appetizer: sweet shrimp, lobster and jumbo crab served with AquaKnox cocktail sauce. The name is rather misleading as only the shrimp comes with the cocktail sauce. Each of the three meats comes plated with its own unique sauce. Of the three, though I liked them all, the crab was my least favorite. 

I ordered their Bone-In Ribeye, though the menu online shows "Bisteca (32 oz. Prime Double Cut Porterhouse)." I cannot say if that is new to the menu or if the ribeye is instead. What I can tell you is that the competition in my search for the best steak in Las Vegas just got a little tougher. The ribeye came over root vegetables. I feel bad saying that the ribeye at AquaKnox is one of the best steaks in 'Vegas if it is not even an option anymore. I cannot speak to the porterhouse, though I would be tempted to try a "serves two" steak alone! 

The prices were not outrageous, though I had expected them to be. Most main dishes were around $30. If you need to find it, the restaurant is located outside the Blue Man Group Theatre. 

AquaKnox has not converted me to the ways of seafood, but through steak they have helped me recommend this restaurant to you. There are so many restaurants in Las Vegas I do not know if I will ever go back to AquaKnox, but it was worth going once for me. And if the situation arose, I would not hesitate to go back.

Went on September 3, 2013 for our 25th wedding anniversary.  I had the bone in ribeye and my wife had sea bass. I was suspect at first ordering steak at a seafood restaurant.  I was wrong.  The ribeye was almost the best I've ever tasted.  Maestros in Scottsdale,  AZ was the best, but this was second. The service was outstanding.  I'd highly recommend it!  Banana Cream pie was okay. Probably want to get a different dessert.

Unprofessional and snobby attitudes from the staff. No thanks.  We took our $500 tab next door to Delmonico's where the service was exemplary.  Fine dining restaurants are a dime a dozen in Vegas. This restaurant needs to hire people who understand how to treat patrons professionally.  

To upper management - if you are going to make a 9:45 reservation, don't close your kitchen at 10pm.  I'm sure your patrons would have liked a heads up when making the reservation.  I know I would have.  Also your hostess could use some training on handling patrons professionally.

Thank you Chef James DeFraga for your awesome menu for our company dinner. My steak was just fantastic.  Super tender and it was a huge portion too! Love the Ahi Tuna as well as the Arugula salad. Very light and tasty. The Coconut Panna Cotta dessert was the icing to end a wonderful evening.  Service was impeccably on point, and please thank all your staff for their excellent service.
Looooove this place! Came here for a special occasion and ordered far niente chardonnay and just went crazy with the dinner. Everything was amazing

Great spot in vegas if you are looking for a delicious seafood meal with a decent selection and enjoyable ambience.  I had the blue prawns with golden couscous and  my friend had the barramundi. Both were excellent. The specialty cocktails were quite tasty and the chef sent out complimentary dessert bites. My only complaint would be the service; the back waiter was helpful but the main server was slow, somewhat rude and  not attentive in the slightest. It was almost 10pm and there were only about 10 tables with guests and at least 8 waiters on staff  I would go back under the assumption that we happened to get the worst waiter in the place. Food was excellent and there a few other dishes I would love to try,

Perfection! Food was amazing, I got the Pacific White Prawns, delightful! My 
husband had the Baramundi which was amazing too! We had the sommelier select a bottle, he made a great selection that paired with both our dishes, good man! The service was top notch and not stuffy, the room is beautiful this is a gem in the Venetian, heck all of Las Vegas, it is sublime. We live in Vegas and often skip the strip, but Aquaknox is an experience we can't wait to repeat!

Fantastic! My sister and I recently celebrated her birthday in Las Vegas and had the pleasure of dining at Aquaknox. For appetizers she had the lobster bisque, which she had previously and said was the best she's ever had. I had the wild blue crab cake with chayote slaw and remoulade sauce which was excellent and we shared a beet salad that was out of this world.For entrees she had the Pacific blue prawns(excellent), I had a Tandoori chicken dish that doesn't appear to be on the menu any longer(excellent) and though we both skipped desert they brought us each a small cookie with a glass of hot chocolate and rum which capped things off perfectly. The service was outstanding and quick and made for a very enjoyable birthday dinner. I'm already looking forward to going back.

the lounge area is very cool, spacious.  the food is solid, seafood tasted very fresh.  it's a lot less of a 'scene' here and more reasonably priced than the other celebrity chef restaurants in and around venentian

Nice setting and we were seated in a great booth. Excellent fries as a s starter, along with nice cocktails, then downhill. My friend's sea bass was indifferent at best and my steak was literally too tough to cut. Both entrees were served on an instant potato style moosh. We split one banana cream pie which, although not a pie, sort of tasty. Service was sporadic at best.

Overall great experience at Aquaknox. Clean and fresh ambience, with cool touches such as the modern "clamshell" booths. 

A few of the cocktails on the menu were trying too hard to be unique. I started with some sort of spice-laden old fashioned which was brimming with fruit and other froo froo ingredients, but switched to a manhattan and was fine. (It was the first old fashioned my girlfriend has liked, so they were successful in making it a girly drink.) The Riesling I had with dinner was not the best either. 

But on to the food. 

We started with the raw oyster selection, which was excellent, very fresh. The Alaskan king crab leg appetizer, served chilled with a little bit of lemon and Tabasco was amazing, we should have ordered the larger portion. 

The John Dory was the highlight for me, and the scallops in a blood orange sauce were for my girlfriend. The scallops were a bit firm for me, but still very flavorful.

What clouded the experience was the idiot that was serving us.  

Not sure if it was his first week on the job, but he missed an ENTIRE course and was condescending when we asked for only ONE of the crab claws.  

Verbatim on WHY he missed the salad course:
"The order (sheet)  was all funky, so I scratched it out and wrote a new one."

YES, you read right, he said, FUNKY in a white tablecloth restaurant.  

I guess he didn't learn to COPY things in elementary school.

He didn't apologize for his screw up.  ARGH!!!!  

And WE had to give him ideas on how to alleviate HIS mistake.  He screwed up, he should fix it, and COMP something.  He suggested that we skip the course, b/c even if we heated our main courses it would compromise the quality.  OKAY....but we still want our damn salads, it takes FIVE minutes to throw a salad together, and we already waited FIVE minutes for him to notice that we didn't touch our food.  

Our main courses were already lukewarm.  God.  RECOGINIZE foolio.  

Hence, to save his dumb ass, he was on top of things for the rest of the meal, to the point of annoying.  I hate that.  

FREEBIE: Breadsticks, super yum, they were dusted with black pepper and the dip was smoked salmon pate.  FAB.  

Things to order: 
Scallops, very good, they were HUMONGOUS!!!  The combined net weight was probably more than a 10 ounce steak.  Meaty, tender & flavorful.  

To skip:
-Trio was alright, not delicate, the sauces covered up the crab, tuna, and lobster flavors.  The lobster was rubbery.
-Red snapper, bland, and tough.  DRY.  

Was the wait for the salads worth it?  Not really.  It was the Caesar and the Bibb...

The last FREEBIE.  Mmmm...they were little triangles of brownie bites with chocolate rice crisps.  So save your $$$ and don't order dessert.

We were sat in the center of the restaurant against the railing, ask for a booth, overall the ambiance was better than most of the restaurants in the Venetian and the Palazzo.
Save room for dessert. As tempting as it is to blow it all on the food (salmon that was proud to die for you) and wine. Their dessert had just as much love put into it.

What an amazing feast!!! The steamer clam appetizer.... Best I have ever had, bar none.
The fish soup....off the hook!!! An amazing assembly of massive prawns.,clams, mussels, halibut and half of sweet, succulent lobster. The broth has just the right spice and an excellent sliced French bread with a garlic, basil and butter topping to die for.

Hands down the best overall seafood meal I have ever enjoyed. If I could give it 10 stars I would!!
The amazing food is equaled by the attentive yet unobtrusive service in an appropriately quiet atmosphere. 

What an amazing establishment!!!

I went to Las Vegas for the weekend and I was craving for a good seafood restaurant.  I'm glad I chose Aquaknox. I enjoyed the decor of the restaurant with its underwater-like environment. I also saw the owner chef, Tom Moloney, walking around the dining room every once in a while. I think it was kinda refreshing considering not many of the owner celeb chefs work in their kitchens anymore. 

For my meal I chose the crab cake, lobster bisque, pan-seared grouper, and the interpretation on s'mores with peanut butter ice cream. There was an amuse of peppery bread sticks and smoked trout dip. Nothing too special but something nice to snack on at the beginning of the meal. The crab cake was good but since it was labeled "jumbo lump" you would actually see lump crab meat. I mean it was nothing but crab but the integrity of the lump was gone in the making of it. The lobster bisque itself was of total lobster essence with a few nuggets of lobster meat and a dollop of creme fraiche and caviar. The lobster was slightly chewy but, what the hell, it's lobster so I ate it with great gratification. The grouper was delicious as it was sitting on top of a bed of soba noodles, baby bok choy, and little shiitake mushrooms and all surrounded in a sea of lobster broth. The glaze on the grouper was sweet and a bite of spice from the sriracha in the glaze. Finally, the "s'mores" dessert was a chocolate mousse with graham cracker cookie bottom surrounded by milk chocolate and topped with marshamallow and accompanied with a small scoop of peanut butter ice cream. Very satisfying and a nice ending to a great meal.

Service I must say was very attentive, especially by the secondary waiter. The primary waiter who took my order was nice but was rarely seen after that. It looked like he was attending the bigger parties in his area. It was fine because the secondary waiter filled my water on time, asked me if I wanted a second helping of the smoked trout dip, asked if everything was OK with my meal, replaced my silverware at the appropriate times, and took my dessert order. So kudos to the secondary waiter.

My experience at Aquaknox was well worth it. I would definitely go back there if I had a craving for some great, fresh seafood with attentive service.

This was our first dinner during our trip to Vegas. We stayed at the Palazzo and figured we should check out what the hotel's restaurants had to offer. We were celebrating a birthday, so we did decided to go a little more high end. 
The ambiance of this restaurant is top notch- upscale and classy. Very beautiful decor, too.
Large , delicious menu with a seafood theme. 
Nice drink menu & lots of options.
Many people in our party had the Surf & Turf "Special" - nice lobster tail stuffed with a filet. Gorgeous presentation.
I had the tuna and it was phenomenal. Scallops were wonderful, too. Lobster bisque was very very nice.
I had a glass of wine - Sonoma Cutrer - for $22. 
Service was impeccable.

If you are looking for a cheap eat in Palazzo / Venetian.. keep walking. Come here if you want to splurge! Worth it! 
We had a group of 8 and they handled out party very well and efficiently. No problems.

Awful seafood. A small group of us stopped by for a quick bite of their oysters and scallops before heading to another hotel. Everything was incredibly salty and had a fishy after taste. It made us think they over-salted everything to mask the poor quality and freshness of the seafood. The waiters proceeded to say the saltiness was from the ocean, but c'mon salty to the point it made your face pucker??  They ended up comping us on the inedible items, which was nice... but definitely won't be coming back.

Great food and atmosphere. We loved the quiet round booths, away from the busyness of the Casino.

The Sea Bass was perfect!

Ok, first time ever giving a 5 star review, but wow. Simply, wow.

Wife and I wanted to discover some new foods in Vegas, so the plan was to order things I wouldn't normally order. We also expected some over-the-top service and experiences. AquaKnox delivered on all of it, hands down. Please note, we're not really foodies, but we like great flavors and food, and we know good service...

From the first moment walking into AquaKnox we knew we were seeing something orders of magnitude better than our dinner the night before (at Canaletto). The service was impeccable. We ordered our meal and the sommelier came by to offer her recommendations -- she offered a great wine for dinner that was really excellent. As one would expect in a great establishment, the wine was kept chilled near the table, and we were frequently checked on and our wine was never low...

Our dining experience began with a really great amuse-bouche, delivered with the first pour of the wine. The single bit was a nice start!  For an appetizer, I started with the squash blossom appetizer, holding true to my "I wouldn't normally order this, but what the hell" approach for this trip. Wow. It was like experience the ultimate spring garden - the baby greens, pea shoots, delicately fried squash blossoms were all incredible. Perfectly dressed.  The best appetizer I have ever had.

For an entr√©e, I chose the whole sea bass and a side of the corn succotash (with edamame). The fish was perfectly cooked and very tasty, and the skin was incredibly crispy.  I found myself rationing the skin to enjoy it with every bite. The succotash was over the top good -- clearly nothing I had had the privilege of enjoying growing up!

For desert, I had the pumpkin cheesecake -- clearly nothing I would normally have gotten. Clearly I would have been depriving myself. The ginger caramel and spiced orange ice cream was an amazing compliment to the rich pumpkin cheesecake.

The meal ended with another single bite of chocolate and a refreshing lemon vodka.

From start to finish, AquaKnox single handedly delivered what we had hoped Vegas would deliver on. The service throughout was incredible and the food was always great and mind-blowing at times (wow, that appetizer). Despite my disappointing experiences elsewhere in the Vegas dining scene, I would come back to Vegas simply to enjoy AquaKnox again.
Food was absolutely incredible and so was the service. I highly recommend the grilled octopus to start.

Wow, really good meal here during the IBM Impact conference.  The thing here is seafood, and they spare no expense.  The large seafood appetizer had a little of everything, including an awesome little oyster "shooter" that was delicious.  I had the barramundi, which was tender, fresh and totally delicious.  Our hosts made this a special occasion too; fine food is always even better when someone else picks up the tab!

My company hosted a large dinner party here And reserved the Chef Table. I worried a bit about how noisy it may be when we reserved the table but was pleasantly surprised to find it very quiet and not distracting to the conversations at the table. We ordered a four course menu offering our guest the ability to chose from three main dishes. The service and food was spectacular! We were served by 4 servers and found that they were very  prompt and professional paying close attention to drink refills and keeping the courses on track. We were never rushed and allowed to hangout and chat with our guest for as long as we required. Highly recommend for this type of event.

A solid 4.  

My stars:  (5=epic "best of") (4=really tasty and want to go again and again) (3=good and will go back once in a while) (2=fair, might return for a visit if there was some glimmer of hope) (1=avoid at all costs)

Go or No?  Go.

Tease:   Aquaknox is a seafood restaurant between the Venetian and Palazzo in Vegas.

Why I went:   My wife and I were craving a snack and drinks while waiting for friends to arrive in Vegas.

When:  11/17/12

Food:  We basically got the raw bar items and some tasty cocktails.  The crab, shrimp and oysters were all amazingly fresh and tasty!  Prices weren't outrageous, but they weren't cheap.  We felt the price matched the quality.  The cocktails were fantastic.

Service:   Excellent!  The bartender provided all for us.  He explained the cocktails as he made them, which was fun.  

Hints/Final thoughts:  Aquaknox is a chill nice seafood place in the Venetian/Palazzo.  It's worthy of a look if you're crazy some raw bar and drinks.  We really enjoyed it.  It was casual and fun.

The food here was great. Get the boulabaise and enjoy.  Im giving low marks for everything except the food here... 

The staff seemed all over the board on how well they did.  our server was great and did ensure everything was up to par, but the bartender was distracted and the rest of the staff doesn't pay attention once your inside.

My big complaint on this place:  LOUD, LOUD, LOUD and damned near pitch black dark.  

The food was GREAT.  But the music is at a 9 when a 6 would do (it was hard to talk, it was as loud as the nightclub nextdoor).  Up the lights a little bit so I can see your great tasting food.

Staying with my girlfriend at The Venetian, on our first night we decided to venture out into the restaurant row and try something for dinner. AquaKnox was the first place we came to, and we decided to just hop in and give it a shot. Wow. Could be the best restaurant we ate at the entire trip.
We were informed it would be about 5 minutes for our table to be ready, as it was pretty full, so we were sat at the bar. We were immediately helped by the bartender, and I ordered a sweet tea vodka / lemonade drink which was absolutely spectacular. The bartender was very friendly and gave us some tips on where else to eat and drink in the area, and after a few minutes we were seated at our table.
Love the atmosphere of the restaurant. Blue lights and blue drapes surround everything, giving it a very "Aqua" feeling, light music playing, and although the majority of people were dressed very well, the place had an upscale, but very relaxed atmosphere.
Our server was spectacular. Very professional and courteous, attentive, and took care of all our needs. The appetizers were unbelievable- love the smoked salmon puree given to you at the start of the meal. I had a seared tuna plate with cous cous for a main meal- un-f'n-believable. Could possibly be the greatest tasting food I've ever had. So fresh and tasty, it was perfect. There were lots of different choices as far as main course meals- you can definitely find something to eat as long as you're into seafood, that's for sure.
Overall, VERY glad we stopped into this place to eat, it definitely set the tone for the AWESOME Vegas trip we were about to have. Fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic setting, it doesn't get any better than this. If you're staying in the Venetian / Palazzo, make sure you stop here. If you're on the strip and looking for good seafood, make a point to stop in and eat. Definitely one of the best, and I WILL be back.

Spectacular staff and ambiance. 

Located in between the Venetian and palazzo.. 

A fabulous restaurant that ceased to amaze both Matt and I. 

Upon arrival, we already had existing reservations made the day off, we asked for a nice booth (they're big, round, and give more of a private area although along side of the restaurant)

As we were seated, the hostess was THE kindest and warming young lady.. that also placed my napkin on me gently and properly before handing me the menu. 

What I enjoyed a lot is the tag team servers we had. As a duo, these gentlemen gave us an unforgettable dining experience. I feel so bad for forgetting their names but I believe they were of the Filipino descent. But seriously, it's like they read each other's minds. We would request something from one guy and bam! The other guy pops up with it in literally like 2 seconds. 

Onto food....

We started with 1dz oysters - varying with 3 different kinds. And may I say it was DELISH. 

Followed by the entrees..
Scallops - ABSOLUTELY PERFECT. Deserves more than 5 stars. If the spaghetti squash or squid ink pasta mix up TJ texture along with the perfectly mixed sauce... I just don't even know. Scallops we're cooked medium rare and it was perfect. 

Matt ordered a fish, that comes (mostly) deboned paired with veggies, such as potatoes, spinach and something else. But the fish had an amazing freshness to it and a chili flavor. You can get the fish either headless or with the head (your preference) 

We also ordered a side of chef's choose of veggies which worked in our favor. We had a zucchini lightly coated with Panko crust and some cheese flavor. The combination of crunchy panko and a perfectly cooked zucchini?!? A party in our mouths. 

We had a few kamikaze shots from the bar as well and they were fresh and STRONG. 

We ended being way too full for dessert, but the chef was kind enough to have us try his peaches n cream paired with a cheesecake cookie. 

If you're craving seafood, I highly recommend this place - as clearly it is their expertise along with outstanding customer service.

Wow.  This was a meal.  The halibut with the lemongrass broth?  Are you kidding, it blew me away.   That was a dish that was thought out and was just perfection.  My buddy had the fillet, and that was just unbelieveable.  The most tender fillet i have tasted, and i get it all over the place.    I will be back for sure.

Best dinner we had during our trip to Vegas. Went there for my boyfriend's birthday and it was just PERFECT.
Starting from chef Jimmy to the sommelier and the waiters staff, everything was amazing!!!! 
We had a testing menu with wine pairing. Each dish was perfectly cooked and attentively described by our waiter. ( i truly apologize that i don t remember names, so sorry) . His assistant was a sweet girl and she was making sure the table was always clean and ready for next course. 
I can t thank them enough for the delicious food and the great service they provided us on that special occasion. 
Hope we can come back soon to Vegas to enjoy Aquaknox again.

A group of 10 of us that came here to celebrate our friends bday. Service was exquisite. They gave each and every one of us so much attention, despite us being so loud. Our server was Jesse and we would come back to ask us if we need anything else. He also ensured that we have everything we requested. Awesome services by Jesse that def made our night.

We reserved the wine tower room, which was surprisingly inexpensive but an almost surreal experience. The food and drinks were superb and the service was fantastic. Shout out to our server Jesse who was extremely attentive, answered all of our questions, and made some creative suggestions. A fantastic dining experience!

We celebrated our 35th anniversary last night with dinner at the Aqua Nox and it was out of the park! Asparagus, Crab legs, Aquaknox Plateau - Good, great, BEST! The staff, in specific Jesse and Tonya, made us feel like royalty. It was fresh, delicious, and can't wait to go back for one of our upcoming birthdays!

We recently chose Aquaknox for dinner on the night before our wedding.  The atmosphere, service, wine, and food were impeccable.   The experience was so phenomenal that we cancelled the reservations we had for our wedding dinner with another establishment because we could not imagine a better dining experience.  We came back to Aquaknox the next night after our wedding.  The staff were so great! When they found out it was our wedding celebration, they brought complimentary champagne for a toast.  It was another impeccable meal and the secluded booth was so romantic.  We ordered a cheese plate at the conclusion of our meal.  I was thrilled to see the chefs had written "Congratulations!" in chocolate on the rim of the plate.  Such a sweet and thoughtful touch.  We will be back to Aquaknox on our next trip to Vegas!

Outstanding, soup to nuts.
Service is impeccable, food is amazing, just unbeatable.
I had the surf and turf and can't recommend it enough. 
Even though Aquaknox is a seafood restaurant, the filet was hands down the best steak I have ever had. The crab stuffed lobster is amazing.
Grilled lemons to squeeze on your crab and lobster? Oh yes indeedy.

One of the  "must dine"restaurants on my itinetary.   We enjoyed the food and service.
I had oysters, which were delightfully delish!  Wanted to try the shrimp and  grits, too yummy!!! Bigger portions than expected ( that's a good thing)
My entree was a "surf and surf", yes I asked for half a crab stuffed lobster and the king crab legs.  OMG !!! It was perfect!!!  As you can imagine the service was impeccable !! Whatever your heart's desire, the staff will try to make it happened.

My girlfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day this year. It was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. The food and staff was excellent! Our servers were Miller and Chris and I would definitely recommend them if you are going here. They were very knowledgeable and made sure we were well taken care of. We will definitely be returning next time we are in Vegas.

This restaurant is located on restaurants row in the Venetian Hotel.  The lobster bisque was excellent but very scarce.  It was a tiny creamer filled with bisque.  It had a nice piece of lobster. Very nice presentation. My husband ordered king crab legs for an appetizer and the waiter came over much later and said they ran out of king crab legs.  Dinner was okay.  The dessert we ordered which was ice cream and sorbet got lost somehow.  It came 10 minutes later.  Waiting for the check was another 10 minutes.  I've eaten better dinners in New York.  Save your money, not worth it.

Amazing oysters and fantastic food! Gin martinis are to die for and service is on point, thanks to Ian! We have been in Vegas 4 days so far the most hospitable and delightful bartender yet. We will definitely return.

The best experience and the best food ever!!!
We were going to go to Cut after a whole day of playing at the craps table but opted to go here after the very nice hostess told us she could seat us right at 530. Mark and Miller were our waiters. Really? Two people to one table? Really! They were very entertaining and very knowledgeable. 

We were so happy with the presentation and the flavor of each dish! I couldn't help taking pictures of our dishes. They were just amazing!

Went with a group of 5 friends for one of their 21st birthdays.  The restaurant theme is 'global water cuisine' and the decor attempts to evoke the sea with waterfalls and aqua hued walls and ceilings.  

The meal began with an amuse of a smoked salmon mousse paired with breadsticks.  The mousse was smooth with a nice kick of horseradish and tabasco flavors.  We ordered a platter of 12 oysters for the table to start and then each ordered entrees: seared ahi tuna, scallops, and grilled whole fish.  The oysters (~$30) were the standout of the night: fresh, tender and perfectly briny, served with wedges of lemon and individually-sized bottles of Tabasco sauce.  Perfectly seared, slightly sweet scallops were served on a bed of sweet corn, mushrooms and chive-mashed potatoes.  The grilled fish was accompanied by wonderfully roasted cherry tomatoes which may have eclipsed the fish itself.  The seared ahi was technically perfectly, but the sauce was remarkably (overly?) strong and sweet.  Portion sizes were reasonable for a restaurant of this caliber and prices ran $35 - 40 per entree.  The birthday girl received, on the house, a lovely triangle of rich chocolate cake with a candle and a "happy birthday" engraved on a chocolate disk.  Finally, a small plate of complimentary rhombus-shaped chocolate squares finished the meal.

Aqua Knox also features an extensive wine list, off of which we ordered the Baileyana Chardonnay ($57), with the help of the sommelier who directed us toward our stated preference for something dry and oaky. 

Through the course of the evening we interacted with two waitresses and two sommeliers.  While all were pleasant, the upselling pressure  was immense.  We were continually directed toward wines more expensive than our preferred range and asked numerous times if we wanted to order more appetizers, salads, soups, and desserts.  Judging by our appearances (nicely dressed but very young) and our firm "no"s to all extraneous offers, I would think our price point was clear.  I'm not particularly sensitive to upselling, but the amount of marketing here was enough to leave me with unfond memories.

Overall, exquisite food but not particularly unique nor a great value (although it's hard to imagine that any of the celebrity restaurants in Vegas could be considered a great value).  A solid pick though if you're looking for exceptionally fresh (flown in daily) and well-prepared seafood.

Attended a private event here last week. OMG! Hands down... the seafood is phenomenal here at AquaKnox. It was kind of embarrassing how much I ate but when it is so fresh, nicely displayed and served with the best cocktail sauce I have ever had...well what is one to do at that point? The cocktail sauce is a little heavy on the horseradish so it has some kick. Ooweeee! This place is definitely upscale and expensive. Don't bring your kids or cheap friends here for drinks and dinner. The ambiance is romantic but hip. Located on restaurant row, you can't go wrong here when you're looking for an scale place to ha r dinner in Vegas. I will be returning to AquaKnox soon! Cheers!

Great service and convenient location within the Venetian hotel. Next to several other upscale restaurants. Primarily seafood items, but have steak or chicken options.  Dish prices range from $18-40 for most items, with a few items greater than this due to their specialty (e.g. Lobster, filet mignon, etc. ). Decent selection of cocktails and basic beers. If you prefer a variety of beers, then next door Public House is a better option.

AquaKnox is noteworthy aqua scooby snacks at its finest. Here's my 6-course tasting journey diary.

5th of all, 
I'm starting with dessert at the end. Imagine a tasting for every dish. My party of 3 enjoyed this ridiculous tasting of 9 gourmet ice cream flavors in its own. Some of which were the traditional, vanilla bean and mango passion, and then the untraditional- Thai iced tea, guiness, lychee, butterscotch. Chef from kitchen had fun by allowing us to guess flavors, and later coming out at the end to see what we came up with.

4th of all, for the steak lovers,
Glazed with green peppercorn sauce, the Prime ribeye(calf), folded to be seasoned inside and out. seared filet style for texture and juiciness sprinkled with Saba beans and baby carrots on a bed of potato corn pur√©e.  Ahh hosed with deliciousness.

3rd, seafood, yes their fort√©
How about that butter poached halibut in a bed of yellow tomato sauce. With eggplant caponata.

2nd,
Raw salmon seared with pumpernickel crust. Basil cream and basil blossom.  give me a break. I'm utterly in love with seafood more so. Stop. No. Don't stop.

1st of all, lobster bisque with caviar on top. Best 5,000 calories ever consumed(I'm over exaggerating on the calories) 

Bread sticks in a vase served with smoked fish mousse while we eagerly wait with our Shirley temps.

Primely, service is tops. These kids specialized in serving us very well, and describing each culinary dish as it was delivered. Mmm they know their stuff, it's obvious they do their kitchen homework. 

Note, 
We came for our best friend's bday and they treated her like a queen, so I highly recommend to spend your benjamin's at this place if you'd like to enjoy fine dining and freshest fish n primo meats.

What do you get when you build one of the most beautiful concept restaurants in the world and serve up subpar seafood dishes? Aquaknox at The Venetian!

Just to give you a vague idea of what to expect from this place...the crabcake appetizer is $15 and comes on a tiny plate with TWO ping-pong ball sized pieces. You would think for about $7.50 a piece, they should taste AMAZING, but no. You can purchase better tasting seafood prepackaged at Costco or Safeway.

So not only was it extremely expensive, the food was completely unappetizing, flavorless and our group left HUNGRY.

This is one of those places where your $45/person bill is paying for the decor and atmosphere, not your food.

Honestly, save yourself some money and take it elsewhere. Don't let the fancy decorations, designer chairs and tables fool you into walking in.

First time to Vegas. Expected a real knockout from the Venitian, however the Aquaknox was good but not worth the price of admission. It is overpriced i.e.: single  malt scotch $30 for a single shot.

Service was confusing. Wine was kept at a bus stand? Was easier to summon the floor manager than our waiters.

Food was very good; scallops were excellent. Lobster bisque was ok; seemed more like tomato soup as it was light on lobster.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Aquanox. If you haven't been to this delicious strip spot then you are missing out.

Located on resteraunt row in the Venetian, Aquanox offers a specialty menu catering to fine pallets with fresh ingredients and romantic ambiance. 

They have a really cool private wine room that is near the front that you can reserve for special occasions. Which I really love for privacy. 

The menu is on the shorter side, but sweet and to the point. Everything from their signature cocktails to the main dishes are phenominal and of course, individually priced!

I was looking for a seafood based restaurant for my birthday dinner. There were many to choose from, but I'm glad that I came here. The place is dimly lit and listed as smart casual for dress code, but it's got a very upscale feel. They hosted a range of patrons. I was greeted and seated right away for my reservation. Both my servers were great and checked on me often. When it came to the menu, I had a difficult time choosing, but settled on the lobster bisque, a glass of proseco, and their stuffed lobster (sold at market price).  Their lobster bisque was probably one of best I've had thus far and that is one of my favorite soups to order. It did not have large chunks of lobster as I have experienced previously at other places, but the flavoring was so creamy and delicious. My stuffed lobster came with asparagus spears and the lobster was cut in half so I didn't have to work too hard to get to the meat. I did not have enough room for sweets, but my server still brought me something light in celebration of my birthday. It was a petit creme puff and a peach yogurt drink. Overall, I had a great experience because the delicious food and professional staff. Definitely a great place to celebrate a special occasion.

Ordered the prawns and scallops. The scallops was amazing. The prawns was cooked to perfection but did not like it much. For the price I would recommend another location. Pretty pricey. The service was great though.

Simply too expensive For what.you get. I understand that Vegas is pricy, but 2 of us had a $150 bill with no liquor and I didn't have an entree (my friend did though).  I had a salad and crabcake , he had Alaska king crab salads and dessert was $125 before tip.  Crazy.  Seems that the slot machines aren't the only place taking your money in this town.  :(

Food quality was good, experience was nice so if you are on an expense account, then I recommend it. (I was because this was a business trip).. if it's personal, avoid AquaKnox

my best friend and i were staying at the venetian on our recent trip to las vegas, and were looking to have a nice seafood dinner. i saw this restaurant on yelp, and we decided to try it since it got great reviews.

we started off our dinner with some drinks; i got the dr. heidemanns-bergweiler riesling and my friend got blue moon. the riesling was definitely one of the best i've ever had. it was very light and not too sweet like other rieslings. 

for our appetizers, i got the pacific prawns which came with a horseradish cocktail sauce, and my friend got the hollander mussels in a chardonnay herb butter broth. i'm not a huge mussel or clam person, but the mussels were super tender and the broth was absolutely delicious. my appetizer came with about five pieces of big sized prawns and a side of the horseradish cocktail sauce. the prawns were super meaty and you can taste the freshness. 

for the main course, i got the mt. cook alpine king salmon which came with a fall vegetable ragout, micro sorrel, and suace buerre blanc. since again i was watching the amount of sauce and fat in my meal, i ordered my salmon without the sauce and replaced the ragout with a side of steamed veggies. the salmon was about 6 oz which was a great portion, and like the prawns, was super fresh, flaky, and moist. my friend got the georges bank scallops, which came with clack truffle creamed corn and applewood smoked bacon polenta. she's not a huge fan of polenta, so she ordered a side of french fries instead. the french fries were thin cut and yummy! i didn't try any of the scallops, since it was topped with truffle oil and i'm highly allergic to truffle oil. but my friend did say it was very fresh and delicious. 

besides the amazing and fresh food, the ambience and friendly staff were out of this world. our servers were jesse and tonya, and they were super friendly and helpful. make sure you ask for them if you ever decide to try this place! jesse was very accommodating to my requests, since i was watching my caloric intake, and made sure that i was comfortable with my dish and the ingredients that were going into it. additionally, the food was not as overpriced as one would expect it to be. 

i will definitely be going back to this place the next time i'm in vegas.

Much like the rest  of Vegas, AquaKnox seeks to blend the contemporary with the trendy and it succeeds.  This is definitely one of the places to check out along a strip full of what I would otherwise consider sensory overload.  They have a private dining area sectioned off by a glass wall so it looks like diners are sitting inside a fish tank, which I thought was very cool. The atmosphere was relaxing and service proved that dining here was worth every penny.

Highlights off the dinner menu include jumbo lump crab cakes served over a bed of market vegetable relish and citrus aioli; seared fennel dusted ahi tuna; an upscale rendition of S'mores (yes ... but cleaner and no melty marshmallows all over your hands), ultra-smooth vanilla creme brulee, and a tasty, though not tart enough, lychee sorbet.

Date night. And we really loved it start to finish. This place is worth a stop. Seriously.  Don't leave Vegas without a truly great dining and ambiance experience. The food was awesome and the prices are very reasonable.  Don't be cheap you get what you pay for in life!  Shout out to Carlos and Brian, they made the whole experience and we can't wait to come back! If I could give 6 stars I would! Love love love!

Service was nice. A bit on the pricey side. 
Really delicious butter lettuce salad. Each leaf has a different flavor.    
Atomic cocktail sauce was bomb too.
Not crowded, so very chill.

Convenient spot to grab quick seafood before seeing Blue Man Group. Nice aquatic-themed d√©cor but not memorable compared to the mega restaurants at the Wynn and MGM. Of the seafood trio, the shrimp cocktail was good (your basic red sauce with extra horseradish fire), the lobster was bland, and the other fish, whatever the heck it was, was delicious.

3-4 stars.
Jennifer made the most amazing drinks (off-menu and off the top of her head!) and was one of the most friendly bartenders I've ever met. Excellent service!!

Where do I start ? This place was superb from the moment we walked in until the moment we left! Some of the finest service I have ever experienced! That place ran like a well oiled machine with every moving part performing at peak performance! Now let's talk about the food. Our server told us about the special which agreed to because he made it sound so delicious boy oh boy I'm glad I took his advice it was delicious! That was was the Best crab I have had outside of New Orleans it was sweet and buttery without dipping it in butter so so good. I asked our server how is that their crab is better the. Everybody else's and he said its fresh the fly it in everyday hence the prices! It was a little pricey but it was worth every penny. The mashed potatoes were excellent the asperaga's had a lemon sort of something to it the steak was cooked exactly like I asked topped with some sort of Asian pepper which brought out a whole other taste to the steak. Over all experience was superb! Highly recommend it if you are staying at the Palazzo or the Venetian or just go there if you are in Vegas! Bravo

Short version: There's just a special kind of unacceptable disappointment for a place like this. When you charge a certain price, you expect a certainly level of freshness of the seafood and service.  This place lacks in both on the night that we visited.

Decor: 5/5
I really liked the look of this place... to the point that we were looking at hosting our wedding reception here but decided to check it out before requesting a proposal for our event.  Visually, I love it.

Cleanliness: 5/5
It was very clean.  No spotty silverware or glasses.  No random napkins under the table.  It's exactly what you would expect.

Food: 3/5
So the food was "good".  It's just not where it should have been for the price point.  We didn't get any bread.  I saw other tables with one, but we were never offered one. My fiance food it strange then was a bit upset when he saw another table with a bread basket.  The lobster bisque made you wonder what you were paying for and where the lobster was.  It's like a bad Scooby-Doo mystery.  My other complaint is around the fact that the seafood was really not all that fresh. I ordered the lobster dinner.  Many the local seafood places off of the Strip have fresher food. Many restaurants in the same range on the Strip have better quality seafood. I was really surprised by this with all of the accolades that they post on the website; however, if you see the plaques on the way to the restroom, they are from several years prior... and the food definitely tastes like it. (Correction: They were awarded in 2017.  Still baffling for me unless I just got a bad lobster. The service really has mad me quite grumpy. No excuse.  I should have fact checked this statement.)

Service: 1/5
I had the would have to say I've had the worst waitress that I have ever had in my entire life.  She took our order with a bit of a snotty attitude, and we didn't see her again until she dropped off the check and was looking for her tip. I couldn't tip her, and I always tip.  I ended up withdrawing cash in the casino and giving is to the assistant because I was told that if I put anything on the check that it would go to her. Not gonna happen!  Her assistant did the best he could but seemed new to this type of service.  He had such a willing, helpful attitude that it made you really lose sight of that... especially after dealing with the waitress staring at our table as she walked by but never actually saying anything to us.  I definitely got the impression that we were not welcome and/or wanted. I let the manager know my thoughts with examples when I left.

I would never host anything at this restaurant! It would be an embarrassment to have them deal with the service that we experienced.

Another Aquatic five star fine dining restaurant finally checked off my list without disappointment. Located in The Venetian Hotel & Casino 
We made a reservation through open Table on a Friday night . I actually had to call and change the reservation time twice and they accommodated me both times with no problem at all. I was surprised that when we arrived we were seated right away. 

Starters 

The Florida Pink Flamingo Ceviche: Lobster Roe, Lemon, Cilantro, shishito peppers & red chili tortilla strips. 
 Very Tasty! 

Truffle Burrata Salad came with 
Truffled Burrata shaved asparagus , summer squash, shaved heirloom baby carrots, fennel cream, dried shallots & top with some delicious sterlet caviar!

Crispy Kennebec French Fries 

I would actually recommend NOT ordering these. The waiter told us these were a "must order" and they were Definitely NOT a MUST ORDER. They were fresh but I go to inn n out burger all the time (who also makes their fries homemade) and they are very comparable. Very. So it wasn't necessary for me to order those. 

Entrees 

The Seared Sea Scallops were prepared with 
Fennel Pollen , wild mushrooms , crispy pancetta, romanesco crown, parsnip pur√©e and bee jus
It was unclear to me how this dish would turn out as I was unfamiliar with most of the ingredients.
I enjoy Scallops if they are cooked right, and they were. 
I noticed there were no mushrooms and broccoli instead. I would probably order something else next time however it was tasty ! 

We also had to go with the special on the Menu which were the  Alaskan King Crab Legs !  
( Served cracked chilled or hot)
These King Crab Legs were the real deal as I enjoyed every bite. I ordered mine chilled on ice which came with a mustard & cocktail sauce. If you like Alaskan King Can't go wrong with these. 

Next time I will order something with a little extra flavor like the Chilean Sea Bass or the Albacore 

The Service was really good ! We had one main server and a server helping him. The place wasn't too busy for a Friday night . The reason I like coming to places like this besides the food quality  is because of the service. There was a few minutes where I was looking around with an empty beer glass and shortly after they asked me if I wanted another. I was happy with Aquaknox.

Now here's a good place.

I didn't want to eat here; fish restaurant, weird location from my hotel, looked too trendy to have good food. I was wrong. Great meal.

We showed up with more in our party than in our reservation. "No problem, just a minute to set up new tables." Cool.

I don't drink but we had a party of 12 and those that had cocktails loved them. There was the LV-usual menu of house cocktails.  The bartender was accommodating, but when one of our party wanted a house specialty without an ingredient, the waitress came back and explained that the bartender felt the drink wouldn't be enjoyable and would she like something different? She would and she did. They were good.

I ordered an appetizer and then I asked the waiter for his opinion of a dish. He said that if I liked {my appetizer} then I would really like (his suggestion). OK, I'll try it. 

Wait staff is young and smart. Not too chatty, but if you engage them, they'll talk. Just the right amount. They were quick, accommodating and professional.

I had the lump crab cocktail and steak Oscar, both very excellant. I should have had the steak cooked more than medium, but that was my fault. I didn't mention it, but I think if I did, they would have helped me out. I got that vibe off them.

Dessert was chocolate something and good. Coffee came with biscotti and were yummy.

Not inexpensive, but I got value, I think. Cool place, up-scale and comfortable. Not over-the-top good enough to be 5 star but getting close. I'll go back.

This place is impressive. The decor is straight out of Biff's penthouse suite in Back to the Future 2. Wide open and ultra modern with multi-level tables, but without losing that comfort zone at each table. The salmon was ridiculous and the wine was top notch. For the first time I actually savored each bite instead of going dyson on the plate. Like everything in vegas, it helps you lose weight... in the wallet.

I love this establishment!!! I really can't order seafood anywhere else. The crab bisque was so rich and flavorful, always a treat. I shared the shrimp and crab salad with my friend. It was so refreshing with the cantaloupe and avocado complimenting the greens and dressing. My entree was as delicious as ever, Prawns  with couscous and lobster cream. The service was outstanding as always. Sorry I was way to full for dessert.

I'll start by saying, the only reason this place didn't get 5 stars is because i wish the food portion would have been a bit bigger! other than that, This place is AMAZING!!

We started with the crabcake appetizers... they were tasty!
I had the new zealand salmon with lobster mashed potatoes-- The mashed potatoes were phenomenal! And the Creme Brulee (which i'm usually not a fan of...) COULN'T GET ENOUGH!! The Aquatini was sooooo good!! Usually not my kind of drink, but this was yummy!

It was a little pricey, but the customer service was impeccable... The staff was SO nice and attentive. We were there for my niece's 21st birthday and when i made reservations, i told them this. they remembered when we got there and made her feel so special throughout the night. It was a very special night and definitely memorable. :)

The place is beautiful! A couple of friends and I met there on a break from the convention that we were attending. We sat in the bar area and it wasn't crowded at all.  We received no attention at all. We had to wave someone over to finally order water. The same for our drinks and then the same for our check. Of course, it's in the Venetian so our drinks were pricy. My friend said her martini was delicious so that earned the two stars.

Going to be tough to ever top the stuffed lobster here. Just be hungry because it's pretty big. We started with the crab bisque(way too rich for me, too much cream I think) & The Blue Crab app(thoroughly amazing!) & The Crab Cake(certainly an upper end crab cake with a nice meat to bread ratio, the remoulade is flawless!) & the Shrimp and Grits(holy flavor explosion, Batman! A must IMO). We also ended our meal with Absinthe, the full presentation and all, pretty cool.

Ok let me just say I am kinda picky. This was one of the if not THE best seafood dishes and experiences I have ever had. We started with the prawns in atomic sauce, cooked perfectly though sauce could have been hotter. Had cocktails all were superb, service was without a doubt exemplary. All of our servers were knowledgeable especially for Zach  and Kara they were sooooooo good at every aspect of the meal. Friendly, knowledgeable and ready to help with anything. Truly and exceptional meal and experience.

I know they are known to be a great seafood restaurant, but I ordered their duck dish which was surprisingly good.  I also tried my friend's scallop and it was perfectly cooked as well.  Definitely worth going back.

I made a reservation for next Wed at 7 pm. Two days later, Aquaknox called me and said "We have a big party coming in on Wednesday and we can't accommodate your reservation, but we have an opening at 9 pm". I'm going elsewhere. 
Not the kind of service I expect in a city focused on entertainment and trade shows.

Possibly the best seafood place in Las Vegas, Aquaknox is an excellent night out. The e John Dory and Lobster Bisque are "must haves". The service was the best we had in Vegas and one of the few times the service level equalled the food. The dessert menu is a little lacking, it's good but not outstanding. Overall I highly recommend AquaKnox.

Excellent upscale restaurant for all yoExcellent upscale restaurant for all you seafood lovers! The seafood was excellent here, the land entrees, not so much! The blue theme of the restaurant really gives you the feeling of being underwater as you enter. We were offered booth or table seating and of course we chose to be nestled up in our own secluded booth--more comfortable and a lot more privacy! Here is a list of what we ordered:

-Crab cakes: Bomb diggity! Probably hands down the best crab cake I've ever tasted. Their crab cakes were chunky and you can see that they used real crab and no imitation crab meat. Perfect to the touch that when it enters into your mouth, you can still taste the texture and consistency of the crab. Yum! The tartar sauce it comes with adds the perfect balance to the crab cake. Usually, I'm not a huge fan of tartar sauce because it is way too strong for my taste, but this one was just right. I'm so happy I gave this one a try!

-Oysters: We ordered 6 oysters to start off our dinner with (2 small, 2 medium, and 2 large). The smallest ones from Washington were yummy. The medium and large ones from Washington and Virginia respectively tasted mushy like they were pregnant oysters. Definitely sticking to the smaller sizes from now on.

-Fois gras: Served with a bread pudding (which I found to be quite interesting because bread pudding is usually served for dessert), a slice of bacon, figs, and greens. This dish was a mix of too many flavors and textures. The fois gras tasted very gamey to me. The bread pudding just didn't belong. The figs were sweet and chewy. The bacon was the only part of the dish that tasted normal to me. We didn't even finish this dish. Not a dish I would order again.

-Sea Bass: Yum! Yum! Yum! This sea bass melts in your mouth the moment you eat it. So delicious! Came with chunks of lobster, corn, and edamame beans drenched in the sauce it came with. Very simple and pleasant to eat. 

-Bone-in-ribeye: Ribeye came sliced for you over a bed of mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes outshined the ribeye for me unfortunately. The ribeye was drenched in the house sauce they supposedly "drizzled" over the meat. I think it would have tasted better if there was less sauce, so that I would have been able to taste the quality of the meat.

All in all, excellent restaurant! I would come again, but would definitely stick to ordering the seafood items here!

We stopped in here for some pre-dinner shellfish and I can't believe we didn't find this gem of a place before! The atmosphere was hip and fun - but the best part was he seafood trio, which - honestly - they need to
Rename this "the motorboat" that is seriously what you want to do to the plate when you finish this dish to capture all of the juices! This place is top notch and amazing!

The Chef's Seafood Soup (entree) was awesome. I would suggest that and a variety of oysters from the raw bar. 

What I did not like was that the server was more concerned about 'selling' than my food interests. Upon ordering a significantly priced bottle of wine, he came back with a more expensive proprietary label bottle saying that I would probably like that better. Actually, I know my wine and ordered specifically to pair with my meal/my group's meal. When I asked why & what specific vineyard this wine came from- I stumped him into a babbling tangent with no specific answer.

In addition, they were really big on pushing their $80 seafood appetizer sampler. We were told that we should order that..."it's best for a table of four like this". Really? We more than happily ordered ~ $100 in appetizers but, did not see the value in the mish-mash of items on the sampler.

Bottom line, great food. Order what you want and you will not be disappointed.

Food - Excellent.  We had the prawns with couscous and the salmon.  Both delicious, fresh and aesthetically pleasing

Drinks - The ginger bourbon lemonade was AMAZING

Atmosphere - So-so.  You'll get a lot of passerby's looking in at you.  D√©cor is alright, nothing special.  It was also a little dead inside for a Wednesday at 8 pm.

Service - So-so.  When my husband and I made the reservation, we specifically indicated that we will have just gotten married and this would be our first dinner as husband and wife.  Unfortunately, no one said anything to us, not even a "congratulations."  In the spirit of being totally candid, we were hoping for a little special treatment, perhaps some cocktails or dessert on the house.  Not a single thing.  That was a little disappointing.  

BOTTOMLINE - There are a million good restaurants in Vegas to try, I see no reason to go back to Aquaknox

I wanted to grab a quick bite after an exhausting day at a tradeshow in the Venetian and AquaKnox was pretty much in the right place at the right time. I didn't feel like going on a mission to find authentic food outside the hotel and the place had just the right amount of people and volume for me to deal with (not too much, not too little). I took a seat at the bar and was helped by several very, very nice bartenders. It seems most bartenders in Vegas are a little on the jerky side, but this guy and girl were more along the lines of fine dining waiters than just bartenders.

My lite meal turned into a self made tasting menu of miyagi oysters, tuna tartar, and a butterleaf salad. One glass of white to start and one glass of red to finish. The oysters were awesome - served with a mignonette that made them pop. The tuna tartar had two sides to it - one was sliced and seared and the other was a true tartar. I would rather they just server a double of the tartar with some kind of eating vessel (like a fried wonton or something). The salad was pretty simple in ingredients, but it was perfect after the tuna and was presented in a beautiful blossom looking fashion. 

Tip included - about $120. Is that expensive? For burger king, ya. For a nice seafood restaurant in Vegas, not so much. That said, I did earn my "High Rollers" badge after checking in here on Yelp.

Wonderful service- delicious food.  Our party had oysters, ceviche, & shrimp cocktail to start;  Fish soup, steak, salmon, & albacore tuna for main; and bread pudding, Apple doughnuts and some orange champagne thingy for dessert.   I was feeling a little under the weather and the fish soup really hit the spot. My party had a great experience here- would definitely dine again.

LOVED. 

My parents are in Vegas a few times a year on business, and they always eat here their first night. I'm so glad we didn't skip their tradition when I joined them on their last trip.

Ambiance - a little modern, cool colors, white table cloths

Service - on top of it, friendly

Drinks - amazing

Food  - even better

Crab Cake Appetizer: 5 stars (and I don't like crab cakes usually)
Tomato Salad - 4 stars
Caesar Salad - 5 stars
Mango Ceviche - 5 stars
Salmon Entree - 5 stars
Butterfish Entree - 5 stars (AMAZING. Melt in your mouth goodness)
Jumbo Asparagus - 4 stars (light)

Sure it's a bit pricey, but the qualities of the food, service, and ambience is on par with the prices.  If you go, I recommend the Clam Steamers to share with your party.  The taste of the clams cannot be duplicated anywhere else!  I am not sure about paying $8 for a bottle of H20, though.

Ambience- Hip yet classy.

Food- Good food, but I think you are mostly paying for the ambience and service.  Except the Clam Steamers were out of this world!

Service- Friendly, professional, and very attentive.

Jesse and T (tonya) served us tonight.  Not only was this the best meal we've had in Vegas..this pair was PHENOMENAL!!
We come to Vegas 3-4 times a year, this was our first visit to AquaKnox..the BEST steak (rival to Moos in Boston) and the BEST seafood (including fresh coast). 
But the food paled to our service..I would eat McDonalds if they served there..WOW! 
Eat here, ask for them..have a ball!  
Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!

This review is long overdue as this restaurant has continued to put out extraordinary dining experiences that leave diners in awe when they remember how good the food, service, ambiance and overall meal was.  Usually a restaurant will hit a home run in one or two of the categories but to knock it out of the park throughout each facet is very rare.  Our meal started with the Aqua Knox Plateau.  Lobster, oysters, prawns, mussels, ceviche, king crab and ponzu oyster shooters.  If i posted the picture, i think it would be the only picture needed to have you stop what you were doing and book immediately.  Too much to say as each item could have it's own paragraph.  To say the least, everything on the platter was fresh, ice cold, delicious and appetizing.  We were then treated with the King Salmon Tartare and Warm Octopus Carpaccio.  Both home runs.  Then we moved onto sharing the Butterfish, Whole Sea Bass and Fennel seared Albacore.  They didn't last long on the table. One of the most important facets of our dining experience is the wine pairing and our server was one of the most knowledgeable service staff we have had in a while.  I let him order the wine for us and didn't regret a single taste.  It's very rare in this trying economy to find a restaurant with service staff that take that amount of pride in cultivating their own palate to ensure a smooth and wonderful experience for the customer, just have to save kudos to that.  This server could have easily been the AGM and see a very bright future in his culinary career. Our meal finished with a dual dessert of cheesecake and flan and both were spectacular.  I would go back to Aqua Knox in a heart beat and can't wait to experience a meal of this caliber in the near future.

The service was lacking. And weird and the wine service was awkward, serving a sauvignon without asking any questions. I've never had a $100 a person awkward dinner. Maybe they were leaving us alone a bit because it was our anniversary?

What a great experience!  Friendly staff and terrific food.  Quite possibly the best meal I've had in Vegas.  Jessie & Kelly made the choices perfect for us. Wish all dining experiences could be Iike this. Must do!!

I found this place off of google & I am so glad I decided to do our company dinner here! 
First off they gave us the private room which was very nice of them to do for us. 
The service was hands down amazing our waiter & staff was very attentive and professional.

Everything we ordered was amazing and I will include photos because I'm a visual person and I feel like everyone loves using photos to reference what to order.
We had for appetizer their seafood plateau, crab cakes, foie gras, lobster bisque, & Louie crab salad.
For entrees we had the surf & turf all around and boy was their steak delicious along with the lobster stuffed crab.

Overall I highly recommend this restaurant it definitely did not disappoint and the quality in service & food deserves more than 5 stars!

I was skeptical when I got invited to dinner here. I'm no major fan of seafood. Only seafood items that tickle my fancy is like, fish street tacos, or like....shrimp jambalaya. I'm NOT adventurous at all when it comes to seafood.
But I figured...sure why not? Lets give this a try. Yelpers = foodies right??

I ordered the infamous Lobster Bisque soup that everyone keeps talking about. And whoa....THAT BOWL WAS DELICIOUS!!!!!! Plus that small scoop of caviar on top of a crunchy bread stick a great additional as well. That was enough to get me half full.

My date suggested the Peruvian sea bass as our main dish. In the end, I was glad I agreed to his suggestion. I know fish is a healthy alternative. I normally drench my fish...or any type of seafood in lemon, peppers, sauces...all types of condiments. I like to mask that "seafood-y taste." But THIS sea bass did not need ANY of that. It was flavorful enough for me...and I'm big on flavoring. Also, what I really liked about this was the addition of mashed potatoes with a slight hint of crab meat. These two definitely complimented each other. 

Making reservations is highly recommended.

Amazing dinner!! Our daughter came to the restaurant two weeks ago and we're here this weekend celebrating my husband's birthday with our family and we came to Aquaknox. Great food, great service!! Jesse Romero and Tanya were our servers. They were very personable never interrupting; just great service! We had steak and lobster. Best steak ever! Lobster was wonderful and had king crab legs for appetizer. Beautiful presentation and wonderful to taste. Will most definitely return.

We went to see a show at the MGM Grand (Ka) in july. After dinner at the Aquaknox with my girlfriend. 

Love the show want to recommend this show to anyone. I think it's one of the best show in Las Vegas. 

The Aquaknox is located in Venetian hotel and casino. After looking at menu,  we order Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes for Appetizer. My girlfriend order Whole Grilled Lobster and I have a Filet Mignon. Did not have anything for dessert because we did not have any room for it. But the dinner was very big portion I was unable to finish my main course. Good food, good atmosphere and good service. 

EXECUTIVE CHEF: Tom Moloney

MENU: California inspired Seafood restaurant offering
classic dishes as well as inspiring creations.

DINNER: Sun - Thurs 5:30 p.m. - 11:00 p.m.
Friday & Saturday 5:30 p.m. - 11:30 p.m.

BAR HOURS: Sun - Thurs 12:00 noon - 1:00 a.m.
Friday & Saturday 12:00 noon - 2:00 a.m.

PHONE: (702) 414-3772

I would never have gone to a place like this if somebody else wasn't paying. It's your typical "pay a lot of money to have some guy talk to you in an accent and serve you half a plate of food for $60" kind of place.

They had a good selection of wine, and the filet mignon was good... but not something I couldn't make myself (even if it was sliced by the executive chef.. woooo)

The atmosphere made me feel like I was eating in the middle of an Ikea store, and we had to pay for water.

If somebody wants to bankroll my dinner I'll go back, but I have had $5 cheeseburgers that I loved waaay more than my $42 prawns.

My wife and i love this place!! Fresh every time , and amazing service. I'm a bit of a critic when it comes to dining out, but this place leaves me more than satisfied every time. Price for quality its perfect. The free range chicken is something i dream about lol and the lobster bisque o.m.g!! The bone in ribeye my wife loves every time. Can't wait to go back.
Fantastic service and great good, what else can you ask for. I had the Branzzino and the wife had the the Baramundi(sp). The fish was impressive

We stopped into Aquaknox to get a couple pre-dinner drinks with a large group of 13 people. While I thought the cocktail selection here was unique, I thought it was a bit overpriced and not very good. 
My chief complaint was with the Shingoku oysters we ordered. of the 6 we had 1/2 of them has grit in them. Biting on sand ruins anything.
The service was the only highlight, considering it was only one girl taking care of the bar area, and she managed to take care of our large group without mistakes.

I felt that Aquaknox was OK, but not really worth the price. Started with the Tasting Trio, then the Aquaknox Fish Soup, and finished with Sorbet. Everything was just OK. It wasn't bad, but didn't really make an impression. The service was great, though. Brian did a great job! He was friendly, professional, and honest. The food wasn't anything I would write home to mom about. Considering the cost and the other choices you have in Vegas, it was a let down. If your company is paying, eat here guilt free. If you're paying, there are a lot of other places that are MUCH better...even for seafood.

Came here only for the bar.Don't order a dirty martini unless you know what you're getting into. It was straight up gin and a bad idea. Noobs. 

Pear martini was really delicious, but didn't make up for the rest. Tokyo tea wasn't very stiff, and appletini was easy on the 'tini. (I had to say it, thank you Dr. John Dorian.)

Bartender/waitress was hurrying us out at 11pm on a Saturday night. Wtf. She took away our candle! Yes, I put that in the yelp review.

This was my first ever fine dining experience and I have to say that I'm glad it was here at AquaKnox. I came here with a party of 6 for a bachelorette party, and our reservation was ready to go when we arrived. We were seated right in the middle of the restaurant, in full view of the bar, kitchen in the back, and all tables around us. The ambiance is dim, classy and modern; pretty much what was expected of an upscale seafood restaurant in Vegas. Most of our party were wearing black dresses so we were served with black napkins right away which was much appreciated. Our reservation was at 5:30 with the restaurant at about maybe 30% occupancy in my opinion which was great because the service was impeccable. Our waiter was very attentive and patient while us girls were taking photos. They took our orders right away and came back with updates every few minutes. They first gave us a sample of their crab risotto as compliments from the chef which turned out to be a nice little appetizer. Our main dishes probably came out in about 20 minutes which was perfect. I ordered the Ora King Salmon which was probably the best salmon dish I have ever had! The forbidden rice, peppers, relish on top was just phenomenal. Definitely worth it. We were all so full and decided to forego dessert, but yet again we received complementary ginger tea & madeleines, compliments of the chef. Such a nice gesture since we were there celebrating. Just a perfect dinner from start to finish. Would definitely consider coming here again.

I loved that salmon dip they brought us. MMMM.... my meal was soooo very tasty. I love scallops. They were so delicious. Mmmm mmm mmm. OH the place looked pretty cool too, nice aqua decorations. Our waiter was really nice. 

MMmmmmm
AMAZING!!!!! I needed to arrange a price fixed meal for two clients - Jessica was amazing to work with! The clients loved their meal. Thank you so much for being so accommodating!

Delectably delicious seafood..The oysters were so fresh and the waiters were so welcoming..I did not want to leave! 

I ordered the lobster bisque to start and it was piping hot and full of lobster flavor and then topped with creme fraiche and caviar..On to the main: scallops, which were seared perfectly and served mid rare, but the accompaniments were rather bland, black truffle creamed corn and bacon bits in polenta.. both were tasty, but together they were too sweet and not enough flavor in either one to make the rest of the dish pop.. 

I tasted the birthday boy's 'Barrimundi' fish, and was blown away! The crisp skin had been carefully caramelized and the texture was similar to salmon and sea bass mixed.. mmmmMM soo good! The mashed chive potatoes underneath the fish were delicious and drizzled with white truffle oil...heaven!The deserts were decent, and the cocktails were phenomenal. 

Overall, a fantastic meal.

Service was great with our two Brian's serving us
Food was spot on and very tasty. 
Last week I had the same type of bone-in rib eye at the Eiffel Tower at Paris not only was it more money and fatty, but couldn't hold a stick to how good this dinner was for less money

Thanks staff

Where to go for dinner in Vegas?  That was the question of the night during a recent trip to Sin City.  Since most of our meals were pre-arranged catered events (we were in town for a convention), this became a rather difficult decision given our myriad restaurant options and only one night to dine out!  

In the end, my companion and I decided on Aquaknox.  We were both in the mood for seafood and some tasty cocktails.  I had been warned by other reviewers that the decor might be a bit cheesy (think 80s, Miami Vice, was what I remembered one reviewer wrote).  However, when we arrived there we were pleasantly surprised.  Surrounded by "waterfalls" on the windows and soft lights that changed from shades of green to blue, I actually felt a tranquil and calming influence instead of the modern, angular harshness that I had expected.  I ordered a Red Lotus martini and my companion had their signature Aquatini.  We found ourselves immediately relaxed.

We were both very happy with our appetizers and entrees.  The portions were perfect -- neither too big nor small, enough to satisfy my appetite without leaving me feeling too full.  My salad was loaded with ample servings of shrimp and crab.  The lobster bisque was delicious.  My grouper entree with the miso broth, soba noodles, shiitake mushrooms and bok choy was fresh and flavorful.  The scallops were seared to perfection.  

Above all, we were most impressed with the service.  We had about 4 waiters serving us throughout our meal.  Each was pleasant and courteous (not intrusive), explained their portion of the menu well, and not once did we feel an air of pretense.  Our experience at Aquaknox shows how a restaurant can provide excellent food and service without the snobbishness that too often accompanies upscale dining.
Atmospehere was good, service was fine food wad good but over priced and I have had way better for less... Not a repeat

I had high hope for AquaKnox as they had plenty of great reviews from Google and Yelp. Unfortunately, they didn't perform to my expectations. The service was attentive and friendly, hence, the three stars.  The food was not impressive.  For starter,  the seafood was not fresh.  I had the AquaKnox plateau and their crab claws tasted frozen that have been thawed out prior to opening.  Additionally,  the claws were not open/ cracked properly so I had difficulty getting to the crab meat.  They did not provide any utensil to de-shell the seafood.  Second,  the shrimp ceviche was bland. No flavor.  It was not worth $79. Third, the $53 AquaKnox fish soup was "meh". Average. My mom makes an amazing cioppino soup that'll knock your socks off compared to their fish soup.

My visit was a disappointment. I will not be back to AquaKnox unless they serve the fish soup with a golden spoon. 

Edited - Almost forgot about the dessert! It was the best part of the meal.  Apple pie donuts with vanilla ice cream was delicious. The minced apples inside each donuts made the dessert unforgettable. If you do decide to eat here,  be sure to save room for dessert as it's better than the main course.
