Of course no meal at a seafood resturant is complete without the classic Surf & Turf dish.  AquaKnox knocked this out of the park.  We had the Filet with a Brazilian Lobster Tail.  It is a classic, but was as fantastic! 

2. The customer service is top notch!  From the moment to get to the restaurant, you are pampered.  The service here is just amazing.  The servers are so friendly and helpful. They help you along the way to make sure you get exactly what you need and want.  They check on you regularly and you never have to ask for anything because they are a step ahead the entire meal.  I was lucky enough to have the service team of Jesse and Tonya.  If you are going to AquaKnox, I highly recommend you request their section.  You will not regret it!

3. The sommelier, Louis, and the wine! During our menu tasting, we also opted for the sommelier's choice wine pairing.  I know absolutely nothing about wine except that it is made out of grapes.  I am zero help with picking wine, so I was ecstatic to have such a brilliant sommelier to help us with some wonderful wines for each course.  I also really liked how Louis gave us so much information about the types of grapes used, as well as the region where the wine is produced.  Educational and delicious, how fun!  I wish I could remember them all so I could go buy some for myself.  

4. The desserts! We had 2 desserts.  We had a flourless chocolate cake, which was good. The coup de gr√¢ce was the butterscotch bread pudding.  Wow, wow, wow this dessert was spectacular! It was a thing of beauty, flavor explosion, and just all around yummy.  Just order it and bathe in it's beauty!

5. The restaurant is beautiful! The seats are comfortable, the color scheme is visually appealing, and it is just a pleasant place to be in.  It is really just a lovely place to go for a nice dinner.

It doesn't matter if you are a local or a tourist, you need to go experience this magnificent restaurant.  I promise you will love every moment as much as I did.  Bon appetit!
Oysters were very fresh and tasty, lobster bisque was delicious as well with big chunks of lobster and creamy texture.  Seafood sampler was delicious as well. Yum yum yum

Disclaimer: Rating this based on the food and food alone.  Not the bar nor the wine.

I've decided to stop being a silent lurker and start contributing to Yelp! :)

I'm going to start with Aquaknox, a little gem that I've been going to since its opening week.  I remember during its first few years there was never a need to make a reservation.  It pleases me to see that how its steadily grown.

A quick note about the decor - it's date-worthy in a more less-romantic more-chic type of way.  I like when the lights changes color and getting a table with a good view of the wine cellar is always a plus.

So, don't let the entire seafood look and feel fool you.  What's really good here is the ribeye.  Several years ago one waiter proudly boasted to us that they have "the best Ribeye in Vegas".  Now, I think Vegas has many fairly good steak houses.  SW, Prime, Fix, Boa, and now Cut comes to mind, but this guy was not exaggerating.  It is really really good even when you compare it to upper echelon steakhouses' ribeye.  From some of the reviews I read - it makes me shiver thinking they may not have that ribeye anymore.  I don't know - I was at Vegas two weekends ago and also a month and a half ago, but I didn't have the opportunity to stop by.  I'll be there for Christmas and maybe once in between - I'll definitely check it out once during those two visits.

Assuming it's still there - if you're looking to get a great ribeye that somewhere else would easily charge you much more for the same quality - this is a great place.  You can also get the ribeye with the surf and turf special, which lets you pick between either a crab-stuffed lobster tail or just a regular 'ol lobster tail.  Both are good, I prefer the non-stuffed lobster tail.  Nothing spectacular as far as lobster goes, but completes the meal just fine.  Beware though, from my experience getting the surf and turf "special" is identical as ordering both the lobster tail and the ribeye together.  As in, the price is just the two dishes put together.  Maybe save a buck.

Another awesome dish here is the scallops.  I don't remember if it's an entree or an appetizer, but if it's an entree, we order it and request it to be served like an appetizer.  It's large, tender, flavorful, and depending on the seasonal preparation it will have a nice matching secondary taste.

Crab cakes were pretty decent too.  Nothing too "wow wow wow" but serves as a good alternative appetizer when in a large party.

Overall, I've never had a bad experience dining at Aquaknox and I'm pretty sure I've been there at least 15-20 times over the years.  It's certainly one of the two restaurants I've frequented the most often @ Las Vegas and will continue to attract me until they somehow mysteriously decline (ala Postrio).

Here's to hoping it stays great. :)
The food was very good but the service was not good for the level and the price of the food and location of the restaurant. Atmosphere is not that warm and inviting.

I dined here last night. Service was excellent as usual my Fishermens stew was great. My mothers king crab legs were ordered to be steamed but when they arrived they were still cold. She went ahead and ate them and only informed me of the problem after she finished. I am very sorry to see their amuse Bouche of salmon mousse is no longer offered. It was spectacular.

Food is always great.  Whether you want a steak, seafood, or in between.  Great atmosphere...BEST ever Blue Martini cocktail.  Their best server no longer works there.  "Jamil" if you're out there...contact us at NC.  Been a few years and just wanted to give a shout out.  Hope you still have our ghetto blue shirts.

Came here tonight while at CES 2017. After exploring all of the top restaurants I have to say that Aquaknox was not only exceptional food but exceptional service. Sure to come back for more. Definitely recommend this to anyone with a fine palette .

This is the first time I have been motivated by an experience to write a review. Pretty good food, overpriced for the quality and quantity. Service was the worst I have ever had. Group of 8. In an empty restaurant (should have been a clue) treated like an annoyance once we declined the waiter's suggestion $200 bottle of wine. Waiter made subtle comments about us splitting salads, and how normally people order full salads with dinner which is why our dinner was so delayed.  Once our waiter realized that we weren't going to have a $1,000 bill, it was the last we saw of him.  Just a few visits from the assistant waiter to refill water.  

Upon leaving we were visited by our waiter one last time to get a small tray of sweets on the house since "none of you bothered to order dessert".  Very nice of him to say.  

Anyway it was by far the worst experience I have had in a restaurant in Vegas.  I am there frequently for business and have eaten at many restaurants on and off the strip.  This was by far the worst dining experience I have ever had.

Excellent dinner.  Jonah crab claws were delicious, Barramundi was A+ as was the seafood stew.  Jesse and Tanya were friendly and attentive servers and made this a special dinner for us.  This is an expensive restaurant, so be prepared!

Decent seafood restaurant but would not return.  Just didn't have enough great dishes to warrant a return

Sweet shrimp and lobster salad:  fresh salad with greens loaded with protein and lightly dressed.  I could have had three times the portion!

Lobster bisque:  flavorful but rich and creamy, so if you're not a fan of heavy soups, this isn't for you

Crab cocktail:  large chunks of fleshy crab served with mustard sauce was a surprising favorite for us.   They do not skimp on the crab and it is excellent quality.

Crab cake:  typical.  Bready and fried patty

John Dory Main dish:  fish should have been more seasoned to impart flavor, but the black eyed bean sauce was tasty.  $45 was steep for this dish.

Peruvian sea bass main dish :  also lacked seasoning.  I think they try to emphasize the natural flavors of the fish but it turns out being bland and flat

Creme br√ªl√©e :  good but not a standout

Banana cream pie:  not a pie at all, more like banana cake layer with banana cream on top, then Carmelized bananas.   If you like bananas, you will enjoy this

What we ate:
Lobster Bisque
Seafood Apetizer
Wild Halibut
Seared Ahi Tuna
Whole Fish
Surf 'n' Turf (blue crab stuffed lobster and filet mignon)
3 bottles of wine

So the food here is pretty good, expect to spend a good 2hrs eating because its one of those fancy ambiance restaurants. 

Well because of the obvious name we had to order seafood. The seafood appetizer was pretty good. Filled with 4 different clams, oyster shooters, ceviche, jumbo shrimp cocktails, crab claws, lobster....Um you could probably stop here b/c by the end of this I was pretty stuffed. We then had lobster bisque which was SOOOO FRIGGING good. Decadently creamy (mmmmm BUTTTER, FAT, LARD, whatever it was so rich) So tasty with small chunks of lobsters - FAVORITE!

I only tried two of the dishes ordered: Surf 'n' Turf and Wild Halibut. The halibut was good but not out of this world. At this point I was really stuffed so stomach realestate was becoming scarce and more selective. The surf 'n' turf was too salty (crab stuffed lobster) the filet was good but not the best I'd ever had.

Overall, come eat the seafood appetizer and lobster bisque drink some wine...you'll be stuffed. You can skip the entrees.

Let it be known that I only went to the bar (its nice looking, the water theme is cool, chill atmosphere too) at this place with a friend, who ordered a round then we left, so I know nothing about the food or service. What I do know is that when I saw my friend's tab for the two drinks he bought, I told him that I hope he also gets a squeezer or a small home to accompany the drinks or else he is getting royally screwed. Needless to say, he has no condo and no women accosted him as we sipped our small fortunes, so the royal screwing did indeed occur. While I expected the drinks to be expensive at this place, there is no need for a bar to ever approach the $20 per drink ceiling, because once that ceiling is hit all of mankind will be doomed to sobriety until a comet does us in like one did the dinosaurs. Yikes.

Omigoodness. If you like seafood you HAVE to eat here when in Vegas. The fish is done sooo perfectly. AND there isn't much attitude like you can find at other restaurants in The Venetian (Ahem, Bouchon).

My dinner at Aquaknox was one of the most delicious meals I have ever eaten. We started with the House Smoked Fish Plate (absolutely sublime) and the Seafood Trio appetizers (sweet shrimp, lobster and jumbo crab cocktails all with their own special sauces - YUM!!). Frickin amazing. Both of them. 

We moved on to the beet salad with horseradish vinaigrette and then I ordered the mesquite grilled Wild King Salmon and she ordered the sauteed John Dory with Lobster Succotash and Sweet Corn Broth. The salmon and the john dory were both cooked perfectly - medium rare, the sauces wonderful. As often happens, I liked her dish even better than mine! 

We ordered two desserts and only liked one of them, but that's because my friend doesn't like mousse and i don't like that kind of rich semisweet chocolate enough to have really  enjoyed the dessert. But the peach crumble dessert was awesome! 

The only reason why I am giving them 4 stars and not 5 is because the waiter seemed to have a great deal of trouble getting us a dry white wine to go with our meal. We tried one tasting at his suggestion and it was way too fruity and so we opted for another one he suggested, a Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand, which (1) took too long to get to our table (there was some problem, and we had already gone through 1/2 our appetizers by the time it showed up at our table) and (2) was NOT DRY! it wasn't overly sweet but it certainly was not dry as we had asked. 

But by the 2nd glass it didn't matter and the frickin food was sooo goshdarn delicious that I still walked away happy as, well, a clam.

We wanted to have a drink before our show and happened to come across AquaKnox. What a great suprise! Our bartender Mateo asked what we usually like to drink and took it from there. My husband discovered a new variety of Johnny Walker that he'd never tried. I enjoyed a blueberry infused vodka martini.
We enjoyed ourselves so much, we decided to come back to AquaKnox after the show. We enjoyed more unique cocktails paired with some great dishes to eat.
The next time you're in Vegas, you gotta go here. Be sure to ask for Mateo to prepare some amazing drinks!

My wife had made reservation at Aquaknox on Valentine's and celebrate my 49th birthday which she had mentioned it on Open Table.. She choosen this restaurant because was highly recommended by her boss. We have been dining in so many fine dining restaurants in Las Vegas. We had to say this was the worse experience ever. Our reservation was at 8 15 pm. We received a call to confirm our reservation and she had mentioned that we'll be celebrating my b-
day and look forward to have us. So we showed up and got sat at the worse 
table in front of wine vault. The staff kept going in and out. The door was hitting my wife chair few times. Finally the front server Chris came to our table had mentioned that the servers who I had requested upon my reservation Tanya, Jesse or Mark were not available. So we had ordered some wine and bottled water then we ordered our meal. Finally we got our appetizer octopus with spicy sauce and lobster bisque. Food was dropped at the table with no explanations of the dish. I guess we have high expectation cause most fine dining restaurants that's what they do. The severs never checked back to see how was the appetizers till we were done. The water glasses were empty. Front server had no clue that we were drinking bottled water. Couldn't find our water so had to open another one. I get it if the restaurant was busy but it's not. There was no bread at the table. We didn't know that we have to ask for it. Finally we got our main course which is pretty good. Again servers never explain the dishes nor checked back till the end of the meal. We have heard the chocolate souffle was awesome so we told our server that we wanted one of those do we need to order ahead of time. He said no because it was not the traditional one. Then I said OK we'll try it. This conversation was take place when we ordered our meal. Well after we finished our main course getting ready to order desert, I had told our server that you guys were out of chocolate souffle because I heard one of your staff had told one of the server who were right behind me 15 minutes ago. Our server had no clue, he went in the kitchen to find out and it was true that they were out. So we ordered creme brulee. Took them quite sometime to bring it out. I don't know that your restaurant doesn't do b-day for your guests but at least say happy birthday. Nothing not a word. On top of that our server put our leftover in paper bag and didn't close the top really good so on the way back to our car the bag was soaking wet from the sauce and dripping all over myself. Normally we don't complaint if there is few little things but this was BAD from the beginning till the end. Especially if your staff kept saying welcome back cause we had asked for specific servers, they should be on top of the game. We spent this kind of money, we expect to have some kind of service.

We dined here for our anniversary and had a wonderful experience. The food was great. I had the lobster which took me a really long time to eat! 
The service was excellent and non-intrusive.
Although expensive, it was really worth every penny.

So maybe the food is good, but hello if you're gonna be a place to have a full bar and lounge places to sit, don't close before midnight on a weekend. And don't take my candle just so you can close early. I definitely won't be coming back here again.

My husband and I had dinner here for my birthday in January. I chose this restaurant based on a coworker's recommendation and now I know where to go for restaurant recommendations!

We made a reservation and when asked if we were celebrating we noted that it was my birthday. The hostess was very welcoming and seated us in a cozy, romantic booth. The restaurant was nicely decorated and swanky.  Our waiter was very nice and helpful with the menu options. I loved the amuse-bouche to start. It was a beef wellington that should be added to the menu because I could definitely go for more of that. The meals were a true example of what happens when a trained chef knows how to combine flavors for an amazing meal. I had the scallops that were tender and bursting with the flavors on the plate. The butternut squash and brussels sprouts perfectly paired with the scallops. My husband had the salmon with forbidden rice. His dish was also the perfect combination of flavors and possibly even better than my dish. For dessert I had the butterscotch bread pudding. I love butterscotch and rarely find this as a dessert offering. I realized half-way through that I was shaking my head "yes" with each bite. So moist and full of butterscotch flavor. I can't wait to come back here and enjoy another top notch meal.
Great food, service and atmosphere...  Be prepared to spend some money.

PROS: ?
CONS: Everything - high prices, mediocre flavors at best, bad service

For being a higher-end, "fancy" restaurant, AquaKnox was incredibly disappointing. The appetizers and seafood entrees were mediocre at best, and definitely not worth the prices on the menu. The seasonings on all of the dishes were either incredibly bland, reminiscent of bad diner food, or clashingly distasteful. 

The wait staff, though seemingly professional, was quite rude. They swiftly removed plates from the guests without waiting for people to finish, and made us feel rushed, almost as if they wanted us out the door. I cannot fathom some of the glowing reviews. Sure, the food and restaurant may look pretty, but it's about the entire package. The restaurant had a sign outside showcasing all the awards they have received in the past... but all of them were awarded more than 2 years ago. Definitely would not return.
This place is really good... had the steak and lobster tail and it was bomb.  Ive had better and for a better price which is why i give it 4 stars  but def would come back again.

Filet was cooked perfectly but nothing special. Lobster bisque was overly salty and crab cake texture was poor. The crab cake was disappointing from a taste perspective. While Service was kind, it took a while to get the order to the table. 

Enjoy.

The pok√´ was decent   the place was overly crowded .  For the most part all o the sea food was served over the top, in some decadent manner this ruining the simple clean flavor of what sea food should be like.  The ceviche was horrible, tasted like steamed prawns in a strong vinegar pickle juice.  The Caesar salad, Was at best average with a decent black garlic sauce.  The steamed spinach, was just steamed spinach .  The Pinot Noir  that was ordered tasted like a cheap $7 bottle from trader Joes.  The sad part was the best part of the meal was the smoked salmon muse that was brought to the table when we first sat down.  For all this sup-par food, the prices that were paid were twice more than going to a Ruth Chris .  Save your money and your money and expectations for a different restaurant.

I actually texted my sister right after the meal, raving that my dinner at Aquaknox was one of the best I've had in a while.  Well, that's what delirium does to you...your judgment gets all clouded.  This was my first meal during my long weekend in Vegas, and I was absolutely starving after a day of sun-worshipping.  We got to the restaurant around 10-ish Thursday night, and the place was pretty empty.  Yet, they still made us wait like 25 minutes at the bar.  Finally, once we were ravenous AND tipsy, they decided to seat us at one of the booths.  Very pretty decor, btw.  Aquaknox, you may have deceived my tipsy self into thinking I had a great meal here with your fancy decor and super-nice and attentive staff during that night (come to think of it, is there a restaurant in Vegas that DOESN"T have super-nice and attentive staff?)  However, I have been schooled in the ways of Vegas dining since, and I am no longer impressed.  
For my entree, I ordered the Seared Main Scallops with mushrooms, spaghetti squash, and some Asian-looking green vegetable in a cream sauce.  After finishing off the scallops and mushrooms, I poked at the rest of my entree.  Now, I like veggies, but the way they prepared it was a bit...underwhelming.  I also tried the Seared Ahi Tuna, which was cooked perfectly.  However, I nearly choked on the excess pepper that was on that tuna.  Dessert was phyllo with walnut ice cream in a caramel sauce.  Pretty presentation, but taste was nothing special.  You're basically paying for the ambience and service here (minus the long wait).  One last thing...do NOT try the Ginger Beer....blech.

Overall impression:  overpriced, mediocre drinks, and overly seasoned food (what are they trying to hide?)  I'd really give the place two and a half stars, but they were really nice when my also-drunk friend knocked over a glass and broke it while trying to get up, hence the three stars.  Would I come back, though?  Probably not.

This place is fabulous!  I went with a few friends for my meetup and highly recommend it.  The decor, the service and atmosphere is outstanding.  I can't wait to go back for date night with my husband.

This gem inside The Venetian is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to in Vegas or anywhere else.  The room is beautiful with comfortable chairs and elegant booths, and the noise level is thankfully minimal.

Be warned of the prices, though.  The night we went the 2 lb. stuffed lobster was $96.00!  

I started with a clever appetizer of three seafood cocktails - crab, shrimp ceviche, and lobster.  Surprisingly filling and delicious, although I cared less for the crab.  One friend had to leave early to catch a show.  He had the lobster for his entr√©e and, though not worth $96.00, it was a beauty.  We were not as hungry as we thought so we split an order of foie gras, which was nothing short of orgasmic.  Perfectly seared and simply served with some frisee, I wanted more. So good that I pity the poor bastard who has never savored the unique culinary delight that a goose so generously gave its life for.

We also split a lobster tail, which was superb, served with drawn butter, grilled lemon, and two tasty spears of asparagus for each of us.  These small plates were perfect.

Our amazing servers, Jesse and Tonya, made the whole experience just that - an experience.  Turns out these cute kids are married, and they made us feel like we had been coming there for years.  I raved about them and the food, so Jesse summoned the chef to our table, a delightful young man by the name of Deric Meininger, a Michigan native who has found his true calling Vegas.  Anyway, I told him I am a very fussy New Yorker, and could not find a single flaw with the food or service.

This is my new mandatory go-to place in Vegas.  Jesse and Tonya work Monday - Friday.  Tell them the fussy New Yorker sent you.  You'll have a great time!

Disappointed.

The reviews on yelp, and professional, they pitched this place like the end all to seafood.

Seated immediately, and I'll admit the staff has a pleasant demeanor about them, the food is just kind of meh.

Ordered Ora salmon, it came out very dried out. The Tuscany potatoes tasted like salt and blue cheese as well. We even had to ask for ice in our water more than once.

The men's bathroom was wet all aver the floor (see picture)

I'm fine with paying 100+ for dinner while on vacation, but I do have some minimal expectations. This did not meet them. If the wait/host staff hadn't had such a charming attitude, I'd have rated it a 1.

The dining room here is huge. Coupled with the high ceilings and modern decor, it almost loses the intimacy of a fancy restaurant.  But, with the friendly service and comfy chairs, it all balances well.

Located in Venetian's restaurant row, AquaKonx is one of many choices. It distinguishes itself with a smart, concise menu, fresh seafood, and options for all diners.

They do have a Coconut Tofu curry dish for the vegetarian, which looked intriguing enough to almost order, but we opted for Oysters, John Dory, Crab-Stuffed Lobster, and a Filet.

The oysters are by the 1/2 dozen, and we received 2 different Pairs of New York varietals along with a pair from Prince Edwards. Very fresh, and a good mix of salinity and sweetness. 

The serving team progressed the meal with an Amuse Bouche of Albacore poke.

John Dory was served with a Corn Succotash, and was pan fried with a hint of heat. The Lobster was well cooked, stuffed with blue crab and stuffing mix. The claw was de-shelled and placed on the open body. The filet was about seven ounces and cooked to rare. Typical red wine reduction, but perfectly executed.

The dessert was an event in itself. The Butterscotch bread pudding was the best bread pudding I have had. Not terribly sweet, well balanced and huge portion.

The meal ended with a small chocolate cookie and gingerbread latte courtesy of the restaurant. 

Overall, great pacing and food. Definetly will re-visit next trip.

I was a little nervous eating here because when we go there it was empty. It turned out good and I would recommend eating there. I had the scallops and enjoyed it. Their lobster bisque soup was great!

This ranks up there as one of the finest meals and service I have had in a while. The food was absolutely amazing and the entire evening was paced perfectly. The sommelier recommended the perfect wine for me, and the team of Carlos and Angela really were terrific. Their lobster bisque is hands-down exquisite and possibly some of the best in the world. My husband and I followed that up with the tasting trio of king crab, Florida shrimp ceviche and Maine Lobster cocktail. My husban' told me  his filet mignon was probably the best one he has ever eaten, and I splurged and went with the stuffed grilled Maine Lobster which was beautifully presented and stuffed not with fillers but with Maryland lump crab. We were celebrating our anniversary, and the staff went out of their way not only to make us feel very at home but made sure that our meals were absolute perfection. Well done.

This is this perfect place to dine if you love Lobster. Crab cakes are very tasty. The blue lighting is calming. The service is impeccable along with everything else.. great place to take someone for a romantic dinner :o)

The seafood here was really fresh. We had a boothe and the service was really well done.

The surf and turf was exceptional except that I couldn't finish it as it was too much food. I'd tell you what I had for dessert, but I don't remember due to the excessive amounts of wine and port consumed.

This place isnt cheap though!

The only reason I give it 4 stars is for the portion size. We ordered the crab cake and the filet mignon and the NY strip. All of the food was delicious and the steaks were large but the sides were lacking. They are very pricey so I would expect more for my money. They were very attentive and the service was top-notch.

Finally a Las Vegas restaurant that give you what you pay for. This place is really not THAT expensive considering the pricey options in Vegas but the truth is you really get alot of food for your money at this place. I started with steamed clams that weren't huge but they were soo good. The sauce they were served in was delicious! I also had a whole lobster which was stuffed with crab stuffing. The lobster must've been at least 2 lbs. It was cooked perfect and buttery and delicious. I made a huge mess and I like the type of fancy restaurant that doesn't make you afraid to get into your food. The wait staff was excellent. I must've had 4 waitors all stumling over eachother to get us what we needed. The dessert was good too. I think we had creme brulee but can't remember. They also gave us hot towels and things to clean up after we got all lobstery. This place was great. I can't even complain about the price which is usually my favorite thing to do.

The atmosphere was soothing and romantic with blue and white everything. They had really nice looking booths that I would like to sit in next time I'm there. Really well decorated, fashionable, and super delicious. This place hit the nail on the head for sure.

I took my family here for a farewell dinner on 6/24.  Prior to going, I was looking for a restaurant that would have a special private dining option available.  Valerie (private events from Aquaknox) contacted me right away and sold me on what Aquaknox had to offer.  I wanted to make this special for my bro-in-law who was being deployed.  Valerie was able to offer a special military discount of 15% off our total bill (awesome gesture) and recommended the wine tower to have our dinner.  She gave us multiple options for the tasting menu and I opted for the 5 course.  I read many reviews and was a little concern that it may be too little of food (4 dishes plus dessert), but boy was I wrong. Prior to our arrival date, Valerie kept in constant contact with me to go over the menu, menu design, and to just ensure that our dinner was going to be special.  This level of service continued on to the day of our event.
We arrived and was promptly escorted into the wine tower.  Since it was a Tuesday evening, the restaurant was not crowded, but I am still glad we decided on the Wine tower.  It made all feel special.  The tower itself is a tad chilly (but she had already warned me of that) but we were prepared.  There were people constantly serving us. Andrea was our captain for the evening, and was on top of everything and super friendly.  We started off we a toast (she recommended a sparkling wine over champagne to save us cost).  We had two non drinkers, so Min (assistant manager/mixologist) made them a really special drink (consisting of ginger beer and some other fruits).  They really really enjoyed it.  
The menu was printed on a card and got everyone excited.  We started off with oysters.  Great presentation and most importantly, great flavor.  Only small knock was that Andrea wasn't exactly sure which oysters were which (no big deal).  The first official course was a gazpacho.  This was the best that I have every had.  Very fresh and tasty.  The following 3 courses were duos of amazing stuff.  Crab cakes and Shrimp Salad.  The crab cakes were flavor full, but the shrimp salad was were it was at.  It consisted of 2 sweet shrimps, and a ton of lump crab meat.  This was topped off with micro greens.  Very very delicious.  Next was the fishes.  Barramundi/John Dory.  I was excited to try the John Dory.  But what made the dish was the lobster succotash below it.  Very nice dish.  The Barramundi was also very good with the mash potatoes.  We could have ended it there, but then came the surf and turf.  Filet was on point.  Perfectly cooked and nice flavor.  The prawns (2) were cooked on open flames and also had great flavor.  By now, we were totally stuffed and could barely consumed dessert (chocolate gelato/mousse combo).  Also throughout the evening, we kept asking Min to make us different cocktails.  He took pleasure in coming up with different things and explaining what he made.  I really appreciate all of his explanation and effort he put into it.  One of the girls asked about the ginger beer, he produced a new bottle and served us each a sample.  
All in all, service and food was spot on.  Aquaknox may not be the most famous restaurant in Vegas (or even in the Venetian), yet it should definitely not be overlooked.  I thought we got a great value (5 course turned into 9 courses) in the tasting menu.  Nothing was over the top but very tasty.  Flavors were not too complex for our simple palates.
Will definitely return.  Thanks Valerie, Min, Andrea, and the rest of the staff for a memorable evening.

WARNING: Beware of the servers. Check your bill before paying!!!

The only reason this restaurant got a one star from me is because the food was pretty good.  Not exceptional, was still decent.  HORRIBLE service...my boyfriend and I kept thinking that we were getting punk'd because the staff kept doing too many things just outright weird.....like we asked for bread, we were told that the "Chef is stingy with bread", but we can opt for breadsticks! yippie!!!! Ok, fine. We order the breadsticks, and they never show up with them. Our food took forever, we had to leave our table to get the waiter to us, had to pour our own wine and the list goes on.
But the most disappointing aspect of this whole experience.......how they are like used car salesmen, tapping in an extra charge here and there, "accidentally" double charging for appetizers AND suggesting splitting a dish and charging full price plus a splitting charge.  I think the restaurant is sinking in the sea of fine establishments in las vegas and is desperate to keep their margin high.  NEVER will we go here again, crappy service overpowers delicious crabcakes.

My husband and I had dinner here last tuesday for our anniversary. From the beginning checking in with the hostess they were so polite. Luckily wasn't a super busy night and they sat us at a very intimate and comfortable table. 
The menu was absolutely delectable, almost hard to decide because everythinf sounded so wonderful. 
The first thing asked was about allergies, which we both have food allergies, the idea os someone asking to help out with the menu made me feel so safe in their hands. 
I am personally a server and bartender, and cannot tell you how much we appreciated the wonder team who were our servers Mr. And Mrs. Jess R.- whom as we found out have been married 8 years and have been employed there for 10! I love knowing that I am attending a place where clearly the staff is being treated well enough leaving them happy to treat the guests just as so. 
The food portions were amazingly giant and so beautiful. We had the clams, lobster bisque, stuffed lobster and the special surf and turf filet and lobster. Not one complaint about anything we had. Also when you sit down they serve you an amuse buche with your wine. Yum! 
 Jesse came out at the end, and brought us a wonderful dessert with banana milk and mousse bites. Lovely writing of happy anniversary in chocolate on the plate (special treatment ) 
The dinner was worth every penny mostly due to Jesse and his wife, being the best servers we have ever had. As we were leaving I couldn't but help hugging them. Thank you so much for making our night so special. Xoxoxoxoox
We will see you next year.

They don't "officially" offer a tasting menu, but they were happy to oblige when we made the inquiry.  The sommelier and waiter were wonderful and seemed excited to give us a great experience.  The bill at the end of the night was MUCH less than I would have expected.
Great food. The surf and turf was awesome the steak was mouth watering. The staff was very friendly and courtesy.

We were there for dinner on a Sunday night in early October. We had no reservation but were right away seated. Nice ambience and very friendly and attentive service - but a very expensive place - as we have expected for s restaurant in The Venetian. I started the classic way with the Lobster Bisque Soup - it was superb. My colleague had the Greenlip Mussels  - when you have been to New Zealand you know them very well - they are bigger than the PEI mussels and the shells shimmer somehow green. As a main I had the Barramundi from down under. Just a great fish unfortunately you can't get it very often in the US. I closed my meal with a cheese plate. Overall food an service was great a real good seafood place - definitely worth the price and also for revisiting.

We wanted a nice seafood dinner. Things went off the rails. Sommelier offered to decant our wine. He opened the bottle at table, then took bottle in the back, 15 min later the decanter appeared. Only 500 ML, what happened to our 750Ml..restaurant magic!!
Then later the waiter took our entre order. After waiting waiter brought a 6 oz salmon piece and a 3 oz Halibut piece. The 3 oz Halibut was $53.  For multiple reasons we were disappointed. Not likely to return.

Literally dreaming about coming back here!

We decided to go here for our client debrief (we had a conference at the Venetian) and my bosses birthday dinner. I found this place through, where else, yelp. They had reservations on open table, so I made on for 7:15pm. We called to see if they could push it back 15 minutes but we were told they had a few large parties and unfortunately could only do 7:15. When we got there on time, NO LARGE PARTIES TO BE SEEN!

Oh well, other than that, the service was great and food was impeccable. We even snuck in a small cake for our boss and they brought it out for us with a candle and cut it for us, free of charge. 

They have a small room in the blue circular tower you will see when you walk by. It's their wine cellar plus a private room for about 6-8 people. I would love to eat in there!

We ordered a few drinks and a few appetizers. 2 ahi tunas, steamed mussles and the crab cake. All of them-wow! The ahi was so fresh and actually very big for an appetizer. The crab cake wasn't mashed up crab, it was huge chunks of blue crab. The steamed mussels were in a delicious broth and also had a lot.

The chef even sent out a small tasting of crab and spinach on a cracker for us, also amazing! 

Everything looked so good that I had a hard time deciding what to get. The entire table wasn't sure! We ordered: scallops, seafood soup, seabass and ahi tuna dinner. Everyone said nothing but amazing things about their meal. I ordered the seabass and I wish the plate never ended. It came with a sweet corn on the bottom-wow. I think next time I will get the seafood soup, it was huge and you literally got to try it all. The broth was flavorful and light. 

I can easily say I will come back. Great service and great good!

Get the aquaknox plateau!!!!! You won't regret it.  Yes it's expensive but this is fine dining ppl!!  I love stone claws and everything was so fresh.

My friend and I split the fish dish, which I forgot the name, and the crab stuffed Maine lobster.  It was very good.  The fish was cooked perfectly and the lobster stuffing was seasoned well.  I think I literally ate the whole plate!

If you're looking for a great seafood option, try this place.

It's very pretty and when we went it was practically empty!  Ask for a booth.

This restaurant is an excellent example of Las Vegas fine dining at its best. Some excellent highlights; the cocktails are fantastically made, the seafood trio appetizer is a MUST when dining here, and the service should be, and was, perfect. We truly enjoyed our experience here, and although there are many fine dining restaurants in Las Vegas to choose from, there are few that tend to get all those key elements and service standards working together harmoniously perfect such as AquaKnox.

If you want amazing service and food then you need to go here!!! Everything is top notch and worth the money.  Our first visit we had a phenomenal waiter named Andrew and had to visit again and request him.  The staff is all knowledgable about wine and how it pairs with the entrees you choose to enjoy.  We chose to do the tasting of the menu which is a 5 course meal paired with beer/wine.  AMAZING!!!! If you want a 5star experience then go visit the wonderful chefs and staff at Aquaknox!
Amazing service. Delicious food! Lovely atmosphere! Totally worth it!

We always go here for special occasions. The food is superb.  The service is outstanding.  I love the crab stuffed lobster. I never can eat it all.  I tried the creme br√ªl√©e last time and very much enjoyed it.  If you are near the Venetian and really want to treat yourself, try this place.

excellent fresh seafood, service and atmosphere. One of the best restaurants in vegas. We loved the alaskan king crab legs and aquaknox seafood soup which was loaded with brazen sea bass, large shrimp, scallops, mussels, clams and a large lobster tail in a wonderful tomato broth.

Came here on a recommendation from a friend who's a big foodie, was nervous when we read the Yelp reviews and saw lots of posts talking about questionable service. Our service was fantastic tonight! We sat with Jesse who took great care of us, and all the food was amazing as promised. Great choice for special holidays or romantic dinner dates.

First impressions mean a lot...
We arrived with some friends who are from out of town and were originally seated at a table. The couple asked if we could have a booth instead and the hostess had us wait a minute or two at the table as they cleared one for us. Bonus points! 
Our waiter was nice and patient. He made some
Great recommendations and I went with a salad and Pan-Seared Barramundi. It was absolutely delicious! The fish was nice and moist with perfect seasoning. The salad was not drowned in salad dressing which was great.

I choose Aquaknox for Christmas eve dinner with my parents and bf.  My sole criteria were: non-steak, seafood preferred, on the strip, reservation availability on opentable, and of course, positive yelp reviews.  

First off, the place did not look as impressive as I'd hoped.  My expectations were probably too high.  In the dining area, there wasn't any cool watery dcor, because that's only in the bar area.  We were seated somewhere in the middle of the room, and it felt very cramped, like all the tables were too close.  For one thing, the chairs were huge (although comfortable) taking up a lot of space, difficult to get in and out and move around.  Service wasn't as smooth as I expected, nor comfortable or inviting.  

For appetizers, I ordered lobster bisque for myself and crab cakes for the table.  I don't understand the hype about lobster bisque.  It was creamy, has the essence of lobster, little chunks of lobster, and so it hit all the right marks, but didn't amaze me.  Maybe three days of lobster had something to do with it as well.  The crab cakes were also perfectly done, but not above and beyond.  I think I'm also jaded with an overabundance of crab cakes in my diet.  For the main, I ordered the John Dory.  I loved the lobster succotash, although a little bit sweet.  Tasting around the table, there were scallops, jumbo prawns, and ahi tuna.  Everything was perfectly cooked, and each had very different, yet interesting sides.  The prawns were probably the largest I had ever seen.  The tuna was a turn off because of its overly strong tapenade topping.  

For dessert we had the crme brulee and sticky toffee pudding.  I scoffed at the brulee - I could make a better one at home.  It was too soft when served.  I enjoyed the toffee, since it was the first one I ever had.  The coffee came with chocolate almond biscotti, which I appreciated.

If you're watching Blue Man, it's a toss up between this and Delmonico's next door.

In the end, I just felt guilty for all the fresh fish having been flown in to Vegas.  This is the desert!  I'll stick to seafood in San Francisco.

Underimpressed. Simply. I ordered ceviche and the barimundhi (can't remember the spelling) the ceviche was a jalape√±o ceviche and the menu explained that it came with some type of bread or cracker....it didnt. There weren't any jalape√±os either. Very flavorless. Just a bunch of lime juice poached shrimp.   The fish was okay. Nothing special. A little dry and served with mashed potatoes and field greens on top. Along with a veggie medly placed on the fish. There are much better places to eat at this resort.  The place was pretty dead at 8:30pm too. Unfortunately I won't be back.

Greatest seafood and steak restaurant. This is the only place I can eat at multiple times every time in Las Vegas. 
I call it the greatest hidden restaurant in Vegas.

I haven't eaten at this restaurant in a few years and I'm glad that I decided to give it a shot again! All I can say is....OMFG, everything we ordered was making me drool while  I was chewing. DELICIOUS!!!

We had dinner here for the first time and it was delicious! The service was incredible and the foot was amazing!!! I highly recommend eating here while visiting Vegas!!!! The steak, lobster, crab cakes everything delicious! The bread pudding was amazing as well!

Dined at Aquaknox recently and give it 5 Stars!! Excellent Service, Delicious Food, Modern & Chic Ambience.....I loved it here!

My girlfriends and I started the evening with a cocktail from the bar: A Blue Martini (forgot the name). Delicious but sweet, so we switched to wine during dinner. The restaurant wasn't busy so it wasn't loud. I loved the interior. Very modern and warm. We picked a booth and it was perfect for three of us.....intimate and good for catching up on things. 

Anyway, Thank You fellow Yelpers for recommending the Maine Lobster Bisque! I loved it and savored every bite. The best lobster bisque I've ever eaten. A little rich but flavored perfectly, and topped with little clumps of lobster. Perfect! I also had the Sweet Shrimp and Lump Crab Salad and it was excellent as well. I'm not a big eater, so those two appetizer-sized dishes were a perfect dinner for me. 

Another must-have: Crab Stuffed Whole Maine Lobster! My friend ordered it and we helped her finish it. It's massive....The whole lobster comes out on a huge plate and you just stare at it! The lobster was so tasty that it didn't even need butter. 

Sorry no dessert recommendations. Too full!

I must commend the staff at Aquaknox for their excellent service! The hostess who greeted us, the bartender who served our drinks at the bar, and of course our wait staff were all so welcoming and polite. Special thanks to our waiters, who were very attentive, open for suggestions/recommendations, accommodating, and skilled at their job. I noticed they even held out a white cloth to prevent splashing while pouring our waters! Thank You for making our visit to Aquaknox such an enjoyable experience! I will be back soon....

Aquaknox is located in the Venetian/Palazzo right outside their Conference Center. Primarily a serving seafood, but do have a few selections of other meats.  Open table reservations worked great,  and  were seated right away.  In comparisons to other restaurants in the hotel, this one will be priced  a bit higher overall for the quantity of the food.  Enjoyed our meal overall, with an delicious appetizer of a crab cake, and entrees of Chilean Sea Bass and a Filet.  We added  on a pound of Alaskan Crab legs, and that was extremely pricey.  The Sea Bass  and Filet was excellent, but would forego on the add on for the crab legs as it was not worth the extreme price.  If you go, and there is only two of you, request a booth, as they are very private and make a great dining experience.  Overall, we would visit again for special occasion with full knowledge the expense of the meal.

Aquaknox is a 3.5, but I'll round up to a 4.   My girlfriend and I sat at the bar for drinks and dinner.  The bar area was so nice, lively, and fun.   I had my standard Captain and Coke and ordered some Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and a Sea Scallop dinner.  The shrimp cocktail was good but pricey.   Four large shrimps for $18.   The sea scallop dinner was $35 for four HUGE scallops.  They were served on top of a sweet potato puree and mushrooms.  The scallops were very good but not the best I've had.  

I was almost done with my Captain and Coke when the bartender accidentally refilled the whole thing with Coke.  He realized his mistake immediately and gave me another free drink.   As he pushed it toward me, one of the drinks spilled onto the pants and shoes of the man sitting next to me.  He gave him a free drink and appetizer which was nice.  

I really liked the atmosphere and would come back again.  I would recommend giving it a try.

Unbelievable! Well really it is believable I've been a fan for years.  Brought my boss and coworkers in while in town, the meal and service were impeccable. My group had never seen how "I roll" (Lol) They did NOT disappoint. There were 6 in our group, we had oysters on the half shell, my boss and I split the 2 lb lobster stuffed with crab (Amazing! )  Our non-seafood fans raved about their 14 ounce NY steak. Aquaknox remains my favorite restaurant of all time.  It is worth every cent to take part in the Aquaknox experience. Thank you to Managers Brian and Andrew for creating such a wonderful experience for us! If you're ever in Monterey, please let us return the favor :-) 
J Nelson 
Massage Envy Monterey

The staff was very friendly and attentive, but the food was just average.  The steak was large, but rather tough, and the mashed potatoes were a little watery. The seafood portiins were also large, and the tuna was tender, but the prawns were too chewy. 

We made the staff aware of the food allergies of some of the members in our party, yet one of my group still had a severe allergic reaction to sesame and ended up in the hospital. Considering all the other options in the Venitian and Pallazo, I don't think I will be coming back any time soon.
The oyster platter, lobster bisque and crab cake were spectacular. Will be back soon. The bartender was very friendly and informative.

Summary:  This is a lovely spot to relax between the Venetian and Palazzo.  My wife and I love seafood and Aquaknox gets it fresh and with a nice variety.  We were there the week before Christmas, 2012.

Food:  4 stars
We started with a sampler of a dozen oysters on the half shell.  They were very fresh and very tasty.  We both had simple grilled fish (the special) over a nicely done risotto.  All in all, a solid meal as expected based on reputation and price point.

Wine:  5 stars
For the price point and the vibe of the resort we expected an extensive list, a well trained sommelier, and a tip toward Italian.  All was as expected and more so.  The sommelier, a young man named Scott, was well versed in his list and very personable.  We found a '01 Moccagatta Bric Balin Barbaresco, a very happy and unexpected joy!

Service:  2 stars
Maybe it was the lack of staff because of the season, but our waiter was simply not good enough for this price point.  Adequate is a failure in fine dining.

Ambiance:  4 stars
They do a nice job of shielding the patrons from most of the hustle and bustle of the resorts.  Be sure to insist on a table away from the front when making reservations and you'll be golden.

O. M. G! I'm so sad that I can't pack AquaKnox into my suitcase and bring it back to Seattle with me. I absolutely LOVE this restaurant! The BF and I decided to return on our last night in town and had an even better experience than our first visit - something I didn't think was possible. 

When you make reservations ask to sit in Chris Godfrey's section. He is a great server and made our time so much more enjoyable.  We had him the first time (two nights prior), and he remembered us. He wasn't overbearing, but made sure we were taken care of like VIPs. Even the manager recognized us! He arranged for us to get a special appetizer from Sous Chef James, who we later got to meet so we could personally compliment him. He earned it. 

This time around we dined on a crab cocktail, lobster bisque, delicious yellowtail sashimi, salmon for me, prawns for the BF, lobster mash potatoes (you can have them separate from the halibut dish!!!), pomegranate mojitos, and creme br√ªl√©e for dessert. Forget food baby - I had food twins! 

I may come back annually solely to visit this restaurant. Well played Vegas, well played.

Came to this swanky place to get a drink before heading off to the club. Also, used that as an excuse to use the finely decorated bathroom. Sometimes my bladder makes the drinking decisions for me. 

Ordered a rasberry vodka thingy at the bar and, yes, it was pretty good.  Don't take my word for it though. I lost the ability to taste vodka a few months back.

The bartender was friendly and managed to have all the answers to whatever questions we had. As in, "hey, you're closing, you know any restaurants in the Venetian that serve seafood that are open? C'mon, man. We need a lobster fix."

Great seafood restaurant. The oyster appetizer was great, came with some good sauces (Champagne Vinegrette was my fave). The salmon and tuna entrees were a hit as well. 
Nice decor and an extensive wine menu.

This place has phenomenal high quality seafood and offers some of the best service i've received, that goes to say A LOT! My husband brought me here for a birthday once and I was definitely impressed! Give it a try!

I went here on a date with my boyfriend while visiting La Vegas last weekend. I was really extremely happy with the great service. Everyone was very polite and cheerful, although we were probably one of the last parties of the night. 

For appetizer, we shared the clams. THEY WERE THE BEST PART OF DINNER. The clams were cooked just how I like them and the broth it comes in is "to die for". Don't forget to ask for extra bread for the broth, trust me you'll want it. I ordered the barramundi, and I must say that it was cooked to perfection. The potato puree was super smooth and tasted awesome with the light dressing on it. My boyfriend ordered some sort of shrimp dish, and he said that he liked it. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful.

We decided on not ordering dessert because we were too full, but they brought us a complimentary one anyway. They served us "adult milk and cookies". it came with a small fresh baked cookie and a shot glass filled with what I think was a mixture of milk, sugar, cinnamon, and rum. It was super yummy and was just the right sweetness.

All together I believe our bill was just over $90 for the two of us. 

I had a great experience at AquaKnox, but the reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because of the placement of the restaurant. It is placed in an open area where you can hear all the hustle and bustle of the slot machines and night clubs, and the only thing that would have made that dinner absolutely perfect was if the restaurant was more secluded and romantic. Other than that, I have no complaints.

Simply put, one of the best new American seafood restaurants in Vegas today.

Keeping it real, skip the lounge that I have always recommended.  Menu changes no longer make it the place to grab a quick bite.  Opt for the comfortable, contemporary ambiance of the main dining room instead.  While the executive chef has changed, taking with him the best of the best, enough remains and new dishes added that still carry the cuisine.

In general, seafood is very fresh and always perfectly cooked.  Never any albumin on fillets.  No bouncing scallops or shrimp.

Top starters include an outstanding wild blue crab cake (very little filler, dusted in flour and fried crisp served with a chayote slaw and a gently spiced creole remoulade).  Very well balanced dish with great texture, sweetness paired with an acidic punch.  The Maine lobster louie also excellent with just cooked through, firm and sweet lobster with traditional veg (I'm not a bunny but this is good).  A kicked up, creamy 1,000 island dressing and heirloom tomatoes with greater acidity and lower sweetness truly compliment the lobster.

Mains are simple but perfectly executed.  A perfectly pan roasted, moist, Alaskan halibut pairs perfectly with the chili flavor of a piquillo pepper relish.  The fish soup outstanding.  A acidic tomato base, the hint of saffron and perfectly cooked chunks of lobster, firm john dory, tender PEIs, briny clams, and sweet prawns.   A porcini dusted, perfectly cooked moonfish served with a red wine reduction dashi sauce is incredible for it's complexity and depth of flavor.  Mushroom and fish?  It works with the earthiness adding an unexpected umame finish.  Finally, the Georges Bank Scallops with blood orange butter, amazing.  Perfectly seared and cooked just through.  Incredibly sweet.  The blood orange butter adding even more richness and acidity to brighten the dish further.  Yes there are sides but who cares.  The scallops are the focus.

Outstanding service.  Very friendly, efficient, and accommodating.  Some dishes were shared, portions divided and individually plated in the kitchen.  

Very good wine list heavily centered around whites that pair perfectly with their cuisine.  Vegas resort markup.

When it comes to Aquaknox, remember the dieters mantra, "when you see food, eat it!"

We celebrated my wife's 50th birthday tonight at AquaKnox. Service was spectacular. My Mom and Dad ordered the lobster bisque and the crab cakes and we had the same. Flavors were melt in your mouth awesome! For the entree we all had the salmon. Two of us had it blackened. I have to say it was the most flavorful and memorable salmon dish I have ever had. Seasoning was spot on. The salmon was served on top of something called black forbidden rice which was bursting with flavors I can't even put into words. Awesome! They brought out some complimentary cheese appetizers and tuna tartar with wasabi cream sauce which were wonderful. 

For desert we had the bread pudding which was superb. Hot out of the oven with vanilla bean ice cream on the side. They also served us some complimentary champagne which was very nice of them. All in all it was a five star experience. Highly recommended.

I can't review the food because I never made it past the front door lol. The hostess at the stand was completely helpless and once I finally got to speak with the the gm  Mr. Meneffe he was even more worthless. I wish I could of enjoyed my experience since it is a beautiful property. Maybe if they had a better leader my stay could of been more enjoyable.
Ian is amazing!!! Thank you for the great food and drinks. We got the tasting trio and it was very delicious.

WARNING: Beware of the servers.

First, we ordered water. They served us bottled still water when we clearly did NOT order it. And I've always had servers ask still, sparkling, or tap. This server didn't even ask! And they kept refilling our cups without us asking and without letting us know how many bottles we've used so we ended up paying for many bottles of water. So I guess let them know if you want tap water instead of bottled water. I don't mind paying for bottled water if that's what I'm expecting to do but we didn't even know until the bill came.

For appetizers we ordered the Seafood Plateau but it was $79 and serves only TWO people. Granted it does come with a variety of items but our server suggested this appetizer for our group of 8 but failed to mention the price. So $79 times 4 plus our main entrees equals a hefty tip for him. That Bastard. 

But the food alone was delicious and fresh so if the service was better, then I would have given it 4 stars easily. But since they tried to sell us every expensive thing on the menu it deserves only one star. I will never return. I've never experienced this before at any other upscale establishment so I guess that's why I felt so cheated.

But if you do want to eat here then get the ponzu and sake oyster shooters. We had multiple shots.

Everything was amaaaaaazing and high class. 
Expensive but so worth it for the service and food. Everyone is so nice and the atmosphere is relaxed yet classy. Love it

I want to give this 3 1/2 stars. I really think this is a typical seafood restaraunt. I had a halibut dish and it was average. It didn't explode in my mouth, so I can't really rate this place high.

Their service was great though. We had a birthday dinner for a friend and she was surprised with a nice big dessert that all of us shared. The thing I like about this place is it is quiet even though its in the middle of the walkway between Venetian and Palazzo.

Good Friends always can make up for good food. Good conversation can always make good friends, best friends!

Anyone saying the food is not expensive must be part of the 1%.  We grabbed a drink at the bar prior to sitting down for our meal and a Makers Mark on the rocks was $12 (without tip).  That's the only price I'll mention, but figured it was a good indicator for anyone reading this review.

The meal was exquisite ... I'm from North Carolina, and frequent the beaches of NC/SC, so I know good seafood.  Being in Las Vegas, I was hesitant to visit an upscale seafood restaurant, but AquaKnox did not dissapoint.  I started off with a Lobster Bisque and had to do everything to not to pick it up and start licking the bowl.  As for my entree, I had the tuna (rare of course), and it was extremely good.  Because we were jet lagged and technically eating our dinner at 11pm, we were too tired to do dessert, so we called it a night.  

Quick and Dirty Review:

Atmosphere - Unique, but nothing too special (located within the corridor between Palazzo and Venetian hotels).
Food - Delicious ... pricey, but delicious
Service - Good service ... attentive and knowledgeable with the menu based on our appetite.

Summary - Although pricey, it was extremely delicious and worth a date night while on vacation.

We really had a terrific meal along with a great experience! Nick B our waiter, was so knowledgeable about every dish, attentive without being a pain and just a wonderful guy...he truly added to our evening! The food was delicious and prepared to perfection. We will be sure to eat at this restaurant again.

I can only give 2 stars when you have an expectation and the restaurant has poor service and stratospheric, mesospheric prices.  The Capital Grille makes this place look like a healthier, far costlier Long John Silvers.  

The plus (singular) was the lobster cocktail, notwithstanding the shell chips and pervasive claw meat.  

The negatives were after the trade show at 5pm in an empty bar my $7 Heineken took 10 minutes and the cocktail waitress had zero (0) clue what was going on and said "sorry I'm busy", and the place was empty.  For dinner our group of 18 had a head waiter who was cocky and arrogant.  I think he showed only a modicum of respect to who he thought was paying the bill.  The entree portions were really small.  From what I recall the scallop entree my co-worker had was three scallops and he ate them and sarcastically grinned at me.  My $36 fish had to be just 5 ounces, seriously, and due to the size of the group it was not warm on the surface just inside.  I really, REALLY like the Ca√±onita in Venetian and 5-starred after multiple visits, but Aqua-Knox has portion sizes weirder than it's name and our arrogant waiter must be a millionaire doing his job for fun.

Our dinner last night was the best I'd ever had in Vegas!  The Tomahawk steak surf and turf was absolutely delicious!  Our servers, Carlos and Nick, were very accommodating and attentive. Fernando G and his chef ? staff created our fabulous, tasty meal from start to finish.  Then they nailed it with delicious desserts by Mercedes Anna.  Aquanox management could not have topped this high roller, dining experience off with anything other a $1million jackpot!

AquaKnox set the bar for all the restaurants we ate at in the Palazzo/Venetian. My family and I are loyal seafood lovers so we couldn't resist reserving after seeing the reviews, and of course, we like to experience fine dining every once in a while. We at here on our first night in Vegas for the NYE weekend.

It's a very fancy and formal restaurant - it had a similar vibe to Nobu but maybe even higher class. The staff were so precise and made the whole dining experience memorable. They didn't miss a beat.

Food:

Appetizer: Lobster Bisque - best one I've ever had! I thought Mastro's in Malibu was the best but theirs puts Mastro's to shame! It was lighter in creaminess so it didn't overwhelm ones stomach. We also had King Crab legs. I usually would order this even though I love them because of all the work it takes to actually get to the meat, but as it turns out, they already cracked it for us so eating was easy and yummy!

Entree: Lobster, Filet Mignon, Grilled Salmon, Scallops - all very good but the Lobster was the best - duh!

Dessert: they had a special that night and my family split a triple chocolate mousse cake with ice cream. 

The presentation of each dish was very well thought out. I almost didn't want to eat it because it would tarnish it's beauty. In any case, we didn't find another restaurant that was as good as this even though we went to a couple more fine dining places later. AquaKnox is the best of the best in Las Vegas.  Of course, it's also located in the Venetian/Palazzo which has the most amount of award winning chefs in all of Las Vegas so no surprise there. Can't wait to repeat the experience!

Well that was one of the best dinners I've ever eaten. Service was exemplary and ambience was lovely. Had a beautiful dinner with a few friends I hadn't seen in years. We laughed and talked and were given plenty of kind attention by several waitstaff. We were made to feel really welcome and special. Wonderful evening thanks to these lovely employees  compliments to the chef as well!

Very good food. October 2015 was the first time I gave this restaurant a try. It was very well worth it. I can only describe the food as fusion between fresh seafood with a hint of Asian. For example, if you direct you attention to my picture, my crab cake was topped with Apple salad. The apple salad closely resemble to what I had before in Thai restaurant. Kinda weird (but in a delightful way, hence the 4 stars review). Other main dishes were just as tasty. If there is any room for improvement, I would have to say that the sear Foie Gras was tiny bit over cook; otherwise, this restaurant would deserve 5 stars. Oh, by the way, Lobster Bisque is a must!!

My bf and I came here for dinner one night in Vegas. We ordered the Seafood Plateau and Maine lobster bisque to start with. The Seafood plateau was large enough for 4 but its recommended for 2. We were on the full side when we had finished the entire platter. 
For our entrees, I ordered the crab stuffed lobster. My bf ordered the filet mignon and grilled whole fish(this was for the both of us to share). The server had asked us prior to deboning the fish if we would like him to bring the fish back after deboning or if we wouldn't mind him doing it in front of us. I told him to just have at it at at table side. I wanted to watch how it was done. The seafood was very fresh and light. I loved the combo of the crab stuffed lobster. It was very flavorful. No need for drawn butter. The steak was cooked to my bf's specifications. The fish was delightful. It was citrisy and perfectly seasoned. 
You would expect good service since you're paying a good amount for dinner and it didn't disappoint. This is why I love to pay a little extra for food just to get wonderful service. :)

Came here on Saturday night before a show. Overall it was fine but we had expected a bit more. 

Started with drinks..... WOW what high prices!!! $35 for an Oban!!!! $24 for Macallan???  I love Single Malt but that is out of bounds!!! I think whoever set the bar prices had been sampling the wares first.

On to dinner .... I had barramundi and it was very good. Others had scallops, advertised as "phenominal" by the waiter, but they were only good.

And that is kind of just how it went. Fine, not phenominal.  Should you go? Well ..... I wouldn't go out of my way to do that particularly.

This restaurant is very pretentious for what it is.  The ambiance is not commensurate with the prices in the menu. Specially, you can hear music pumping from other parts of hotel and my chair was stained as were parts of the carpet.  Dishes are expensive, which I am okay with if the ambiance, food and service are to par but this was not the case.  The food was good but not amazing. I felt that the waitstaff had an arrogance to them that was off putting. Would not go back.

Great food. Below average staff. 

We came here for the oysters and steak. The food was amazing. We ordered 2 rounds of oysters (loved the Virginia ones) and clams (Virginia as well). Some people had steaks,  fish, and the lobster bisque as entrees. 

The service we received was overall confusing. I still can not distinguish who our server was. It was hard to get someone's attention to grab the bill and also just for a water refill. 

Also whoever cleared the oyster tray from our table spilled the leftover water all over one of the guys at the table and also into his glass of wine so he couldn't even finish it. We didn't even get an apology or something to wipe up the spill. 

For the price we spent for dinner (we were a party of 9 so the bill came to about $700) we received poor service.
Thomas and Mark were our servers, great people! They knew the menu, gave us great recommendations, and took excellent care of us throughout our meal. Great birthday dinner!

Invited to experience the skills of new Executive Chef Deric Meininger by Aquaknox General Manager Robert Menefee it was just after the restaurant's 5:30pm opening on Saturday that four friends sat down in the Forbes 4-Star establishment, and treated to a seven course tasting intended to showcase the newly crafted menu during one of Las Vegas' slowest weekends it is a wonder that the restaurant has flown under my radar for so long.

Owned by a restaurant group but lacking the marquee of much of The Venetian's celebrity chef offerings Aquaknox is the sort of restaurant many may walk past without even giving a second thought, yet much like Bartolotta at the Wynn those lucky enough to take the plunge are rewarded by refined environs, exemplary service, and the sort of seafood not commonly thought of in the middle of the desert, an opening amuse of raw dayboat scallops atop a crispy base both creamy and sweet while a follow-up oyster trio presented three varieties of briny bivalves in manners intended to highlight the best of each - the simple shooter especially impressive with a sweet start giving way to salinity before dissipating in a trail of heat.

Offered a complimentary wine pairing from which three of us opted for very small pours it was with course two of the tasting that the menu first veered from the ocean and spontaneously created to compliment an apricot and pear heavy Riesling a thick slice of liver shined, the caramelized exterior and smooth sapor finding surprising balance in cocoa tones reined in by the vegetal gastrique while crispy brioche and candied nuts added plenty of texture, the sorbet seemingly unnecessary to the plate but well placed when considering the wine.

Visited more than once by Chef Meininger, a quiet man despite recent stays in the kitchens of Gordon Ramsay, course three was the only item of the evening not of his own creation and considered a staple since the restaurant's inception the Aquaknox Fish Soup was every bit the signature it is billed to be, the spicy saffron broth bathing no less than a half-dozen varieties of seafood with pearls of fregula adding additional texture as top notes of pepper permeated the palate without overwhelming at all.

Again showing a deft hand with sea-life, both hearty and delicate, plates four and five featured fish, crustacean, as well as mollusk and with the meaty Wahoo delicately perched atop a rich ragout lightened by fruity chutney the "surf and surf" proved even more inspired as snappy prawns and a buttery scallop were each highlighted by their accoutrements, the former leaning slightly Mediterranean while the later took a more French approach - the finishing vinegar an especially welcomed addition atop the creamy squash base.

Taking a chance in finishing with beef it was with another trio that savories wound up and although the Ribeye proved a bit tougher than any of us would have preferred both the Filet and the Strip were fork tender and nicely seasoned, the flavor imbued by peppers and onions allowing the meat to stand up to the booming Cave Blend served alongside.

Once again intending to showcase the restaurant's best items it was to a triplet of tasters alongside one central plate that we were treated for dessert and with a delicious yet heavy Tawny guiding the way not a single item of the group was less than exemplary, the stunning key lime presentation as light as a cloud while banana cream pie was presented as a sort of Mille-Feuille, the bread pudding trending more like spongecake with rich butterscotch notes flooding the palate in each bite.

Undoubtedly receiving VIP treatment, but witnessing every table around us treated nearly the same, it was after a short tour of the restaurant that our meal would end and with espressos and teas served alongside a duo of sweet n' spicy mignardises it can only be said that Aquaknox more than exceeded expectations - a return visit for some a la carte options, the wood oven lobster, and a full-sized bread pudding inside the temperature controlled wine chamber almost inevitable to occur in the months to come.

Wow this is a wonderful dining experience!! The waiters were so great. The food is magnificent!!!
My husband & I had the Lobster Bisk & the Blue King crab cakes. Perfect. Highly recommend this place for great seafood & a nice quaint dining experience.
Never disappointed at the menu, atmosphere or service. Excellent dining experience after a show. My go to restaurant in Las Vegas.

We had been looking forward to trying this restaurant and it was a bit of a disappointment. The restaurant was not busy and it took 45 mins to get our food. We had a party of ten who all ordered surf and turf and every single steak came out cold and very low quality. The second round of replacement steaks were chewy and dried out. The lobster bisque soup was delicious as well as the salmon! Highly recommend. 

However, the manager and staff were very nice and gave us 4 free desserts to split with the table and comped two of the 9 steaks. 

Stick with the seafood here and I'm sure you will be satisfied!

My second time here with family for dinner during Christmas time and everything were great.  Seafood are very fresh and high quality.  Good customer service.  I would definitely go back again and again next time in Vegas.

Great seafood restaurants are a rarity here in the desert, but I feel like at Aquaknox I've found a gem! 

The atmosphere is very elegant, with a bit of a nautical twist. Each table adorned in white linen, and garnished with blue goblets & wine glasses. My boyfriend & I were celebrating an anniversary that evening, so we were ideally seated in a booth that was intimate, as well as comfortable. 

Service, unquestionably superior. I would expect nothing less from a restaurant of such high stature. Allen, our server- was very accommodating. He executed very wonderful suggestions, that MADE our experience. 

To start out, we got a vase full of long crispy bread sticks & a house smoked salmon dip. Let me tell you that if it weren't socially unacceptable...I would have licked the dish that the salmon dip came in, no problem. Needless to say, it was excellent, & I crave it daily. 

Next up to bat- Crab Cake & Lobster Bisque. Being a previous resident of New England & a connoisseur of food- I feel like a have a very firm palate when it comes to a few things, crab cakes & lobster bisque included. The Crab Cake was incredible, beautifully seasoned & served over a citrus flavored bed of corn relish. As for the Lobster Bisque, it wasn't too creamy- just perfect. It was really comforting & nostalgic to have some good New England food, without the 5 hour long flight. 

Seafood Plateau- Overwhelmingly fresh, standard assortment (oysters, oyster shooters, clams, mussels, lobster, crab claws, prawns). The ponzu oyster shooters...to die for! I was also a big fan of the champagne vinegar sauce that came with the oysters. Also, probably the biggest prawns I have ever seen. Very impressive! 

John Dory was my main course. Excellent suggestion from our server, Allen! Unlike any other fish I have ever had. It was sauteed on one side only, giving it an ambidextrous texture. I loved the crunch from the sauteed side, but the soft side exposed its sweetness, & also gave it a buttery finish. John Dory definitely tasted like fish, which was admirable to say the least. A lot of times, when seafood is over prepared, it loses that oceanic taste. Frankly, I would like my fish to taste like fish. The lobster succotash & sweet corn broth that it was served over was also delightful. It did a great job of complimenting the fish, without overshadowing it, with its bold flavors. 

Now, at this point- being a girl of 5'4"/95 lbs, I'm surprised that I wasn't already stuffed & in a food coma. But, there really is always room for dessert. Apple Tarte Tatin- sweet savory apple chunks, covered in caramel served beside a salted caramel ice cream. I thought the salted caramel ice cream to be very inventive & appropriate!!! Creme Brulee- my one true dessert staple. I enjoyed the vanilla beans that were tucked under the custard, it made for a very yummy last bite. 

Aquaknox was a great success! I look forward to making this our new go-to venue for seafood. The food exceeded my expectations, & the service was right on point.

The food was fantastic. But unfortunately our server was very satisfactory. My family and I went there for Christmas Eve Dinner. It was a party of 10. My biggest pet peeve is discussing whose going to pay for what during dinner so we coordinated before going that we will split the check three ways so there was no confusion. I discretely told the waiter the plan so he knows and for some reason he didn't get it and not only proceeded to be confused Very Loudly that other tables we're turning around to look at us. So embarrassing. I almost felt like he was doing it on purpose. Being very vocal on asking whose paying for what etc. Never again. Although the food was great.. not worth being put on the spot and embarrassed.

This review is for the New Years Eve Prix Fixe dinner. For 150, you expect the meal to be special or at least memorable, this was neither. There were only four courses, two of which were barely warm.  The crabcake was very fresh, but lacked the big chunks of crab that you should see at a nice seafood restaurant. It would have been better if it was hot. The truffled kabocha pumpkin gnocci was the only dish that impressed me. Again, not hot enough. For the entree, I expected to see lobster or crab as one of the options, after all it was New Years Eve in Vegas! Not so, I ended up eating chicken coq au vin, which was moist but I wanted something more gourmet than chicken. Beef was an option but I don't eat it. The dessert would have been good but it contained peanut butter, which I despise. A lot of people have peanut allergies, so I can't believe this was the only option they had.
