And they never even announced that it had peanut butter, they should have noted it on the menu. My gf did the wine pairing, she did not like most of the wines. I would never come here for a holiday prix fixe ever again. The service was friendly, but a little slow considering the place wasn't exactly packed. They took forever to bring the bill and process it.

Great atmosphere and even better food. Had the steamed clams, they are excellent!  The best part is the broth. Ask for extra bread to dip in the broth. Then followed the clams with lobster bisque. Outstanding (probably the best I've ever had). Comes with a little breadstick with lumps of crab meat. For main entree, wife had the salmon, which was very good and I had the crab stuffed lobster. Although it was pricey ($98) it was plenty of food and was really good. We also tried the blue raspberry martini. Also very good. Expect to pay for the great food but if you're reading this review chances are you'll be just fine.

My experience it was okay, maybe I had high expectations, I order some oysters the crab cake the shrimp cocktail, then finish with muscles and the branzino, muscles it was good but it came out kind of cold not the way I like it. The branzino it well seasoning, it was a good for one time trying.
Service good...

Absolutely delightful flavors and service.  We made reservations for a party of 6 during the last evening of Restaurant week.  Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and shown to our own private dining room with a single table for 6.  Immediately, they asked us if the music volume was ok and promptly lowered the volume to accommodate our enthusiastic conversations.  The inner decor was marine life focused with a tranquil and peaceful spa-like vibe, which greatly entertained our party, as one of the ladies is an avid diver.  

The first course consisted of a choice of the following delights: 
1) Lobster Bisque with Maine Lobster, Caviar, Creme Fraiche 
2) Crab Cakes with Marinated Vegetable Relish, Citrus Aioli, Petite Mache 
3) Halloumi & Watermelon with Shishito Peppers, Basalmic Vinegar 
4) Romaine Hearts & Treviso Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese Caesar

I opted for the crab cakes, which were excellent!  The citrus aioli totally made the dish.  I tasted the lobster bisque, which was also delish with delicate, but oh so rich creme fraiche.  The real winner of course #1 took me by surprise; the halloumi & watermelon salad.  Boyfriend ordered it because he is allergia a los mariscos (I know you all remember that phrase from Spanish 101 practice work!)  Back to the story, being the goat cheese-aholic that I am, I would have ordered this dish if I understood what halloumi was.  I will never make that mistake again!  Hailing from the Mediterranean island of Cyprus,  halloumi is a semi-hard, unripened brined cheese made from a mixture of goat and sheep milk, and sometimes also cow milk.  It has a high melting point, and often fried or grilled, with a strong savory bite, with a slightly creamy texture.  Mmmm mmmm gewd!

Before course #2 arrived, the manager spoiled our party with a 3 special treats, which he explained were some of his absolute favorite things on the menu.  
1) Smoked king salmon with pickled vegetables and buttery crunchy toasts  
2) NY littleneck clams with garlic & chili in white wine herb butter 
3) Hollander mussels in chardonnay herb butter broth.  
Honestly, this free little treat might have been the absolute best dishes to grace our table.  We were all politely sharing, but fighting our animal instinct to greedily ravage these dishes and lick the bottom of the bowls clean!

The second course consisted of a choice of the following indulgences:
1) Pacific White Prawns with Pearl Couscous, Lobster Cream, Cherry Tomatoes, Scampi Garlic Butter 
2) Prime Ribcap Steak Frites with Roasted Shallot Red Wine Glaze 
3) Mt. Cook Alpine King Salmon with Vegetable Ragout, Buerre Blanc 
4) Roasted Jidori Chicken - Celeriac Puree, Glazed Baby Carrots, Sauce Ver Jus
The whole party's orders were split between the prawns and the steak.  My only complaint is that I was torn between the salmon and prawns.  Having a less than stellar salmon experience the previous night led me to try the prawns.  All of the steaks were cooked to perfection.

The third course consisted of a choice of these treats:
Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee or Homemade Ice Cream Sundae
I think the entire table ordered and enjoyed the creme brulee, which was as delicious as it was beautiful.

I will be back.  Thank you for an evening of culinary bliss and thoughtful service Aquaknox!

We were in Vegas for the week. I love seafood and all I wanted for my birthday was a nice seafood dinner without the circus or the celebrity chef. Found this place while searching YELP and I'm so glad we did because it was FABULOUS! Everyone from the young woman at the front to the manager wished me a happy birthday and made us so comfortable that it was like being with friends. 

The real gems here were our waiter Jesse and his beautiful wife Tonya who took great care of us. I couldn't decide which dish to get and Jesse made some excellent recommendations! The surf and turf was out of this world. Our appetizers were amazing and my "aquatini" was so good that I drank 3 of them! 

Unfortunately we were so stuffed we ended up taking a lot of leftovers and were trying to figure out what to with them since we were seeing a show and Jesse was so great that he packed up everything and held it in the fridge for us until the show was over. 

To say they made my birthday amazing is putting it lightly. This restaurant had the best food I've ever had and the personal service made it spectacular! 

I would recommend them highly. It wasn't a stuffy environment, which is something I wanted to avoid, but it was still very classy. We had a nice private booth and were treated fabulous!

I planned a dinner for 20, and Valerie was great to work with. She was always prompt with emails and was very accommodating. The dinner turned out nice, and everyone seemed to be pleased. Our server and his team, I wish I remembered his name, was very attentive and welcoming. I will say that I was definitely impressed by the service. 
The food was good as well. I wished that we were able to have access to the full menu, but with a large party, it was not available. Overall, great place!

Wow, they really did a great job.  We had a sommelier, (rare these days) waiter, assistant waiter all of whom were very attentive and did a fantastic job.  We didn't like the first wine we selected, so it was whisked away and replaced with something that we really enjoyed--that's the right way to do it!  Food was absolutely delicious, they started us off with a complimentary crab cake, very tasty.  We ordered poke, burrata salad, and the seafood plateau, all superb!  Everything on the seafood plateau was perfectly fresh and perfectly prepared--that's rare for a big assortment like that.  We really didn't have room for desert, but they brought us a tasty bite of coconut cake that was a great closing touch.  I think I have a new favorite restaurant in Vegas!
Been here a dozen times. Always exceptional service and food!! Absolutely phenomenal.

Let's start with AMAZING! From start to finish the experience at AquaKnox was excellent. Upon arrival we were immediately seated for our 7:30pm reservation which is always a great start to a dining experience for me. Our party of two was warmly greeted by our server who was quick to take drink orders and offer a watermelon amuse-bouch√©. We reviewed the menu and decided on the Pan Seared Halibut with maine lobster corn succotash, corn nage, black truffle, ocean greens and the Grilled White Prawns citrus marinated, shallot-white wine reduction, pearl couscous, heirloom tomatoes, roasted piquillo pepper, capers, arugula, basil, parmesan, lemon butter along with the SAUT√âED BABY SPINACH baby mixed spinach, extra virgin olive oil, garlic as a accompaniment. We cap the dinner off with the Sticky Toffee dessert that wasn't my favorite but after such an amazing meal it really didn't matter. AquaKnox is definitely worth the trip if you're looking for seafood in Vegas.

We had a late dinner here. Between us we had the prawns and the cra cake appetizer for our meal. Both were delicious, but he prawns were to die for! 

Despite having two servers we still waited almost 15 min before having our drink order taken and there was definitely an air of disappointment when we didn't order apps, two entrees and dessert.

Absolutely incredible! It is a four star restaurant that deserves five! The service was impeccable. Our waiters met our every need! We had our 10 month old daughter with us and they welcomed her with open arms and made sure she was well taken care of. The food was outstanding. And they have a great wine list and a full bar! Highly recommended!! A must if you are in Vegas.

We had the Lobster Bisque per the other reviews. It was simply amazing. I am from the east coast of Canada originally so I know good lobster bisque and this was awesome. I also had the lobster infused with crab. That was not bad but not mind blowing. I had an aquatini which was amazing as well and i highly suggest it!

Over all great experience and good place to eat for seafood.
Food was well presented. Very tasty. Romantic atmosphere. We sat in a booth and it was very private. The server was outstanding. He was very personable.

This is our second time at Aquaknox, and our second time ordering their seafood plateau.  Worth the money, and quite filling for two people.  The seafood included in the plateau are crab legs, lobster, 3 types of oysters, clams, oyster shots, and ceviche.  Seafood is fresh, hostesses are accommodating, and overall it's a wonderful dining experience.  Will be returning again next time we stay at Palazzo or Venetian.  Don't forget to charge your bill to your room to accumulate points!

A hopping place (like there is a different type of restaurant in Vegas), the atmosphere was electric, loved the decor and booths that created a nice buffer for the hustle and bustle on restaurant row. 

Wine list is very extensive with some amazing wines - we had a lovely Chardonnay. I expanded my horizons and split the beet and watermelon salad - lovely if you are a fan of both of those. Surf and turf was next on our list - the right choice - our waiter made sure each of our steaks were to our liking (medium rare and medium). Lobster was cut perfectly to ensure you could get all of the meat out. Came with standard sides - mashed potatoes and asparagus. 

The service was fantastic - had two waiters who were very attentive. In typical fashion the manager popped by to say hi and check on our experience. 

Would recommend this to anyone in Vegas looking for great seafood!

Ambiance sucks!  Why these large resorts imsist on playing the same music, too loud, regardless of venue is cheap and tawdry.  No bread, just sticks, is a missed opportunity. Superb service, very good food.
I recently had a couple business meetings here. This place is fantastic, the service is excellent and apps are so tasty!

I had dinner here and had a pretty good time! To start, instead of bread, they bring you these long crackers and a smoked salmon cream cheese dip, which was a really nice way to start the dinner. For appetizers we had a roasted beet, watermelon and blue cheese salad, as well as the smoked fish plate. The salad was really awesome. They key was getting a bit of everything on the fork and opening wide: super delicious. The smoked fish plate was alright, though not as good as the salad, and I ended up being more into the pickled veggies that came with the appetizer than the fish itself.

For entrees, we had the halibut and scallops. The fish was standard good, but the best part of the halibut dish was the marscopone mashed potatoes and tomatoes it came with. Really tasty. Was licking the plate with my fork. The scallops were also pretty good, seared on the outside and buttery on the inside though maybe a tad salty. Once again though, the sauce and accompaniments that came with the scallops were also quite good. We also got a side dish of vegetables, which I highly highly recommend, not just because the veggies taste good, but because you might want to actually eat something.

We got two desserts. The olive oil semolina cake with blue berry compote and orange basil sorbet just wasnt that good: the cake part got totally lost amid the strong flavors of the blueberry and sorbet. I guess its going for something subtle and interesting, but it didnt work. However, the flourless chocolate cake, a warm chocolaty concoction with a cup of caramel was super delicious. Definitely on the sweet side, but it had enough real chocolate and caramel flavor to balance the sweetness. Plus if you dont feel self conscious you can just drink the caramel from the little cup it comes in. Yum yum yum.

The service here is great, very attentive. The decor is also really nice, with some comfortable little booth seats.  Overall, I think we spent about 1.5-2 hours here, and had a good time. 

My only complaint about this place is that the amount of food you get is really really little. Even when it comes to the cheaper sides, like potatoes and tomatoes and veggies. I know Vegas is all about screwing you out of your money, but I feel here it was just too obvious. For example, the "tomatoes" that came with my halibut were 2 or 3 small cherry tomatoes. I would have also appreciated more of the potatoes. And of course the actually piece of halibut was pretty small. So yeah, it's pretty obvious they are holding back on the food to get you to order more. Even the lack of real bread speaks to that. Finally, the prices of course have the 20-30% "vegas strip surcharge", but I chose to ignore that in this review.

This was our second time visiting AquaKnox, we ordered the exact same items as the first time.  It has been one of our best meals on the strip.  I would still count this as a great place for a special dinner, but something was missing on our second visit (so rating 4 instead of 5 stars).  Highlights of the menu are some of the best Crab Cakes I've had, excellent Salmon and Butterscotch Bread Pudding.  The Salmon is cooked on the medium side (so if you want it more, be sure to mention something) and it's the best salmon I've ever had.  This place is huge and practically empty both times we went.  With all the show closures and turnover at Venetian this restaurant may suffer, but certainly worth a special trip even without a show.

Ordered:
Crab Cakes (w/ great spicy ketchup & slaw)
Fig & Goat Cheese Salad
Lobster Bisque
Corn Succotash
King Salmon
Butterscotch Bread Pudding 

Overall: Great seafood restaurant on the strip.  Worth a special trip.  They are a little inconsistent but worth a visit.  The pictures will speak for themselves.
The best shrimp and grits ever! The service and food were amazing. I will definitely be visiting every time I go to Vegas.

As the No1DP was staying at the Palazzo he passed by this restaurant a few times on his walk around the Venetian/Palazzo area and suggested this place as a possible dinner option. As we had wine as part of a "happy hour event" through the conference No1DP was attending, we talked to one of the line cooks about their menu and observed their open kitchen. Out of all the places we went to happy hour, this place impressed me enough to come back for dinner, so the No1DP promptly made dinner reservations later that night.

CONCEPT/VENUE: The Venetian/Palazzo's fine dining option with an emphasis on "global water cuisine". Fancy schmancy way of saying upscale seafood. 

At the entrance to the restaurant there is a water-encased walk-in wine cellar. We both thought that this would be a perfect way to showcase their premium wines as the wines themselves were "hidden in plain sight" by the waterfalls and enticing potential customers to come inside. As we went inside No1DP wondered how much it would take to eat inside the wine cellar as there was a table that could seat two. 

No1DP and I were placed in the booth area where other couples were present. The booths provide a place to people-watch other diners in the tables while having a little area to ourselves. It was also easy for bussers and waiters to pass by without saying anything.
 
SERVICE: Overall so-so. Service was good that silverware was replaced when a new dish was about to come out and that when you left your table, your napkin was remade for you. They were also quick to refill your wine glasses. The wait time between ordering our food and when the food actually came out was at least 20 minutes, and when the food finally came they gave No1DP the wrong dish, the Pacific Blue Prawns. We took a bite out of the prawns and thought it was good until No1DP realized that he ordered halibut. It took time to make another halibut and gave him a small salad for compensation as I ate my dish. No1DP liked his salad and the dressing. 

FOOD/DRINK
Wine was a low-oak Chardonnay, which was chosen because our dishes consisted of fish with hearty sauces. 

Amuse was a very small "tuna salad" of sorts with a mushroom on outside. Mushroom was firm and tuna was lightly seasoned.

Appetizer was a wild blue crab cake ($18): Chayote slaw, creole remoulade sauce. Crab cake was done perfectly as the crab fell apart after slicing it. Remoulade gave the crab a bit of spice and the vegetable medley on top sweetened the dish. 

My dish was a New Zealand john dory ($45): Lobster succotash, okra, wild mushrooms, sweet corn nage, black truffle. One of AquaKnox's signature dishes. The fish was soft, buttery and could easily be separated with a fork. Sauce was also delicious and went with the dish, made the fish a little more nutty. Sauce was heavy but not too heavy in that I could finish my dish. 

No1DP's real dish was a wild Alaskan halibut ($44): Lobster mashed potatoes, broccolini, piquillo pepper relish. I'm used to softer halibut and was a little disappointed in the texture, especially since I started realizing that I prefer fish with soft textures. No1DP did enjoy his fish as he's used to this type of texture for halibut and thought the sauce was delicious as well. 

Aside from the spotty service the No1DP and I enjoyed our experience here and I would recommend this place for fine dining/seafood if you want to stay in the Venetian area for dinner.

Crab cakes, fresh clams on the half shell & white wine braised clams, giant prawns, tuna tartar paired with a Malbec Argentinian red wine - all child's play leading to this surf & turf lobster tail & med-rare filet mignon. I'm being treated well! The night topped off with a flourless chocolate cake plus caramel drizzle & espresso chaser. How sweet it is! Of course I didn't pay for the meal so it's easy to give the place 5 stars.

I wasn't expecting this to be one of the best meals I had in Vegas. The food was amazing. They understand the concept of a perfect bite. I have never had scallops cooked so perfectly. The food was only matched by the service. From the moment I sat down at the table to when I finally left, it was an incredible dinner. The sommelier was able to recommend a perfect wine for the meal. Both my water and wine glasses were refilled promptly. I look forward to eating at AquaKnox again.

There is a lot of good fish served at Aquaknox.  I have eaten here probably 6-8 times (can't remember) and I've had many things.

Two things:
-The menu hasn't changed much in the past three years.
-Even the specials are the same (surf (filet or strip) and turf)

The food is really good here and the service is excellent.  But, really, there is one thing here that you have to get and get it no matter how many times you get it.  

Sweet shrimp & crab salad!  Let me say it again....

SWEET SHRIMP & CRAB SALAD!  

I've asked the servers what their dressing is and I couldn't quite get it out of him.  Nonetheless I'm going to try to replicate.  Its a misture of sesame oil, olive oil and a blend of citrus fruits (lime, lemon??).  

The prices aren't cheap.  That salad is 18 dollars.  Pretty high up there.  I've talked to others and some think they could charge 25-28 dollars for that salad and they would still buy it.  Most of the main courses are in the 30+ range.  Your bill can run up fast.  

Enjoy, and just get the salad.  You can thank me later.

Nice experience.  Very good all around, however would not say excellent.  Service was a bit slow.  We were sitting at least 10 minutes before anyone said boo to us.  Once server came, she was excellent, although still a bit slow.

Another issue I had was the menu.  We reviewed the current menu online, as we always do, however was quite disappointed to discover the online menu was not current, and many items listed online were not available.

That said, cocktails, appetizer, entrees and desserts were all excellent   We would recomnmend, and we would also return.

Amazing.

The appetizers were great. The wine we ordered (with help from our waiter) was amazing and complimented our meals (surf and turf) extremely well. The steak was cooked perfectly. The desserts were amazing.

The ambiance is nice, and when you first walk up it's really pretty having the wine bottles being cascaded by water.

It's pricey, but extremely worth it.

I would recommend the lobster and the John Dory. I always love the amuse bouche that is presented, and the different sauces that are offered with the oysters. I don't like the fact that if you bring your own bottle of champagne they put it in the back for you at all times, don't offer you a chiller for it. I was allowed a bottle of Crystal and I assumed it would be placed in a bucket of ice beside my table at the time of my meal like I have seen with the one that are placed on an ice bucket with a holder next to the table. My bottle of Crystal was kept in the back, and it pissed me off when I told the waiter you should try this vintage, it's awesome. He told me I already tried some of yours in the back. I was really pissed, but dinner was comp'd because I gamble a lot. The food is well presented and the quality is of the highest. On one occasion when I was having clams, I got a mouth full of sand and it was disgusting.

We had my gfs birthday dinner here before heading out to LAVO .

I ordered this whole fish and boy it was the BEST out of all the dishes we had that night. It just melted in my mouth like BUTTAH!!! It was superb that all my other friends wanted to eat more of my dish!
HEY! Its mine.....

We also ordered fresh oysters and 2 bottles of wine that I can remember.
Anyway, it was a wonderful dinner and a GREAT WAY to start our all girls night out!

Will definitely come back for the whole fish again and again.. and AGAIN!

I love this bar/restaurant.  It has a supercool aqua motif, and I love the bartender here--she is my favorite!  This place has a great raw bar.  I love the oysters here, and the atomic sized prawns  I had a spicy seafood pasta with arrabiata sauce.  It was truly wonderful, spicy, but not overhwhelming.  I cannot wait to go back and visit my favorite bartender!

Went here diring restaurant week.

Ordered the orawns with risotto and the steak cap with mased potatoes. The steak was so so. The prawns were phenomenal. 

They brought out a crab cake on the house.  It was so good. Lobster bisque was tasty. For dessert we had bread pudding.  The presentation was awesome. It again was awesome. 

The show stealer was absinthe. The cart they bring it out on and the whole process was cool. I would recommend this restaurant to a seafood lover or someone who is into trying new drinks.

If you are in Las Vegas and not dining at AquaKNOX you are missing out. Everything from the first greeting to the digestive at the end of the meal is top notch! Being from Texas I cut my teeth on beef and I have to say that the steaks here are the best I have ever eaten. Perfectly prepared and seasoned 21 day dry aged perfection. We started with king crab and I had the surf and turf while my dearest had the seabass so perfectly cooked and served with a sauce so delicate and flavorful it was heaven. The sauce complimented the fish without overpowering it as is the case so often when a mild fish is served with a sauce. The service was perfect. From the gentleman who seated us to the person who cleared our plates everyone was friendly and engaged yet not overly hovering. We wanted for nothing. The recommended wine was also perfect. A lovely Napa Pino Noir -Cherry Pie. We were stuffed by the end of the meal but could not pass on the Butterscotch Bread Pudding... OMG what a perfect desert! Tiny lemon tart and raspberry tea as a digestive at the end of the meal compliments of the chef put the finishing touch on what was the finest meal of my life. Thank you to all at AquaKNOX! We will return!

The food was absolutely delicious and the service was great and hilarious. I came here with a party of 12 or so. I recommend the seafood platter app and the lobster. We noticed that every time someone would get up, the waiters would replace their napkin and fold it up all fancy. It got to the point where, just to be obnoxious, we would get up and down and up and down. I think we had almost as many waiters as people in our party.
Service is impeccable. Laid back and classy at the same time. Fantastic oysters from B.C.  crab legs were Huge!!  Well worth the visit

if you're looking for some of the BEST seafood in Las Vegas, look no further.  From the surprisingly complex Amuse Bouche of Mushroom & Mango Ceviche and the Alaskan King Crab appetizer to the first-class service by Jesse and Tonya, the night couldn't have been better.
I grew up in Alaska, so my standards for crab are high and the chef exceeded my expectations. I had the halibut, which in other less deft hands can be overcooked, but in this case, it was perfectly seasoned and mouth-watering. My friends, both who live far, far away from oceans, had the prawns and scallops and couldn't stop saying how it was the best seafood they had enjoyed in years.
I'd highly recommend the lobster mashed potatoes with thick, moist succulent chunks of lobster that doesn't overpower the potatoes.
I'd highly recommend this restaurant, especially if you can get a booth, which the manager Min made possible for us. In other restaurants it can be difficult to hear yourself think, but here at Aquaknox, you can relax, enjoy a great bottle of wine from their excellent selection, consult with a knowledgeable and helpful sommelier and celebrate the good life.

Ate here for the 4th time recently and had as good a meal as I can remember.  My wife had the crab stuffed lobster, highly recommend this dish.  I had the seafood soup, very, very, good.  Started with a dozen oysters which were obviously extremely fresh.  Sat at the bar as usual.  Good martinis.  I will dine here again.

Absolutely loved Aquaknox for appetizers and drinks with colleagues!  Fantastic setup with a definite ocean vibe without that stinky fish smell.  I happened to be there between 4pm and 7pm, when drinks containing Absolut vodka (among other possibilities) were buy one, get one.  So I scored two $13.00 martinis for the price of one!  Heaven!  What a steal in Las Vegas!  After the first martini, I realized I needed a snack in order to stand up without falling over.  My boyfriend and I decided to split the Seafood Trio.  Yum!  Truly this is one of the tastiest dishes I've *ever* had!  It was lump crab cake, sweet lobster and cocktail shrimp.  OMG!  It's something to dream about!  Service was great; prices were fair.  I didn't sit in the main dining area or sample from that menu.

I can't remember the last time I had a steak that was precisely, perfectly cooked to MY liking (medium) and my husbands liking (rare) perfectly - the chef Cooked it perfectly! The sashimi was fresh, the wine was served with great knowledge, and the atmosphere was welcoming and romantic. Well done.

AquaKnox is located inside the Venetian/Palazzo property. 

I've dined here twice- one intimate dinner, and one business dinner. This restaurant has the right seating and atmosphere for casual, romantic, and business meals. Different parts of the restaurant have different vibes and they seat you accordingly if you put in a note/request while reserving your table. Service is always super. 

Though everything I've tried here tastes amazing, there is one dish I recommend 1000% to everyone!! I just tasted it, and I literally think about this meal often and cant wait to have it again- it was that good!! 

AquaKnox Fish Soup - $53.00 (Jan 2017)
Description: Mediterranean tomato-saffron broth, pernod, maine lobster, mussels, clams, prawns, sardinian couscous.

I know it sounds like a hodge podge of all the seafood they could find... but don't worry. Its a bowl of pure amazingness served with a little crostini which was also crazy delicious. Go try it and tell me how much you love it ;)

Their drinks are also memorable. Can't wait to dine here again.

Excellent place for seafood!!! Wife and I came here on a last minute decision at 7:30pm. Called in for reservations just in case and they said they would be able to seat us right away. Awesome! We got a nice private booth which made it seem like it was all planned. 

Wait staff were extremely polite and attentive. Chris was our main server and he also had a back up server to help. We started with steamed clams and seared foie gras. The broth for the clams was amazing and wanted to drink it straight. Foie gras was also delicious and on point. For our main dish my wife had a half crab stuffed lobster and King crab legs, and I had the Peruvian seabass. Nothing disappointed us at all and definitely hit the spot.

This was probably our best meal of the trip for the 3 days we were there. Would highly recommend if you like seafood.

Went on a Thursday night at 7:30PM and it was almost empty. Food was delicious. I had seared tuna and two friends had lobster and surf/turf. All enjoyed it. Excellent service. Bottom line, meal was good, but very overpriced.

This place was awesome.  I was meeting a friend of the family whom I have not seen in 42 years.  We had reservations at 530pm.  We were seated quite fast to our table and were greeted by Hillary (man) and Norman.  They waited on us like there was no tomorrow.  Since I don't eat fish.  I ordered the rib eye steak, shrimp cocktail, a glass of red wine and flourless chocolate cake.  He ordered that same, except he had crab for the appetizer. It was the first time I ever ate crab meat.   It was specatular..  I thought this restaurant was in the Palazzo; but I see here it says Venetian.   The total bill was $247.  So it is a bit pricey; but well worth it.!!! I highly recommend it. The ambience was great and it quickly filled up.  I looked up and saw the almost every table was taken.  Thank you AquaKnox.!!  Susie

Not very impressed.

My family and I came to Las Vegas for my dad's 50th birthday. We originally had a dinner planned somewhere else but due to some people bailing we had to find somewhere else. A friend had recommended this restaurant. The staff was very polite and and sat us promptly. The menu was explained well and we were told of the nights specials. It wasn't until after we received our first round of drinks and appetizer that everything started to go downhill. The portion size is what I had expected and tasted really good but the service went right in the toilet. After our appetizer arrived my dad asked for a mexicana coffee. It took half an hour for that to arrive and nobody came back in between that time to ask anyone if they wanted drinks. When the waiter finally came back with the mexicana coffee he placed it in front of me,  not my dad. 15 minutes later we flagged him down to place another drink order. I asked for a mohito and my aunt asked for wine. The waiter took orders from half the table and took off without asking anyone else. He came back with two sangrias to which we told him we never ordered. The other end of the table never got a chance to order and actually had to walk across the hall to another store to get some wine and my mohito never showed up. Myself, my dad and my cousin's steak was not cooked how we asked for it. My cousin asked for well done to which he received charbroiled outside and red inside. I asked for medium rare and got rare. My dad asked for medium and got medium rare to rare. Throughout the night we had 4 different waiters serve us. Our collective overall experience was not good. I will not go here again nor will I recommend it to anyone else.

I've been coming to a convention here twice a year for at least 15 years and this is my first time eating at AquaKnox. I took a customer here for dinner and it was top notch all the way. Our server was Zack and he did an amazing job explaining the menu, making suggestions and just making sure we were well taken care of.

We started with the 1 pound appetizer of king crab legs- warm with drawn butter. They were delicious albeit a bit pricey at $72.  I had the scallops which were perfectly prepared served over creamed corn and a cauliflower pur√©e. My client had filet mignon which she said was delicious.

We skipped dessert but we were brought a complementary amuse bouche of tuna (prior to our meal) and then a nice after dinner tasting of a pistachio tasting cocktail and a tiny pistachio flavored layer cake with custard.

Very pricy, classy place.  If you've got a client or date to impress, come to AquaKnox but be prepared to drop about $150 per person with a bottle of wine or about $100 without.

Diane and I very recently enjoyed a very nice first dinner at AquaKnox.  The atmosphere here is modern and refined; service was very good; and the food sublime.  We also found the waitstaff and kitchen to be very accommodating to special requests.  In our case French Fries were substituted for Butternut Puree, Mushroom, and Brussels Sprouts.  

For another starter following on the heels of a tasty amuse bouche of Chicken Salad with Piquillo Peppers on Focaccia, Pacific Prawns with horseradish-based Atomic Cocktail Sauce served on the side packed a cold, meaty, and spicy payload.  And a difficult to find King Crab Louie salad with shaved vegetables, Heirloom Tomatoes, Baby Iceberg Heart, and Green Goddess Dressing added to the cool gustatory vibe before the mains were brought to our table.  

Then we dined on excellent moist Roasted Welsh Seabass with Fingerling Potatoes and squash, and large New Bedford Scallops with hand-cut Kennebuck Fries.  Although we didn't order any dessert, we were each treated to a sweet Chocolate Hazelnut confection at meal's end.  

This is a place that takes pleasing its diners seriously.  Our server was solicitous of our needs, and I observed well-focused chefs working frenetically in the kitchen to quickly and correctly complete orders.   

For me, when craving fine fish, a return trip is quite likely!

I attended a work function here with 9 people in a semi private room.  The room was perfect!  Service was splendid!  We had a waiter and an assistant so pretty quick service.

I highly recommend the Alaskan King Crab Legs and the Surf n Turf with the ribeye!!

Quite a few of the steaks had to be returned due to being very undercooked but other then that, it was amazing!!  No complaints from me!

Everyone raves about the Lobster Bisque - it was good but not as good as the Crab Bisque from Tommy Bahamas.

Amazing food and service. Filet mignon was great! Crab cakes were hearty, large amounts of king crab. Fav was lobster bisque soup! Vegans must try! Anniversary dinner, created nicely and champagne to start! Excellent service!

This place deserves all five stars!  I'd call it a fresh water experience.  Wear your nice clothes here because this place deserves it!    They'll start with an Amuse bouche, then tasty bread sticks with salmon mousse - fabulous flavor.   Seafood appetizer (shrimp/crab/lobster) delicious! 
Calamari salad - friscee with a light panko calamari and dressing that was like a cake topper!
Chicken - I know at a place that does fish right -  but they know their chicken.  Hands down one of the best chicken dishes.  Crispy outside and juicy inside sitting on an artichoke/potato mash and a lemon butter sauce that I'm still dreaming about.
Scallops - cooked perfectly!
Salmon with the bacon, chard and chive sauce you will not be disappointed.
Roasted asparagus was a nice touch.  
Chocolate cake perfect ending -- except then they brought us carrot cake.  Frosting tasted like butter, only better.   
Service was exceptional.
Located in the Venetian Hotel.  A calming atmosphere and a place where you can actually talk and listen without over powering music.   If you have a party of 6 or under, try to reserve the circular wine room.  A good time to be had by all!

Seriously good food and great service. Top-notch.

I was here for LV restaurant week with a large dinner party, and what impressed us the most about our experience here was the service and excellent timing of everything. We were here for a leisurely and elegant meal, which we definitely received. The servers were accommodating, friendly and knowledgable!

I ordered the prix-fix 3-course meal which included:
1. Little Bite - Fried Risotto (tiny and crispy, but lite on the flavor)
2. Appetizer - Peach Caprese (delicious with a great blend of flavors...if only there was a little more avocado!)
3. Palate cleanser - Oyster! Free! (while I don't like oysters, the fact that it came with the meal was a pleasant surprise!)
4. Main - Prime Rib Cap Steak (cooked well, yummy onion rings, not the best steak ever, but well prepared)
5. Dessert - Belgium Choc Smores (MEHHHH, I was not a fan, but many of my fellow diners loved it)

Overall, I was impressed with the food, decor, and above all else, the service.

If you're walking in for just drinks you should know that they're good but really overpriced! Especially the water ($7.5 for a bottle!)
The service was ok, although it took the waiter a long time to bring us the check.

I can't resist good seafood. No matter the price. 

I have to give 5 stars for the ambience in this place. I just like the cool vibe and layout of the restaurant. The food gets a 3 1/2. Not the best seafood I've ever had, but still pretty good, despite the high pricetag.

Our service was good and I really enjoyed the bread. I'm a sucker for carbs. If you get that right, I'm halfway to being sold on your restaurant.

Definitely interested giving this place another try.

i've eaten here a few times but never remember to review it... it's good, nothing like blow your mind good, but good.

lobster bisque nice and creamy i think it is a tad undersalted tho. 

mixed green salad with champagne vinaigrette. nice and light.  mmmm.. yum

grilled brie and tomato sandwich yummy however paired with the fries it gets a little too greasy of a meal

steak and lobster also a yum.

seafood tower thingy sooo tasty. the food is fresh

5 course dinner with wine paring for my birthday? Umm, yes please!

My birthday dinner here was wonderful and I left wonderfully full.  The service here was excellent.  Everyone who came to our table, be it to clear a dish or place a new one, greeted us with eye contact and ensured we enjoyed ourselves.  The sommelier was very knowledgeable and took time to explain aspects about the wine to us when we were unsure.

Some standouts from out from dinner were: 
-the oyster shooter, alcohol? yes. oysters? yes. together? double yes.
-heirloom tomato panzanella, it was drenched in vinaigretty (is that a word?) deliciousness
-seared yellow fin tuna, the fennel pollen gave it a nice earthy taste while to balance the subtle fishiness
-John Dory, just wonderful, it had a beautiful golden sear on the outside that tastes as wonderful as it looked

They have fresh seafood flown in daily.  The John Dory is their signature fish and it didn't disappoint.  It was a wonderful, elegant, seafood experience, albeit pricey.

Date night seal of approval!
